Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: Vik K
Reviews.Content: It's beautiful property.They gave us 4th floor partial ocean view room. We really enjoyed breakfast on poolside. I will definitely go back to Key west and stay at Hyatt Key West

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: stellar2222
Reviews.Content: Very happy with our stay at the Hyatt. Excellent staff, beautiful room, superb location. Right on the water, and a quick walk to everything that is happening in Key West. The on-site restaurant, Shor, was outstanding for an outdoor dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Hyatt Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: Badgerman1998
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Key West and are looking for a higher end hotel, the Hyatt Resort and Spa will serve your needs nicely. Nightly price is a bit high for what I would consider smaller rooms but the appointments and larger bathrooms do a fine job of making up for the room size limitations. The staff absolutely go out of their way to take care of you and often remember your name after meeting you just once. Due to the Hyatt’s location on Key West they are quite limited to actual beach space so they have added some nice make-shift beach areas next to the pool that face the ocean. Certainly served our needs just fine. The hotel manager found out that we got engaged while in Key West and had champagne and strawberries waiting for us in our room when we returned from dinner the second night. In addition he stopped by and said hello on multiple occasions when we were sitting on the beach and even bought us a few drinks. The property is extremely well cared for and very clean. Additionally, the Hyatt is close to the action at Mallory Square but not too close, so you get all the benefit without the noise. It is also a short walk to Duval Street. Parking was a bit tight at times but not a major dilemma. We only went to the hotel restaurant for breakfast, the food was very well prepared, the prices perhaps a little high but reasonable for hotel restaurants and the outdoor seating on the ocean well worth it. Service was very good. Don’t be afraid to make requests of the staff, even if they are unable to accommodate you, you can be sure they will make every effort.

Reviews.Title: “I used to work there”
Reviews.Author: Ania J
Reviews.Content: The hotel consist of three buildings, just by the water and almost in the middle of the center. People love to have their weddings there! A few steps from the port, great restaurants, clubs,pubs etc. The sunset will take your breath away!!! But on the other side, there is only tiny public beach, so if you really want to enjoy some time by the water, you have to go on the other side of the island.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Overall Good Service and Facilities”
Reviews.Author: FamMan2011
Reviews.Content: Just spent 5 nights at the Hyatt Key West. Location is great - about 2 blocks from Duval Street and walking distance from everything in Key West. Reception Desk Staff (particularly 1st shift) was very friendly and hospitable. Concierge Staff very good with Restaurant recommendations and reservations. Buy 4 and get the 5th night free promotion was a bonus. Room product is well maintained and overall well appointed. Bathroom nicely done with good shower and good space. Only major area of disappointment was gift shop / excursion assistance. Very apparent that gift shop attendant did not know, nor seemed to care about the different excursions.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, but not good enough for price”
Reviews.Author: Whoppe2001
Reviews.Content: We just came from a three night stay at the Hyatt Key West. The check in process was good, the bellboy and the staff was very helpful and nice to us. We were escorted up to our room which was seemingly quite newly renovated. The room was quite okay and we did not really spot anything wrong with it at first. We did however come upon two issues with the room: 1) Aircon was loud 2) The bed overhead fan was downright scary. As we started it, we found it was wiggling and we were actually convinced it would fall down so we had to stop it. This is obviously not good :) The location as many has mentioned is awesome. The pools were nice enough as well. The restaurant we found to be inconsistent. The fish sliders were awesome, however the grilled calamari was quite oily and very very tasteless. We ate at the restaurant the next morning as well and the buttermilk pancake they use under the lobster egg benedict was so bitter we could not actually eat it. Service was acceptable, but not really up to par for the pricing of the room (which was at about 500 usd/night++). I would say if you come from a Hyatt Regency like the one in Miami or Orlando this hotel is a good step up in the right direction. But, coming from great stays like we've had in Park Hyatt Tokyo or Park Hyatt Chicago this is a serious step down and not even close to matching it. For the pricing of the hotel, it should in my opinion match up to what Park Hyatt offers.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!!”
Reviews.Author: Phillybilly
Reviews.Content: That's what the realtors say and Hyatt Key West Resort is in the best location. A one minute walk to the foot of Duval St, a minute walk in the other direction to the docks, a two minute walk to Mallory Square. The place was spotless. The rooms were nicely laid out and had a very nice and spacious bathroom. We had an upper floor in building 3 on the Simonton St side. Beautiful view of the gulf from our balcony. Balcony fit 2 nicely, 3 if you had to. Nice pool area (with bar) with a separate jaccuzzi next to it. They have their own little private beach (wear water shoes, a little rocky). We rented a tandem bicycle (from Eaton St Bike Shop) for our stay and locked it up at night at the bike stands adjacent to the valet parking area. We noticed cruise ships parked in front of the Westin on quite a few days and I know that wouldn't be what I'd care to look at when gazing toward the gulf. As other reviewers noted there were a few homeless folks on the public beach across the street at various times of the day but they seemed pretty harmless. If that bothers you then 'don't look down', so to speak. We honestly can't think of anything we didn't like about this place. We're now planning on when we can return.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful View and Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: ficklered
Reviews.Content: We were greeted with champagne and a happy, helpful staff! Our room wasn't quite ready at 1:00, so we had an amazing lunch at Shor Restaurant on property. By the time we were finished and looked at their turtles, our room was ready. We were also granted a late check-out to accomodate our plans of diving the next morning. Our room had the most amazing view of the water and everything was clean and perfect. They also held our luggage so we could explore Key West without dragging it around. Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location to duval street but not a true Hyatt resort”
Reviews.Author: TiataniumCups
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt for four days on a trip for pleasure. It is more like a small hotel than resort. The doormen/valet greeters are very friendly and helpful. Once entering the hotel lobby you notice two large poles rather than a front desk to greet you. The area is small and awkward. You need to look around the pole to find the desk where the staff are seated behind a desk. I thought this was a strange setup. The front desk people were very nice and helpful. The room was modern and spacious. It was updated with a nice bath. However the bathroom door did not have a lock. It was also a sliding foot that I did find difficult to keep closed. It was a gorgeous bath other than those two concerns. Service at the restaurant was very very slow. Almost two hours one day for lunch. Friendly staff again but poor systems. Spa was decent. However it is in two converted rooms overlooking parking lot. Concierge services were fantastic and knowledgable. A nice hotel but will consider trying something else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay!”
Reviews.Author: OregonToots
Reviews.Content: The most comfy bed YET! Close to everything, very friendly, helpful staff. High end extras in room. Highly recommended indeed!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Stay”
Reviews.Author: Travelgirl2207
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Hyatt Hotel in Key West. I will start from the beginning, check in was smooth and easy and the glass of Champagne was just a nice start. Our room in building 2 was very spacious, clean, modern and we had a lovely view of the ocean. The pool is small but so is the hotel so it was just the right size, poolside service was just fantastic we never had to wait for a drink. We are both travel agents and stay in a lot of hotels and are quite critical but i have no complaints at all. The location is perfect just a short walk from the hustle and bustle of Duval street. I would definitely stay here again and i have no hesitation in recommending it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: rkvaus
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt in mid Jan. Not sure that some of these reviewers were at the same Hyatt, because our experience was different. First we arrived about 1pm expecting that maybe they would have a room cleaned and available. No. They took my cell number and said they would call when the room was available. Well no call. I finally called about 5pm and they said oh yes your room is ready. The room was average for a motel, but much less than you would find say at a Residence Inn for the price. One smallish room, with 2 queen beds which pretty much left little other space. There was a small balcony that could barely fit 2 people if you were real careful. BTW this balcony overlooked a beach area used by the KW wino community which did add some local color. There is more I could say, but will say that the location is good and about one block to the north end of Duval; and there is a small beach with view of the Gulf. Basically if you want to pay alot for an average room, this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff.”
Reviews.Author: Alicia1015
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hyatt at the end of January and were very pleased with the resort, staff and restaurant. We were upgraded to a king suite with ocean view and it was really nice. The room was huge and bed was very comfortable. There were also two balconies which were nice for relaxing. We had breakfast at the hotel and the mango, cream cheese stuffed french toast was AMAZING! The pool area was clean and they also had nice lounge decks on overlooking the ocean. All staff was very accommodating and friendly. The room was $350 for the night but based on location and quality I would pay this again. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A solid 10”
Reviews.Author: endonurse
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful resort. The rooms are beautifully decorated with large living areas. The pool is heated and has a wonderful hot tub. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location, great service”
Reviews.Author: Anne327
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 nights at the Hyatt last week. On arrival we were greeted with a glass of champagne by the very friendly front desk staff. They were able to accommodate our request for a high floor, even though the hotel was full. Throughout our stay we found all the staff to be extremely friendly, courteous and helpful. Our room was on the 3rd floor of building 3 at the back of the building. In spite of being on the end farthest from the ocean, we still had a very good ocean view (see picture). We could also see parts of the town and cruise ships coming and going in the distance, which was fun. Immediately below our balcony was a parking lot leading to a small public beach. As mentioned by some other reviewers, the beach was occupied by a handful of homeless people, which may bother some guests. The only other issue with our room location was a dumpster in the parking lot below which was very noisily emptied early in the mornings by a large truck - once at 4:15am ! Other than that, this was probably the quietest hotel room I've ever stayed in. The hotel was busy but we never heard a sound from other rooms or the hallway. One thing we noticed about building 3 was that the expensive ocean front rooms had very poorly designed balconies right beside the public stairs - no privacy at all. The room itself was spacious, bright, well furnished and comfortable, with a nice sitting area and a smallish balcony. The bathroom was modern, clean, and had adequate space for all our toiletries. The large glass walled rain shower was great. We did find the housekeeping service to be later than we prefer - on several days they hadn't arrived by 3pm so we ended up not getting the room cleaned those days. The common areas of the hotel were very nice, and we thought the pool area was lovely - it's quite small and surrounded on 3 sides by the hotel buildings, which limits the sun, but also helps block the wind - which was pretty strong during our stay. We did take issue with other guests saving chairs at the pool. There were only a small number of chairs that got morning sun, and every day people put towels/personal items on these, then went off to breakfast, shopping, etc., often for several hours. I know this is a common (although rude) practice in other places, but the hotel should address it more assertively than with the small sign that wasn't even in the pool area. We saw many people disappointed that they were forced to sit in the less desirable areas while the best spots sat empty for hours. The location of the hotel was great for us. We liked that it was away from the crowds of Mallory Square, but only a 5 minute walk if we wanted to go there. There are a huge number of restaurants and bars within short walking distance. We enjoyed the Duval St. area, but also really liked the scenery and restaurants in the marina right beside the hotel. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would return if back in KW.

Reviews.Title: “No detail untouched!”
Reviews.Author: 54321dogsmom2
Reviews.Content: We recently spent two nights at the Hyatt Key West Resort & Spa where we were pleasantly surprised at every turn. We arrived around noon-time expecting to be told that we'd need to return for check in at a later hour; however, our room was ready and we were checked into the property effortlessly. Additionally in the welcome area, we were offered champagne which we momentarily declined but returned after lunch to take advantage of. Carl, the bellman, gave us a tour of the property on the way to our room. The fitness center is open 24 x 7, the concierge had extended hours, the pool area had wonderfully comfortable chaise lounges with pillows and the hot tub was large enough to accommodate several people without feeling cramped. Upon entry to our room, we encountered a hint of aromatherapy which was refreshing. The small balcony had a partial oceanview and the bathroom had plenty of counter space for our toiletries. The provided shower get, shampoo, conditioner & lotion were also scented in the same aromatherapy as we encountered upon entry to the room...ahhh! The room also contained a dorm-size refrigerator and two complimentary bottles of water which were replenished daily. The resort fee covers free parking and in-room internet access. I was pleasantly surprised at the speed of the internet connection. We contacted the front desk for extra coffee packets for the coffee maker in the room & these were delivered promptly. Upon check out, I also asked if they had a chilled bottle of water which I could take with me & they provided one immediately. I will certainly stay at this property again if I have the chance!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not worth the cost”
Reviews.Author: businessandpleasure1
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at many great Hyatts and are surprised that this hotel is even called a Hyatt. I think it caters to their vacation club owners and not the traveler. When we opened our windows and saw the pool area and beach, we thought it was great. Then it turned out that we were looking at the resort next door. The Hyatt pool was very small and their "beach" was about five feet wide and full of rocks. The fitness center is one of the smallest I've seen.. Some of the husband and wives that are club owners come every morning and stay for an hour on the equipment. No matter what time we came, the equipment was full. Many other people came, stayed a while and then left. The air conditioner was noisy and the refrigerator froze all our leftovers from dinner. The only good thing about it was the location, but there are far better hotels on either side.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay! Was here in 1999 but this time was even better.”
Reviews.Author: dcdogmom
Reviews.Content: On a quick trip to Key West we decided on the Hyatt because of our past experience as well as the location. Our room was HUGE with a nice view of the pool and a partial water view. The hotel had built a big ledge behind the bed that served multiple purposes (see picture) and gave us tons of room to put stuff. Loved the bed lights, they were on dimmers. Bathroom was perfect. A private area for the toilet and a walkin shower with a rainshower and a handheld. Just awesome. The staff here could not have been nicer. We got there early (around 11am) and could not get in our room. No surprise. They offered to hold our luggage and promised to call when the room was ready. We were able to get in our room around 1:30 and the front desk gave us a glass of champagne to take to our room. We were walked most of the way to our room by a staff member....nice touch! Every staff member we encountered was pleasant and smiling. It would appear that they like their jobs. That kind of attitude is just icing on the cake! Well done Hyatt!

Reviews.Title: “great expectations”
Reviews.Author: suziep032
Reviews.Content: I convinced my husband to stay here instead of the Sheraton by Mallory Square. We were both pleasantly surprised and happy that we did. It was so much quieter and easier to come in and out for traveling purposes. I can't wait to go back here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, Great location”
Reviews.Author: hndapwr
Reviews.Content: This was our 5th stay at the Hyatt and were were looking forward to trying the Oceanfront Deluxe King room. This is to be their top room category. Unfortunatly, the room was a dud. The room itself was very nice and very clean, but it was on the first floor and was right onto of the "public beach" next to the Hyatt and right by the Jet Skis. The public beach tends to be a hang out of unsavory looking people looking like they are doing unsavory types of things. It was a real let down. The Hyatt is extra special to us as we were married there and had our reception there. So I was really bummed that our expectations were not met. I knew I would be grumpy each time were were on one of the balconies staring at that stuff, so I decided to go to the front desk and talk to them. I ran into the Director of Operations who recognized me and asked how the room was. I told him, and he said go to the front desk and they will figure something out to make sure we are happy. I went to the front desk and explained myself and she took me around to a couple rooms to see what would be good for me. we would not be able to moved until the next day, but she gave us options. When I told her about my favorite room type, she arranged for us to be moved there and they explained to me how to go about booking those rooms in the future so I would know how to get the room I wanted. The next day, we packed up, left out stuff in the room, and when the King Salon room we wanted was vacated, the moved all of our stuff (including our beverages in the fridge) from our old room to the new one. they then called my cell phone and let me know it was all taken care of. The new room was fantastic and we were on cloud nine that they bent over backwards to make us happy. And when my wife had an accident on a bicycle, everyone showed concern and interest for the rest of our trip. They offered use of their wheelchair, they offered to call their on staff doctor and made sure we knew we could call them for everything. So to Atif and the front desk staff, thank you so much for all of the time and effort you put in to making us feel so welcome. We came to this hotel the first time because of the location. We keep coming back because of the staff. (I won't lie though, the location IS amazing).

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel for New Year's Eve!”
Reviews.Author: akos77
Reviews.Content: The last end of the year (2011) was the third time we spent the New Year's Eve in the Hyatt Hotel Key West. The location of this Hyatt is more than ideal. It is close to all the places where you would like to go: only a few steps away from the world famous Duval Street or the Half Shell Raw Bar, etc. Most importantly the Hotel has a very personal touch. The friendly bartender Attila and the kind, attentive and thoughtful Mr. Atif Awan. They really do everything to make your stay special. On the last day of the year, when Mr. Awan realized that they may not have enough roll-over beds for the night, he went to the closest store to buy couple of professional air mattresses. My kids had so much fun, we had a memorable stay in the Hyatt Key West. This was not a surprise at all since we had the same experience during the previous stays.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fnatastic staff”
Reviews.Author: AgaSzSz
Reviews.Content: I visited Key West a while ago but this hotel was so far one of my best holiday experiences. Loved the room and fantastic ocean view. Private beach was a fantastic touch as well. I tend to go out a lot but this property just keeps you in. Great experience :).

Reviews.Title: “Let Odie Welcome You To the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: rdeclemson
Reviews.Content: When you visit the Hyatt, the first order of business is to visit Odie ...the parrot right outside the entrance. The champagne reception in the lobby is just the start of what will be one of the best experiences of a lifetime...others have described being there better than I can ....we have been gong to the Hyatt for several years, and we have already booked for 2013. I suggest you do the same!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: tools35
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in a great location. The staff is very attentive and they do everything possible to make your stay memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Wedding Experience”
Reviews.Author: theresa r
Reviews.Content: We had our beautiful beachfront wedding at the Blue Mojito beach on the Hyatt Property 8/13/2011. Lindsey S. was so helpful in the planning and execution of the event! All the hotel staff were so friendly and accommodating to us and our group of 40 travelers. Everyone on the property treated us like royalty, even down to little details like special appetizers and notes sent to the room. On the wedding day, special mirrors were sent to the room for getting ready, housekeeping cleaned the room early so photos were not a problem, everyone was well taken care of. With the added stresses of traveling with a large group, the Hyatt took all the stress away! Even with dining out in town, concierge helped to make reservations. Although, the food on property is Excellent! Highly recommend them!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Great Key West Location”
Reviews.Author: Ruth R
Reviews.Content: This is the prefect place to stay in Key West! The location is right on the water, which is great, but at the same time everything is walkable, as well. When my children and I stayed in this lovely hotel, we left the car in the parking lot the whole time! We had the best of all worlds with a gorgeous ocean view from our balcony, but then we could just walk out onto the street and head for all the shops and terrific restaurants, no problem. The staff was very gracious here - although they did make a mistake with our rooms the day of our arrival, they couldn't have been nicer and more efficient in rectifying it and this attitude continued throughout our stay. If I'm ever lucky enough to return to Key West, there is nowhere else I'd rather stay than this Hyatt!

Reviews.Title: “Summer Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Audrey S
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed staying here. You can walk or bike anywhere you want to go. The view was wonderful. The hotel staff were always very helpful. It's a beautiful hotel with a wonderful pool area located beside the water with a waitress to bring you drinks from the bar while you relax by the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good value for the money.”
Reviews.Author: Lois H
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the middle of everything and right on the water....however we had a view of homeless people sleeping on the beach under our window during the day. Although we paid a substantial rate, there were additional fees to use the internet and to sit in chaise lounges by the pool. Upon our arrival, maintenance had to go into the next door room and climb over their balcony and pop our sliding door to get into our room to replace the automated key card lock.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: joyce h
Reviews.Content: Just returned home from a week in Key West. Everything about this hotel contributed to our enjoyment of Key West. First, I think it has the best location in Key West. It's on the water -- one block from the harbor and two blocks from Duvall Street. Literally everything is within walking distance. The rooms were spacious and comfortable; the employees were knowledgable and very service-oriented; the food was good for hotel food; and the facilities were "as advertised." If you can afford it, I can't imagine a better place to stay in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to relax and have fun. Close to everything.”
Reviews.Author: ok2eme
Reviews.Content: Spent a December vacation to relax and couldn't have picked a better spot. The hotel was undergoing upgrades but the staff was very accomodating to make sure it had as little impact as possible on the guests. The location of this hotel is perfect for Key West. You are right on the water and within walking distance of Duvall Streets restaurants, bars and shops. If you want to book water sports, tours, etc. The staff at the Hyatt can take care of you, many activities are offered right from the dock of your hotel. The staff at the Hyatt and for that matter everywhere at Key West were all very friendly and the service levels are great!

Reviews.Title: “Wow, couldn't have asked for better”
Reviews.Author: klhawkz
Reviews.Content: My family and I went to Key West on a wild hair thought......We originally went to South Beach with the kids and decided to try somewhere else during our trip. I booked the Hyatt and Wow........It's very different then the Hyatt's in the city. It's more laid back and representative of the Key West lifestyle. We enjoyed the property very much!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but needs an update”
Reviews.Author: wander1
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is great for Key West but the hotel itself needs an update. Our room was quite pricey and we paid extra for a "partial gulf view". The partial gulf view required a trip to the balcony. The hotel is dated but it's important to remember that even multi-star hotels are still really just beach hotels. That being said, the staff was very nice and we had a good stay. If we stay there again, we will be much choosier about our room selection.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, close to everything”
Reviews.Author: kypat
Reviews.Content: We are staying at the Hyatt Key West. Our room is great, very nice view. The lighting in the room is excellent and the room is very inviting, colorful, clean and comfortable. The pool was warm and our lunch by the pool was very good. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for fun”
Reviews.Author: william c
Reviews.Content: Have been to Key West many times for vacations, never stayed here until this year. Very accomodating and friendly staff, very clean rooms, could walk to everywhere I really wanted to be. Enjoyed both the pool and the hot tub. Small but nice beach area.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: christy88ky
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt is the perfect location for a Key West vacation. Just a couple blocks to Mallory Square and Duval Street, also located right beside the Harbor Walk. Rooms are extremely clean on every visit I've had here. Beach is very, very small but not different from any of the other resorts on this side of the island. Overall you cannot beat this resort. I never consider anywhere else when I visit.

Reviews.Title: “All of the staff were do extremely accommodating.”
Reviews.Author: Bchilled
Reviews.Content: Excellent. We only stayed one night but just on the impression the staff left we would make a trip back. We only drove down for the day and decided to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: PARbnet
Reviews.Content: Price wasn't bad, very clean and well maintained property, you can't beat the location and the staff was very friendly/helpful. They could drop a few of the "signature" items from the house keeping. For instance, they seem to have "scents" that they use in different areas each day that are just horrible (rooms, elevator, common areas). You're probably getting the picture that my wife and I have allergies -- we do [ sorry Hyatt :( :( ] The pool was nice but small and the beach area is really just a sandy spot they carved out at the breakers before the entrace to the harbour - don't think I'd swim in it, but some folks did. We didn't use any of the SPA services, so I can't speak to those other than to say the rest of the hotel left me with the feeling they'd be top notch. They do have on-site self and valet parking which was a plus for us since we drove down from Miami, but you really wouldn't need a car here if you're coming into the Key West airport because they rent bikes, scooters and electric cars right on property. Location and the fact that it's "gated" and very clean are the high points for this hotel. The pool, beach and restaurant shouldn't be your draw here.

Reviews.Title: “At First Disappointed, but.............”
Reviews.Author: Ange2169
Reviews.Content: We chose to take a spontaneous trip to Key West and utilized www.priceline.com to grab a resort at a cheap price. To our success we were confirmed at the Hyatt Windward Pointe Resort in Old Town Key West for $190.00 a night. With such a great deal, there is a price to pay, just remember that when using Priceline. Upon our arrival we were met with a very polite valet, who grabbed our bags and ushered us into the Hyatt Lobby. It was 2:30pm, and I thought check in would be easy, well it was but were weren't allowed to check in till 4:00pm, the staff was nice, but I was kinda disappointed about this, I remember 3:00pm check in times, well not to let us down we left our bags and went exploring. At 4:30 we made our way back to the Hyatt and breezed through check in, although they do charge $20.00 for hotel amenities which is equivalent to two bottles of water, and free Wi/Fi in there lobby area. This I could have done without, a waste of time and $20.00 We were shown to our room by a very friendly and attentive staff member, room 2107, if you ever get this room, if your by yourself and you got a good rate stay, don't complain think of the good rate, but if your there with someone else, problem, problem, problem! Room 2107 and most likely 2105 are most likely the least desirable rooms at this beautiful resort. yes it's a not so nice view, but even worse is it has two twin size beds. Well, I went down to see if I could change up, but no such luck. I was told that twin size beds are the new queen size bed. Kind of an unappreciated lame excuse. Now mind you, the staff was still very friendly. This was a spontaneous quick trip and I've always expected little rocks in the road, if this were a planned event, this would not be a kosher episode, and I would have been unhappy. But, Priceline I'm sure is more responsible, As you the adage goes you get for what you pay for, buy somewhere out there someone paid full boat for that room, and that's a true disappointment, there is plenty of room for a king size bed in there, they should try it out. Another disappointment about room 2107 is your right under the lobby, so people entering/exiting all hours of the night, you will hear them. Would I use Hyatt again..... yes they were nice, and helpful, would I want the same room again absolutely not. With Priceline you lose your leverage, and get what they give you!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: J_M-wanderer
Reviews.Content: Excellent accommodations, good services, restful stay. After a disasterous stay last time at the Pier House in Key West, we decided to try the Hyatt. What a difference, basically night and day. The hotel is well appointed, good location, and the personnel are friendly and see to all your needs. If you're up for water sports try out their jet ski tour of key west. My wife and I had a blast, and the price was very competitive. The guide was funny and ensured our safety and fun. We'll be back, I promise!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay at Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: suzetdk
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very roomy, and we had a nice balcony view of the ocean. The bathrooms are also spacious and had a large walk-in shower with several showerheads. The sliding bathroom door did not close properly and left a small gap, but luckily I was with very close friends. The hotel gift store had a nice selection of SPF-coated clothing where the prices were very reasonable. The front desk was very friendly, and offered us strawberry-infused water upon arrival, and offered us umbrellas when needed. The hotel is walking distance from several restaurants and convenience stores. The pool and hot tub is rather small. Will definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: RickDeniseSheltonCt
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our 10th anniversary here and renewed our wedding vows November 14th thru the 22nd. This is one of our best vacations,the place is spotless,has great food and the service is the all time best we have experianced. Had a small issue renewing our wedding vows on the property but the Hotel Manager made it happen and really went out of his way to make it very special for us. The Hotel is in the perfect location. 1 block to Schooners Wharf and 2 blocks to Duval street. Have all the fun you want then retreat to the quiet Hyatt as we called it. Restaurant and Bar at the hotel is first class with awsome views of the water. I would not hesitate to come back to this Hyatt. Cant until next year. Two thumbs way up here. Thank you Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Regbowman
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a small resort but it's not lacking, great staff at the front desk and all around as well it's a great get a way hotel

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: travelgal018
Reviews.Content: we stayed here with 2 young kids. the room was nice and modern looking, although very small. very nice bathroom (no tub but cool shower). hotel seemed more geared towards adults/couples, but it still worked out fine for us because we are not too fussy. we chose this hotel for the location so it was worth it for that alone. however it was expensive so that's the why i gave it very good instead of excellent because it wasn't the best value. also it felt more like a very upscale hotel than resort. there were nice touches like champagne and water on check-in, complimentary box of baby care items with crib, etc. my son liked turtles by the pool. we ate at restaurant for breakfast which was nice.

Reviews.Title: “An old hotel Hyatt is trying to maintain ----”
Reviews.Author: smvhou
Reviews.Content: This is not a bad property, but if you believe the Hyatt-hype on this hotel you are going to be disappointed. The Hyatt website & printed materials would lead potential guests to believe, incorrectly, that this is a 4-5 star resort, similar to other Hyatt Resort Properties in Hawaii & elsewhere. Unfortunately, that is simply not the case. This hotel has been around for decades & periodically Hyatt throws some money to remodel & update, but this place is fighting to stay relevant. Hyatt does it's brand-image no favors by continuing to list this property as something it isn't. It's a pleasant place. but it is NOT a 4-5 star resort by any measurement. Very small pool & beach area. There is "no" inside bar &/or area to relax. Only an outside pool bar that seems to keep sporadic hours you cannot count on. Tiny lobby that is certainly not inviting to sit & relax. Very small balconies on the majority of rooms, with a table that is way too large for the area & 2 chairs. You have to move around the furniture & maneuver around it if 2 people want to use it. There are a few larger balconies, so if this is important, be SURE to confirm it in advance. Furniture is in good shape & looks fairly new, though the upholstered chairs in our room were "way past" due for a good cleaning. Great bed & linens & top notch housekeeping as usual with Hyatt properties. Unfortunately, service is lacklustre at best. Friendly, courteous, helpful & professional staff, but we heard numerous employees complain about being short of staff, which explains the poor service levels, even though it was over 1 of the biggest annual festival weekends in Key West. Didn't try the restaurant, but others with us did, & told us we were better to go elsewhere. On the plus side you cannot beat the location. Self-parking is included in the rate, which is a big deal in Key West, & you won't need to move your car once you arrive. Overall it is a typical older motel-type property, with low ceilings & cramped rooms, but Hyatt tries to to make the best of it. It is not, however, in the same class as Westin Key West, or even The Pier House which is of the same age. And some of the smaller high-end guest house properties are far superior.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt key west”
Reviews.Author: 5Js
Reviews.Content: the hotel is in a great location, few minute walk to duval and mallory sq., most people don't mention that the harbor walk is even closer 1 block, which also has great places to eat and drink. the grounds are beautiful, pool is just the right size, and plenty of sun decks and areas to lounge. rooms are big, rain shower head in shower is great, don't worry about views, (you're not in your room that much) our room was a normal rate and we faced the gulf, could barely see it through the palm trees, that was enough for me to feel like you're in paradise. only con, you have to go to the restarant on site for decent coffe in the morning and you have to pay for it. Two Friends and Rum Barrel restarant/Bars right across the street. Rooms a bit pricy but worth it for a few days. one day while lying on the deck we were informed a weddding was to take place in that area and we would have to move, they comped us two rounds of drinks for the inconvinence and we didn't even ask for it, that was good customer service. first trip to Key West and would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Won't Return”
Reviews.Author: skirkla1
Reviews.Content: Excellent location and very nice welcome from bellman who indicated they were not busy that night. Hyatt emailed me offering an upgrade "if available" which I accepted, but supposedly the better room was not available when I checked in. Thing is, my travel companions were moved to that very room category later when they discovered the sink would not drain and no one was available to fix it. They refused to let us keep one of the rooms a little later because they were full which I know was BS. Room had a good view but was in poor shape....torn wallpaper, stained and torn furniture. Floor turned my feet BLACK it was so filthy! Too small pool area and the "beach" was a man made sand box. Other than the bellman the staff was not warm or accomodating. Free parking was appreciated, as was a mini fridge in the room. Very small balcony. Tried to charge us "resort fee" a second time on check out (already prepaid). Next time I will stay at the Pier House next door.

Reviews.Title: “Yet Another Satisfying Stay”
Reviews.Author: Keywestfanyeahh
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at HKW on Front Street. You cannot get a better location for enjoying Duval St. -and then retreating back to the Hyatt where it is peaceful. Food quality and offerings are consistently high at the SHOR. Friendly, helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Serendipity at work”
Reviews.Author: stusil
Reviews.Content: We decided to have a short getaway weekend and drove from Boynton Beach to Key West. We expected it to be a leisurely experience, where we would sit at the pool and read a book and relax. We self parked and there was no charge. As a gold passport member, we were not charged for Internet either. When we arrived, we were greeted at the front desk with frindly smile and asked a question. Would we like a glass of champagne or strawberry water? Nice touch. Everyday they have a different flavor of water, including a thirst quenching cucumber water. We were in a standard room and we overlooked the gulf and pool. Wonderful view. The room was not overly large, but still had adaquate room with a small balcony. Every single employee we came across from the front desk to the chanbermaids went out of their way to be friendly and helpful. We walked towards the pool looking for the concierge, where we met Charlie. He said he might be able to help us. He told us about Fantasy Fest. It sounded interesting and he supplied us with literature and tips as to what activities to look for and where to look for them. He also supplied us with a local map. The hotel is a block or so from Duval St. where all the activity was taking place. We walked down there and found thousands of people having a wonderful party. Yes, it is heaven for exibitionists, who want to show off their bodies whether young and beautiful or old, fat and weathered. This is not for the prudish type. Seridipity is the art of finding something you weren't looking for. We found it in Fantasy Fest. It is a combination of Halloween and Madri Gras. We did not witness any of the drunken roudiness that we would have expected. New York has the Easter Parade, where everone strolls down 5th Avenue and is invited to wear unique hats. By comparisaon, NY's Easter Parade is quite tame. In Key West, people are invited to wear costumes or not. Many do not actually get get dressed up in costumes, but rather have them painted on their naked bodies. Both Friday and Saturday we saw thousands of people strolling up and down Duval Street with various costumes snapping pictures by the boatload. We walked our feet off and reluctantly left as it began to shower, which stopped as we approached the hotel. We then walked around the boardwalk area near the Hyatt, which has one waterfront restaurant after another. We had a delightful meal. We went to our room and found the bed and linens very comfortable and had a restful nights sleep. The next day we walked past Charlie again, he asked us how we made out and we thanked him for all his help. We told him we were looking for a place to eat andhe directed us. We decided to stoop at the "schooner ?" Which is an outdoor garden type of reataurant. They had a guitar player Michael McCloud who was a Jimmy Buffett wanna be, but was quite entertaining. The food was OK, the service very slow. We then proceded back to Duval St. and once again had a wonderful voyeauristic experience. Charlie had told us about the big Parade at night and that there would be 100,000 people squeezed into 10 blocks. We saw place that have viewing seats and they were charging as much as $350 or $175 p/p standing room, but that included drinks and dinner. We noticed some people brought picnic chairs and started lining up along the curb. We found a Walgreens, purchased a bottle of wine and two chairs. We parked ourselves at the curb and instead of walking up and down Duvall St, we had the strollers, walk past us as we sipped on our wine. We sat there for several hours, as the time passed quickly, until the parade began. After all the excitement about the parade, both my wife and myself were a bit disappointed. We felt the floats were for the most part amateurish. Nevertheless, we had a great time. We ate at the street fair and loved every minute of this totally unexpected experience. I imagine some of the Tea Party Tea Totalers would have a hard time appreciating the body art, costumes and floats. We loved it. The next day we had a lae check out and drove back to our version of paradise.

Reviews.Title: “WE HAD THE BEST VACATION EVER!!!! Oh yeah, Champagne at checkin too! YUM!”
Reviews.Author: coloradoadventurgirl
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved this hotel! The staff is so nice, they remembembered our names, and greeted us every time they saw us! We even enjoyed drinks with the GM at the pool side bar! The island mentality seemed to make all of these people extrememly welcoming and because they are at Hyatt they are hard workers! The room was AMAZING! The whole hotel reflects an elegant sophistication. It seems very new and clean! The pool was very nice, we also enjoyed sitting on the pier on the pool chairs. The restaurant was AMAZING! I recomment the lobster tale for dinner. Steak and eggs for breakfast! They did run out of the lobster benedict that both my boyfriend and I were anxious to try two mornings but steak and eggs was a tasty replacement! We enjoyed renting bicycles at the gift shop, the location is AWESOME!! Walking/biking distance from EVERYTHING!! Duval Street, Mallory Square, Shipwreck museum, Acquarium, bars, restaurants, and biking distance from the beach! Very nice!! WE WILL BE BACK! We are even joking about having our destination wedding there but since we've only been dating for 6 months or so that will be way down the line! ;)

Reviews.Title: “If you can get a good deal on a room, stay here.”
Reviews.Author: Hpychk
Reviews.Content: This Hyatt, as all other waterfront hotels, can get a bit pricey. However, the staff was as friendly as can be. Our room was well decorated and appointed. Great beds, great shower. The balconies are a bit small but still nice to have one. We had some windy weather so really didn't use the pool. It's a great location, you can walk to many spots on the island.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Horrible "Beach"”
Reviews.Author: KentuckyTwinTraveler
Reviews.Content: The facilities are nice, the staff was great and the location was good. The "beach" was horrible. We were a family of four and wanted a place where the kids could snorkel while we had a drink by the pool. This place advertised that it had a private beach. Technically, that was true. However, the small patch of sand was not worth the money. The "beach" was about 50 ft of water front sand in the middle of the ferry shipping lane. This place is right on the water and is close to the sunset square but not worth the money. Next time I will head more in-land and save a ton.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: fsview11
Reviews.Content: You can do Key West on the cheap or you can do it right. While some properties don't seem that far away on the map try walking .8 miles back to your hotel after doing the Duval Crawl. This is a great proeprty, not too big, nice pool and hot tub, on-site prices aren't terrible for food and drinking. The rooms are very up to date, champagne (cava actually) on check-in, resort fee includes internet, bottled water daily and parking. The staff is also great here, they're always looking to go out of their way to help you and go the extra step.

Reviews.Title: “excellent resort”
Reviews.Author: tony15230
Reviews.Content: One would expect a great stay , as this is a higher end resort, but still, an excellent hotel. While you expect more paying a high price, you also do not want to be disappointed. This property was excellent all around, and would certaintly recommend to anyone. My other reason for the review is to give a plug for Hyatt. I was staying here using some points as a Platinum member, thus I realize easier to enjoy, nevertheless they made me feel like I was paying full price, and received all the amenities as one does as a memebr with Hyatt. I think that is important, and worth noting . again, definitely a great place, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!!”
Reviews.Author: iowadds
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to the Hyatt Key West and we were not disappointed. Here are some pros and cons I have for the hotel: Pros - Great location, close to Mallory Square, Duval Street - Steps away from many great restaurants - Beautiful gulf view - Friendly staff - Modern room, clean, comfortable bed Cons - Small beach (if you are looking for a beach resort, look on the south side of Key West) - $20 resort fee, includes parking (this was clearly stated prior to arrival, and figuring in parking was not a bad deal. Also, 24 hr fitness facility).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff, Great Rooms, it was Great”
Reviews.Author: Stonecoldwade
Reviews.Content: We come to Key West often. i had some Hyatt Points and chose the Hyatt Key West Resort and Spa for that reason (free stay). From the moment we arrived it was nothing but first class. I can't say enough about the great staff. We checked out today and came to the Casa Marina because I had some Hilton Points to stay there. Not a bad place, but after the Hyatt it is a disappointment. I highly recomend this Hotel and can't wait to come back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Location is wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: reallyrelaxing
Reviews.Content: Had a girl's weekend here, Sept. 23-26. What a wonderful place to stay! Walking to restaurant's, shopping and the ferry we traveled on was a snap! The view was incredible, we had a rainy day and from our room we were able to watch a water spout form out on the ocean from our balcony. The staff and other guest were warm and friendly. The room was spacious and the air conditioning was icy cold which we loved. The pool is small but that is the norm in Key West so no worries there. We wiil be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great people, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Brian M
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for a Key West stay, walk to anything, a block from Duval St, but quiet and personal. Staff very nice, pool and "beach" were just what we needed. We will return here for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: beachinitboston
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. The rooms are fabulous! I have stayed at the Westin several times but we liked the Hyatt much better. The pool is small but that was ok. We had breakfast at the restaurant which was delicious. The service was great. I will return.

Reviews.Title: “un believable”
Reviews.Author: happinstance
Reviews.Content: I was shown to my room and I couldn't believe it all, the view was something I just can't describe .whe atching the sunsets each night.I took so many pictures of sunsets, The food was great ,the bar was fun It was close to anything I wanted to walk to. I had a real ordeal on my way to Key West but they, the staff there made me feel safe. I'll go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with some hotel specific reservations.”
Reviews.Author: Trvl4advntr
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hyatt for 10 days in September 2011. This was a return stay after several years. We returned because of our memories of the excellent view and location coupled with service and cleanliness. In quick summation, we now recognize that there are better hotels with just as good as location for the same price. Pros: location. Walk to everything. Great views of sunset. Beach/water sports and pool. Cons: cleanliness. It was generally clean with a few minuses. We stayed in a salon room (king with a large balcony overlooking the pool/water) There were dirty feet marks on the wall. The upholstery was grey insead of yellow on the seat. Glossy white tile floors need serious bleach in the grout- which normally wouldn't be a big deal but it's KW and you are frequently barefoot in your room. We asked to have the sheets changed twice during a 10 night stay and they never changed them and house keeping routinely forgot to get remove dirty items. Such as a cloth napkin for 3 days and empty wine glasses left on counter. If your going to KW for the first time, highly recommend a hotel with beach and pool on the Mallory Sq side of Duval. While Hyatt is not a poor choice, you can find a better hotel at a comparable price.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: rtsmms
Reviews.Content: This hotel surpassed our dreams. We had such a great time. The rooms really look like they do in the pictures. All I can add is the Location. ABSOLUTELY AWESOME!!! We are 24 & 25. We like to be in the thick of things but since it was our honeymoon we didnt want to be near all the bars. This was wonderful location 1 block to Duval Street. We could walk to all our activites. The Shor was a wonderful restaurant with comparable prices. All the staff was so friendly and genuinely nice. We had a wonderful time! After seeing the area and other hotels. We wouldnt stay anywhere else on key west! Also had to add the housekeeping was wonderful. Everytime we walked into the room it was spotless and looked as when it did when we first walked in.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for more”
Reviews.Author: FirsttimertoFlorida
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in September 2011. The grounds are beautifully landscaped, the room had a king size bed with a partial gulf view. Room was clean and spacious. We were given glasses of champagne on arrival. Somebody was always at the front lobby desk no matter what hour it was. We were always greeted warmly. Its perfectly located close to Duval Street but far enough away that its quiet. This hotel had so many extra amenities that we weren't able to use them all before we left. We will definately stay here again the next time we are in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: WineGirl45
Reviews.Content: The views, the room, the service was exceptional. I highly recommend this hotel as a wonderful place to stay while visiting Key West. You can walk to Duval Street, Mallory Square, restaurants, bars and museums. We were greeted with glasses of champagne while checking in. Hotel staffers were very friendly and helpful, making our stay a wonderful one. The views are incredible with a very nice pool, restaurant and bar right on the water. The room was clean, large and very comfortable. I will absolutely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, spacious, friendly!”
Reviews.Author: mvmone
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Hyatt and wished we could've stayed longer! Due to bad weather in Miami, we couldn't fly out the final evening of our stay in Key West, so we Pricelined a hotel for the night and got the Hyatt. What a lucky draw for us! Although, it's a bit of a hike (~10 min cab ride) from the airport, the hotel is beautiful. The location is also close to all the action on upper Duvall St. At check-in, we were warmly greeted and offered a complimentary glass of champagne! We were given the keys to our room and took a leisurely detour through the lovely grounds of the Hyatt. Passing pools filled with turtles/tortoises, a restaurant, an open air bar, and a small private "beach"/swimming area for guests. All room access is via outdoor corridors, giving the place less of a stuffy hotel, and more a condo-type feel. The room was large, very open, clean and modern. Unlike most hotels that stuff king beds into small rooms that get dominated by bed, the king bed fit this room. The bed was comfortable (they could use better pillows). Though our room was one of the farthest from the water, the room/balcony was angled such that you have a view of the water. The bathroom was also spacious, lovely and modern. I liked the pocket door...smart space-saving design. The walk-in rain-shower had nice tile and floor to ceiling glass enclosure. Very clean, sleek look. Since we were only there for the night, we didn't use any of the amenities, but would love to return sometime in the future to do so. For our brief stay, we were quite impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: bjlf
Reviews.Content: You will not be disappointed selecting this hotel for your stay in Key West. It is located very near the action of Duval Street and Mallory Square, yet offers a peaceful and serene setting. Overlooking the wide open water, the views are great and there is a awesome sunset sailboat cruise you can take that docks right at the hotel property. It has a very nice pool, cabana bar, spa, etc.. The rooms are updated and very upscale.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel and Spacious Rooms”
Reviews.Author: JustACityBoy
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Key West with my wife and another couple. We stayed at the Hyatt Resort and Spa on Front Street. The location was absolutely perfect. The rooms were spacious and the shower was big enough for four people. Nice and roomy for whatever you like do in the shower with company!! Two short blocks to Duval Street and right on the Gulf. It was very easy to walk around to the waterfront restaurants and shopping. Duval Street is definitely the hot spot. More bars than you can imagine and plenty of restaurants too. My favorite was actually right next to the Hyatt, called A&B Lobster House. The meal was a bit pricey, even by NY standards, but was outrageously good. I had the 10 oz. Filet Mignon and 10 oz. lobster tail ($70) and started with a very creamy and chunky lobster bisque. By chunky I mean lots of little bits of lobster, not the usual two small clumps. The best seafood for cheap was at Half Shell Raw Bar, right on the waterfront. If you go for happy hour (4:30 pm to 6:30 pm) you get everything for 1/2 price. That includes the food, so we pigged out for sure. Abbondanza's Italian was also very good. Bring your appetite because the pasta portions are HUGE. I mean I must have had one pound of linguine with my shrimp scampi!! And my wife's linguine with white clam sauce was just as big. One dozen clams (in the shell) to top the pasta off. And very reasonable prices. It was a little out of the way for us (we were on the north-west side of the island and Abbondanza is on the southern part) but was worth the twenty minute walk. I have to say the Key West is a remarkable place to have a really good time. You can find happy hours that begin at 7 am!!! Yea, in the morning. Of course you must visit Sloppy Joe's for drinks and a live band, The Hog's Breath which is kinda small but very lively at night, Schooner's on the water. It looks kinda run down, but that is part of the appeal. Good for breakfast, as it is cheap. The one thing I did find is that breakfast everywhere was pricey. Wierd, lunch was actually cheaper in many places than breakfast. I went to Pepe's, nice but not really impressive. The food was good though. Cheese Burger Cafe was a good breakfast (and $3.50 bloody mary's) and reasonable. Southernmost Beach Cafe was also nice. Right on the water, near the monument bell with the "90 miles to Cuba" stamp. Amazing that all the beaches are imported. I mean they don't have sandy beaches in Key West. Wherever their is sand, it was brought in from Florida proper or Cuba!!! The south side of the island basically has the beaches, but they are not typical caribbean tytpe beaches, so don't expect too much from them. As for the rest of the bars and restaurants, there is something for everyone. If like to sit on a ssaddle while you drink your beer, go to Cowboy Bills, if you like to be nude and drink, go to the Garden of Eden. Honestly, clothing is optional!!! If you are more traditional, go to the Hard Rock Cafe. We had a blast in Irish Kevin's. The entertainer (one guy with an acoustic guitar) is absolutely hysterical. He is Pauly from NY, so you know we had fun with him, especially when he was making fun of the red sox (Boston fans were on hand). He is a real character and insults just about everyone. If you can't laugh at yourself, better not go. All in all, a great trip and will definitely return (with lots of friends next time). Two quick tips: Hit as many happy hours as you can BEFORE dinner. You save a lot of money on food and drinks with half price specials. We did that each night, then went back to the hotel to shower and change for dinner. Works out great. Second, take the Hop on Hop Off Trolley tours (any one). They are worth the $20. Very nice drive, very informative and it's the cheapest way to get around. You can hop on and off all day, so go out early. And one more thing: be prepared for flooding during heavy rainstorms. The streets by our hotel turned into rivers after a one hour rainstorm. It did rain really hard, but you will have to wade through one to two feet of water in spots, so wear flip flops. And I left Hurricane Irene behind, with little flooding by me only to get flooded in Florida!!!! But it makes for one more good story, though....

Reviews.Title: “Secluded and top notch!”
Reviews.Author: maxx3442
Reviews.Content: Having been to Key West numerous times and always staying at a decent B&B, this time I decided to go for a more luxurious vibe with the comforts and spoils of a nice pool, pool bar and absolutely top flight restauarnt on premises. First thing I noticed was the abundance of vegetation on site which was perfect as a noise barrier and also laid the goundwork for a mini resort vibe. It succeeded on both parts. The staff was very professional and pleasant. The breakfast was amazing and absolutely no complaints all around.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, great breakfast and close to town.”
Reviews.Author: hollebcfp
Reviews.Content: Take the breakfast package. The food is great as well as the view of the harbor. If you rent a jet ski there, take the first trip of thre day and you can bargain the price down alot.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: skipthomp
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and my two daughters (ages 10 and 13) spent four nights here in July. We originally had a room that required a sleeper sofa for my daughters. My wife and I got into a conversation with the bartender at the pool. We told him we were very happy with our accommodations. But he heard about our sleeper sofa requirement for our kids. He called the front desk and the hotel manager later met us at our room and graciously offered us a complementary suite upgrade at no additional charge for the remainder of our stay. We spent the final three nights overlooking beautiful sunsets on our huge balcony. I've just got to say THANK YOU for your incredibly hospitable service.

Reviews.Title: “We really Enjoy the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: hndapwr
Reviews.Content: We had another wonderful trip to Key West and we love staying at the Hyatt. Everyone is so nice and the rooms are just to our liking. They are modern and clean looking, with really comfortable beds and a wonderful walk in shower. Unfortunately, this is the second time in a row that we didn't have the wooden stool in the shower that makes it easier for my wife to shave her legs. I wish they had those in every room. This is our 3rd stay at the Hyatt in the past 14 months. We were married there in June of 2010 and had our reception there. It was wonderful. This trip we were in room 3201. It is a gulf front room with pretty views, but the palm trees take away some of the view towards Sunset Key. The view towards Christmas Tree Island is beautiful. Being up one more floor (at least) would help with that. We really did love this room though. Being right on the water just makes the views that much more special. Having a mini fridge in the room is great to keep our Diet Mt Dew cold along with extra bottles of water. This particular room had a little less storage than the last 2 we have had. Probably because of the layout, but a couple more drawers would have been helpful. The location can't be beat. Steps from the Bight and steps from Duval. Even being that close to the action, you still feel like you are in a little retreat. You never hear any noise. The views from the pool and docks are wonderful. Everyone we had contact with was very nice. From the Director of Operations, to the pool servers, bartenders, waitress at the restaurant to the housekeeping staff. Our rooms didn't get cleaned until late afternoon usually, and I would have preferred it done a little earlier, but the rooms were always clean. One frustrating thing was the prevalence of non-guests swimming in the pool. There was a very large group one day and they were very loud and a couple of the kids were swimming in their street clothing. They brought their own bottle of rum and seemed to be hitting it pretty well. It got so loud it drove us from the bar and we went back to our room. I really think management needs to take control of situations like that. Instead, they gave them a "locals discount card" so I guess they encourage non-guests to come. I think that it is one thing to encourage them to come and have drinks or eat, but another to take over parts of the pool. The relaxation factor left the pool that day. Management needs to step up and take control. With the exception of the pool issue, we had a wonderful trip and look forward to staying at the Hyatt again. We just hope they get control of the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, peaceful, relaxing, fun, and perfect for what I needed”
Reviews.Author: Eephillips7
Reviews.Content: The room service was great, front desk help was prompt and nice. Drink prices are a little on the high side. Shor restaurant food was very tasty. Great staff

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but Not So Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Lurtle
Reviews.Content: Only a few positives I can give...great location and staff were very friendly and attentive to our concerns. But our stay was cut short after one night (was supposed to be four nights) and we moved to the Westin which was heads and tails better than our experience here (reviewed separately). Upon check in we found our room partially serviced. Beds were made up but food trash was on the floor and the bathroom had hair in the sink, trash on the floor, and no amenities to be found anywhere. We called the front desk and they were very quick to send staff up to clean the room for us. They even sent us complimentary chips and salsa later in the night to apologize for the inconvenience. The reservation I made had said there was a fridge in the room, but after noticing the "fridge" was not really cold we called and were informed that it was only a "cooler." They did find a fridge that they brought in for us. The room iteself was a little dated and the two double beds were a bit small for our family of 4. We also found out at 5 a.m. that they gave us a room that backed up to the dumpster. I've never had an experience where I've called the front desk so many times! We just may have been unlucky and had a lot of little things go wrong from the get go. The manager on duty tried his best to satisfy us, but unfortunately first impressions are hard to change and we had to check out.

Reviews.Title: “Best location to walk about the island!”
Reviews.Author: ivormom
Reviews.Content: Super location to see Key West, and yet the beach area and room were very quiet. Our room was spacious and nicely decorated. Our only disappointment was with the service in the restaurant. It was reasonably quiet when we visited and yet the hostess often made us wait when several tables were available.

Reviews.Title: “Special getaway!!”
Reviews.Author: cherandfig2
Reviews.Content: Celebrating a special birthday in a tropical setting...with no agenda other than experiencing good restaurants and poolside cocktails. Hotel was excellent for its amenities especially the pool and access to the beach from the pool area. Boats of all sizes and purposes were everywhere. Pool bar/grill and Shor restaurant on the property were excellent. Most rooms have an excellent view from balconies.Many points of interest are within walking distance..[Duval st, Mallory Square, Marina for water related activities, etc.] Pepe's' Lattitudes, El Siboney & Shor's are highly recommened restaurants. Great time was had by all...plan to return and explore the south side of the Island.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: emma8834
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hyatt Resort in Key West in June 2011. It is a beautiful resort with a very tropical feel. Staff were all very accomodating and helpful. The hotel is in easy walking distance of nice resturants on the pier and Duvall Street. Our room was very spacious and beautfully decorated. I believe all rooms have a small balacony overlooking the gardens. I highly recommend this hotel and hope to return again and again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Amy S
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt had wonderful staff, everyone was friendly! The pool was big and open till 11:00pm. on hot days a staff member walks around handing out chilled towels for your face or neck... so refreshing!! The beach area was ok. They had a big sand area but if you wanted to get to the water you needed to go down some stairs and walked across pebels. The rooms and room service was wonderful as well.

Reviews.Title: “"Time of our lives!"”
Reviews.Author: MarkD1956
Reviews.Content: The most impressive and comfortable hotel we have ever stayed at! Management as well as staff members were outstanding! WHAT A TIME!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of calm after Duval St...”
Reviews.Author: AndyStone
Reviews.Content: Pro's: - Great room - very clean with a calming decor. - Great shower (and its gets hot). - Personal service from the Reception Staff. - Large comfortable firm beds with clean, fresh linen. - Large bath towels provided and always soft (not abrasive at all). - Fantastic location - one block away from Duval St / sunset experience / main shopping area. - Free parking. - Fast Wi-Fi download speeds. Con's: - On the expensive side (but worth it). - Small pool (though always clean). - Bar closes at 22:00 (to ensure the are no noise complaints from Guests). - Our cleaner was a little keen (always knocking before 0900 - we were on holiday after all). - Staff were always pushing the Hyatt Key West condos (hard sell tactics not required). Overall: A calming oasis after the madness of Duval St. We would go back, if we were in Key West again (unlikely). This hotel SAVED our holiday after our experience at the Miami Beach Holiday Inn...

Reviews.Title: “Superior staff, very dog friendly, highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: petvetsal
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our 2 dogs for 10 days. The staff was very accommodating and respectful to all of our wishes. They worked around our schedule to clean rooms when we requested, knowing that we had our dogs with us, and we were able to enjoy our vacation time without stressing over "what about the dogs?" We highly recommend this hotel whether you have dogs with you or not, and we will be back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel. Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: roaminggnome00
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at this Hyatt. We chose it for the location, right off of Duval and right near the harbor-you can walk anywhere from this hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful, including Vito, our bellhop. The lock on our room quit working and it took over an hour to repair it. No problem for us because we were hanging out at the pool, but the hotel sent up a plate of chocolates as a "Sorry for the inconvenience." Unexpected and very nice. This was a pretty family friendly place-lots of kids in the pool. Pool was great. Plenty of lounge chairs. There's also a nice deck with lounge chairs you can lay on. Alejandro walked around and brought us food and drinks when we asked. If you don't want to pay $5 for a bottle of water, bring your own (the rooms have fridges)! The staff also brought around cold towels and popsicles. We tried breakfast at Shor. Limited menu and overpriced. Would skip Shor next time. The Blue Mjoito bar by the pool is a fun place with good drinks. Lots to do at or near the hotel. We rented scooters in the parking lot from HydroThunder. We went sailing with Floridays, which launches at the Hyatt pier. They also have jet ski tours and a scuba/snorkeling trips at the Hyatt pier. Overall, this was a very nice hotel. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place to Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: jds00
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd year my husband and I have stayed at the Hyatt Key West. It is a great place! All staff are super nice and the location is wonderful! Will definately be returning on our next trip to KW!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: collie1228
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Resort for three nights in July (actually we just got home this afternoon - we stayed there last night). Full disclosure - we stayed at no cost on my Hyatt points, but the hotel was great, the restaurant and bar were outstanding, and we really enjoyed the pool all three days. We ate lunch twice at Hyatt's Shor American Seafood Grill, had the burger one day and the club sandwich the next. Hyatt Hotels seem to have cheeseburgers down to a science, as I've never had a bad burger at a Hyatt anywhere in the world. The fries were hot and as good as I've ever had them. Dinner last night (after the sunset sail on Hyatt's sailboat) was excellent as well. I had a flatiron steak and my SO had the lobster tail. Both were great. I can't say enough about the friendly, professional service we received in every part of this hotel. If we were coming back to Key West, we would stay here again without fail. We won't be coming back as we found Key West to be unbelievably touristy, and not the "original" destination we were expecting. (trip report later). A special shout out to Vito, who was on duty as the parking valet and bellman when we checked in. I had a problem with the parking system, and he fixed it and made it right.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay!”
Reviews.Author: beetrvln
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the Hyatt Key West. We had an amazing stay. From the moment we arrived, it was perfect. We were greeted with a glass of complimentary champagne while we checked in. The bellman takes our luggage and that of our best friends and takes us to our rooms, WOW!! It was a birthday celebration weekend, so I booked a Deluxe Gulf Front Room for us and our friends. We were on the 4th floor, the view was amazing. Let's start with the room, we had tiled floors with rugs, so it made it quite warm and inviting. We had 3 sliding doors with 2 balconies which were furnished with nice wicker furniture and small tables. From the bed we had an unobstructed view of the gulf and the boats anchored in the bay. The room also had 2 chairs and a chaise lounge type sofa. We had a flat screen TV, a mini bar with refrigerator. The headboard to the bed ran along the wall and was a shelf with slide outs that hid and housed the ihome for the ipod and telephone. The bathroom was fabulous too, a nice rain shower that was huge and tiled in an ocean blue glass tile. We never want to leave. I had ordered an in room amenity and it was in the rooms when we arrived with a lovely card and instructions that the cold items were in the refrigerator. The service was impeccable our entire stay. We dined at the restaurant on property for breakfast once and again the service was great, dined on the patio next to the water and the food was delicious. We did use the concierge services to make a dinner reservation for us one night and they couldn't have been more helpful. She reserved a great table and then proceeded to give us recommendations on the specialties of the restaurant and which ones to try. This is someone who is familiar with the area and the restaurants and I love that. Self-Parking is available and is included in the daily resort fee, however the lot is small and we had trouble finding parking. But not to worry, the valet opened up the valet parking for us, parked the car and didn't charge us the valet charges, he got a nice tip! We loved the hotel so much that we extended an extra night, cancelled one night in Miami and savored what we could for our last night. Truly we cannot wait to go back, I wouldn't look for anything else in Key West, the Hyatt is the best

Reviews.Title: “MUST Have a Blue Mojito....”
Reviews.Author: jt5506
Reviews.Content: Super clean and friendly staff...great location in Old Town. Partial Ocean view was beautiful but sad that the balcony only seated 2. There were 4 of us. The pool does need some music for ambience as it is somewhat smallish. Beach area small too but I never had a problem finding somewhere to relax and look into the ocean. Take a snorkel set as there are many fish hiding in the beach access. We saw lots hiding around the rocks and even a small, nosey barracuda hanging out. I will go back to this place for sure even if it is just for the blue mojito!

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel, great location, would definitely return ....”
Reviews.Author: AVMJRL
Reviews.Content: Very nice facility. Our room was basic -- we did not splurge on the view so we did not have an ocean view (unless we tilted our heads and stretched). But the room was quite nice. Nice little balcony, free wireless (a necessity for me), and great bathroom (another requirement). And it was quiet at night, which is another plus. The pool is very nice. There's a little beach -- not a great beach but not sure there are great beaches in Key West. There was a lot of seaweed in the water. One big plus was that while the beach was not big, there were docks we could jump off and land in crystal clear blue water. So swimming was definitely available -- you just won't be laying on a beach. There is a nice deck with chairs and umbrellas. We didn't eat at the hotel. Right up the street was a good breakfast place (Two Friends Patio). Parking is free -- and one night they had no spots available due to a wedding and they had to valet park my car. They did not charge for the valet parking in the case, a very nice touch!! Best advantage for this hotel -- location!!! We were able to walk just about everyone. It's maybe 2-3 blocks from Duval Street. Restaurants are all within walking distance. Hotel staff were very nice. They offer jet-skiing tours there. We booked a jet ski tour for a much cheaper rate on Duval Street -- but in retrospect, it might have been better to pay a little more and book at the hotel because no shuttles from one place to another were involved. Only drawback was the small beach but given all the other pluses and the location, and after having looked around for other places while we were there, I would definitely return to the Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “everything about it was over the top!”
Reviews.Author: Bellina7
Reviews.Content: Coming to a wedding here with my handicapped mom had me cautious, but the staff and furnishings were outstanding. The pool was delightful , the bar tremendous and the restaurant superb. The location was quiet and calming, with extra amenities within walking distance. I would go back in a heartbeat!
