Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: royabdo
Reviews.Content: Great location and great service. The employee there out make you feel like you're at home. The Hyatt is also in a great location. You can walk to anything in Key West. If I had to change one thing, it would be the daily parking fees.

Reviews.Title: “I Like the hotel”
Reviews.Author: ladyw98
Reviews.Content: This hotel hands down was great we were greeted very nicely just as we arrived it was my wedding anniversary so we are offered champagne upon arrival and such great service. The breakfast and this hotel is super great loved loved the food their one thing hotel restaurant staff needs to pay closer attention to utensil got a dirty forks but was changed so I was quite happy after all. To my husband and I our room was kind of dirty the floor was tiled but you can see under the bed while sitting down on our lounge chair there was a bit of nasty dusty muck their and the floors could have been cleaner being their large white tiled floors and it will show the dirt much easier so housekeeping needs to do a better job with part of it the floor should always be clean in a hotel room tiled or carpeting and housekeeping did not clean in the morning they cleaned 4pm in afternoon we were promised water every morning we got it a 4pm every day we just overlooked that part of it anyway .I must say this I would stay here again just for the breakfast and the kindness of the staff but I feel rooms need better cleaning personally.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: raceprincess
Reviews.Content: This was to be a very quite vacation. We had requesed a room with a beach view. Instead we were in the very back look over the roof. Only because there were others that had checked in before us and they had requested the same and paid extra money. Even though I had booked the hotel 2 months in advance. Then in the morning we would be woken up by the noise of chickens and by the hotels bird since we were not far from it. Complained and I will say the staff was very nice but never moved us the whole time we stayed there. Very disappointed to say the least.

Reviews.Title: “A Jewel of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SEEZ83
Reviews.Content: We actually held a wedding there. We had been there in November 2010 and our experience was so great we returned and had my daughter's wedding. The hotel itself is great - the rooms are perfect with incredible bathrooms (our many guests staying there were really impressed with the rooms). The pool are was great. Restaurants terrific. Outstanding water views. Little beach where the wedding took place and the function room was super. The Catering Manager, Lindsey Skupski was incredible and made the entire experience memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent. Ideal location. Friendly Staff. Beautiful & Clean Rooms”
Reviews.Author: mauricecano
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel. We were greeted with champagne at check in. Room was spotless, spacious. I would definitely stay here again. We had trouble getting our room safe to open. Hotel staff later sent up a bottle wine for the tiny mishap. Very impressed!

Reviews.Title: “disappointed with check in”
Reviews.Author: Ana214
Reviews.Content: I reserved a King Bed Smoking Room with a balcony for our honeymoon. When we checked in I was told "good news we can accommodate your smoking request but just one small change, it will be a room with 2 double beds. I told them that was not what I reserved and really wanted my King Bed it was our honeymoon afterall. The clerk went and asked a manager for assistance, she was able to give us the King bed we reserved but no smoking room. The only reason I choose this hotel was for the smoking room so I was highly disappointed and requested that if a smoking room became available that we would like to move. No one ever contacted us again on the possibilty of moving. The check in process was slow (the desk clerk was also doing bellman duty which in all honesty I've never seen before.) The room was nice, comfortable bed. The balcony was extremely small, it fit 2 chairs and a small table not worth the extra price. The swimming pool was also very small. The restaurant was excellent, breakfast was awesome and we had one dinner which was delicious as well.

Reviews.Title: “Spended the fourth in Key West....”
Reviews.Author: TamiSue44614
Reviews.Content: As soon as we arrived the service was great......they have access to everything there from watersports to scooters..... Food a litte pricey... But great location. We had a partial gulf view that looked over a public beach.... Over than the view of the homeless people it was nice. Great walking distance to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Chill Out”
Reviews.Author: Happytraveling055
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived on July 3rd around 4pm. The check in cleark was very hospitable and gave us a "get your bearings" mini tour of the property. Our room was spacious, clean and a wonderful ocean breeze greeted us on our balcony. The pool was packed but there was plenty of other water and non-water spots to unwind. We headed down to Duval Street and soon returned to our little oasis (only three blocks away from all the hustle and bussel of Duval Street. We were very pleased with our decision to have dinner on the property on a balcony facing the famous Key West sunset without the crowds of Mallory Square. It rained heavily the next morning which was a perfect excuse to just lay around reading a book with the balcony sliding doors open. Check out via the phone - no issues. Recommed that you pay a bit more (about $20.00 extra) to include breakfast and parking. Definitely recommend this property if you want to be close to the center of downtown Key West but yet feel like you are miles away.

Reviews.Title: “Does it get any better?”
Reviews.Author: ThatGuy131
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at a lot of different hotels all over the country including other Hyatt's and this one was hands down the best. The location is perfect, just a five minute walk from all the action/attractions/restaurants on Duval street but its almost like a gated community as once you are there its very quiet. The hotel staff are all amazing, as it was our first time in Key West we needed someone to ask all of those stupid questions and the staff was happy to help. The room we got, a King Salon, was huge and had an amazing view of the pool and ocean. It had two balconies, an impressive bathroom/shower, and enough space to hold a party. The American Shor restaurant was very good, but pricey as would be expected for an on property location. We also got dessert at the Blue Mojito which is billed as a restaurant but is just a bar located poolside, none the less the food and drinks were great. The concierge was very helpful in making reservations and recommendations. We didn't rent a car but there appeared to be ample parking, and there was an onsite bike rack which was very helpful for the bikes we rented. We loved the Blue Heaven restaurant for breakfast, Fogarty's was a solid pick, Kermits on Elizabeth for Key Lime Pie, Cheeseburger on Duval for what might be the best burger on the island, Uppercrust for very good but expensive pizza, tried El Siboney which is billed as amazing and cheap Cuban food but we didn't love it and it wasn't that cheap. Getting in the water while you are there is a must, we made it up to Bahia Honda beach on Big Pine and took a trip with Fury Watersports both were worth the time/money.

Reviews.Title: “Worth Every Penny”
Reviews.Author: KANSASSOONER
Reviews.Content: Just simply a great place to stay. My wife and I stayed 6 nights and had zero complaints. Big,clean,quiet room with a comfy king bed. Loved the pool area and the staff was very friendly and helpful. Location was close , but not to close, to everything OLD TOWN KEYWEST. You can find cheaper, but not better!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a Wedding”
Reviews.Author: jodywarc
Reviews.Content: We recently held our daugher's wedding at the Hyatt Resort and Spa. It was one of the best decisions this family ever made. Lindsey S., our coordinator, made it a wonderful experience. Everything was beautiful and ran as smooth as silk. The staff was professional, helpful and kind. I can't say enough good things about Lindsey. She is truely a pro. In fact all of the staff was wonderful. The facility couldn't have been more beautiful. The rooms were awesome. The wedding was unforgetable.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CAMDVM
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous hotel with big light rooms which have been excellently designed. Lovely pool area with a tiny but attractive beach. Excellent location â€“ Friendly Staff â€“ Would definitely return Good restaurants - Pricey â€“ Bagatelle / Louisâ€™ Backyard (for the views) / Nine One Five / Mangia Mangia Good Restaurants â€“ Reasonably priced â€“ Blue Heaven / Two Friends Patio / Roof Top CafÃ© / Mangia Mangia Good Trips â€“ Seaplane to DryTortugas National Park / Danger Charters Wind and Wine Sunset Tour

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: renard8450
Reviews.Content: We rented a Harley in Miami and biked down to Key West. Since space on the bike was limited we shipped the majority of our clothing down in advance. Slight concern when we arrived at 8 pm and were told that our FedEx box was locked in a manager's office but must have been a misunderstanding because it was quickly retrieved. Front desk staff were great though. Caitlin and Stacy even shipped our clothing box back home for us instead of making us haul it to a FedEx! The room was clean, spacious and overlooked a tiny beach area. Our fridge wasn't all that cold and we were concerned about keeping some seafood leftovers in it overnight. Called down to the front desk and they said it was a "cooler", not a fridge (which is what Hyatt.com calls it) and that it would only keep cold things cold. We put the seafood in with a bucket full of ice and it was plenty cold by morning. Maid service was probably the worst part of the hotel. A few unusual things weren't cared for that usually are taken care of in hotels of that class. For example, the ice bucket had a little water left in it after we dumped the ice and it was just left near the TV as is. We were running out quickly one day and I left up the ironing board because we were late. The board was left in the middle of the foyer and they just cleaned around it. The bathroom and linens were clean though, which was much more important to me than having to take down an ironing board when we got back that day. Only other problem with the maid service was our last day. We had arranged a late checkout of one extra hour with the front desk. Front desk staff were very accomodating but at exactly noon the maid was banging on the door telling us we had to get out. When we told her it had been cleared with the front desk she told us she was going to verify that, in a tone that sounded like she didn't trust us one bit. Didn't try the bar or restaurant but had room service one morning and it was fine. Portions are huge - my husband and I really should have split one meal instead of ordering two (particularly since it cost $55 for two meals, coffee and a hot chocolate!) We had a boat excursion the day we ordered room service so we indicated on the tag that we'd need it at 7 am and they were very prompt with delivery. The grounds are well cared for, including a few cute pools of turtles who can been seen basking in the sun. Didn't use the pool area but it looked clean. The fitness center looked modern and of adequate size. The absolutely best part of this hotel is it's location. It's not on Duvall so you don't get the noise but it's only a block away. It's closest to the most popular spots on Duvall (Sloppy Joes, Hog's Breath, Captain Tony's). We also walked to Mallory Square, and the Harborwalk (starts by A&B Lobster House) . The surrounding area feels very safe and the hotel must have been well insulated because even being near a few bars it was still very quiet at night. There's a $20 resort fee but they don't nickel and dime you for everything else once you get there. Parking was included, wifi included and we even had a few waters left in our room each day. We were there during Memorial Day weekend so we didn't get a deal but I'd absolutely stay nowhere else if we returned to Key West again!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: mre1154
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and efficient, and they reflected the casualness of Key West. (It's the first hotel I've ever been to where everyone at the registration desk was seated.) The prices were good because of the off-season, and for a small additional amount we upgraded to a room with an oceanfront view. The room was spacious, nicely-appointed and comfortable. The bathroom had very modern fixtures; no bathtub but a great shower with a ceiling nozzle and a hand-held wand. The hotel is conveniently located to Mallory Square, the site of the sunset festivities, and many points of interest in Key West. We were able to walk wherever we wanted to go. The hotel has a pool, hot tub and many other nice amenities which we did not have an opportunity to use. My only criticism is that the hotel did not have a business center; computers for guests are located in the gift shop, which closes at 5PM, and there is a charge to use them. Nevertheless, we had a very enjoyable trip, in large part, because of the high quality of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: tina_9336
Reviews.Content: Great view from room. Excellent hospitality! Very gracious. Wonderful water sport opportunity on site

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: Losfortunatos
Reviews.Content: the rooms are really nice, the breakfast is good, the staff is helpful and polite, the view from our room was not exceptional; all in one it is a good hotel but not a fantastic one

Reviews.Title: “Awesome, as expected”
Reviews.Author: Cjlego
Reviews.Content: Ocean front, bay view. Small pool, easy access to the bars and restaurants. Expensive though.

Reviews.Title: “Right in Old Town”
Reviews.Author: mama4llama
Reviews.Content: The location of this beautiful hotel is perfect to just wander the old section of Key West. We were upgraded to a partial sea view..nice, but room was a tad small by Hyatt standards. Still very comfortable. When I booked the room with 2 beds, I mistakenly thought 2 queens not 2 doubles. I spoke with the front desk and they quickly brought up a very comfortable rollaway bed for our daughter...thanks. The beds were comfortable, room was clean, and it's location is just out of the noise of the bars, but a easy walk to restaurants and shops. Free Wifi with good easy access.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: brenbury
Reviews.Content: I honestly have nothing negative to say about my stay here. The grounds are beautiful, the hotel itself is well maintained, the rooms are modern and clean, the service is very friendly and the view is amazing! At this hotel, it is definitely worth asking for an ocean view. It is only a few blocks away from the famous Mallory Square which means you get to view the sunset that everyone raves about right at the hotel. Each room also has a small private patio with a table and two chairs. However, if you can't see it from your room you could also walk to the upper deck (above SHOR) for a great view. On that note, the location is also spectacular. It's tucked away in a quiet, cozy corner but is only a short walking distance away from many great restaurants and attractions. You can also rent scooters, electric cars, or jet skis right on the premises. Parking is a little tight, many times there were only one or two spots available and that was mid-week. The restaurants on site had tempting menus, but we chose to leave the property for our meals so I can't rate them. There is also a spa on site, which I never had the chance to try. In addition, there is a whirlpool and a small pool, but the pool is relatively shallow (3'9" at it's deepest). After walking around Key West for hours, the whirlpool was definitely appreciated. Overall, our experience here was great and I would definitely recommend it to friends. The hotel's representation of itself is accurate, which as an avid traveler I find is often not the case.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: LondonTealady
Reviews.Content: On check-in we were given a wonderfully warm welcome by the lovely Stacey who upgraded us to a seaview room (as I'm a Diamond member). The room was huge with amazing views, and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. I'd recommend getting breakfast at the hotel as getting on the veranda overlooking the sea is a beautiful way to start the day. The location is very great too - a very short walk from the hoi polloi which ensures maximum convenience with maximum tranquility. One small issue was dealt with thoughtfully and efficiently by the general manager. If you're going to Key West, I'd thoroughly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: rohothegrinder
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the Hyatt Key West twice now and each time was excellent. I can only give top accolades to the hotel and the staff. It isn't cheap, but you are in the middle of paradise, so that doesn't come cheap. Some of the best money I have ever spent. Anyone that complains about this place has to have other issues as our experience was sweet.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here”
Reviews.Author: Andy_Kirsty71
Reviews.Content: Our two night stay at the Hyatt Key West Resort and Spa exceeded our expectations. The check-in was a very friendly experience, and this friendly, positive approach is what we experienced from all the hotel staff during our short stay. The hotel resort is nicely planned out in a great spot in Key West - close enough to all the action in Duval Street (5 mins walk) and in a perfect spot to enjoy the Key West sunsets. The hotel offered lots of nice touches - on one afternoon, around 4.30pm, there were free drinks and canopies; on another, an acoustic guitarist (Gary Hempsey) sat on a stool at the poolside bar and played for around two hours - a perfect soundtrack to relax and watch the sun go down. They have some good craft beers on at this bar too - unusual for a hotel bar - and a great 'two for one' offer on these! There are also discounts and freebies at the hotel Shor restuaurant and at the spa, plus free wi-fi and free parking. The rooms are a good size, and well appointed with, again, some nice touches, such as an iPod/iPhone dock hifi. Would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: gratamama5173
Reviews.Content: We were hear for a 10-year anniversary trip. Despite a freak situation where the hot tub serously discolored my swim suit (the hotel apologized, quickly took care of the matter and attempted to reimburse us) the trip was fantastic. The staff was exceptional, the location is the perfect combination of being nearby everything and away from the craziness... Rooms are well appointed, toiletries are of good quality and I love the pool area. (Pool bar is really cute, but never gets too jazzy) Recommend the massages!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: 60811Kathy
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay - the resort was just what winter-weary travelers from Baltimore needed. The service was especially attentive and friendly. The location was very convenient. We booked a PURE allergy-free room without realizing how wonderful that would be. By day 2 we both noticed a difference in how we felt and breathed - what a wonderful surprise! We plan to return as soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Very Very Good!!!”
Reviews.Author: 409Traveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spend our 5th wedding anniversary here and we loved every minute of it! The rooms have been updated in a cool contemporary style, loved the finishes and how spacious they are! Their service is very good and they even gave us complimentary champagne and chocolate dipped strawberries to celebrate during our stay!!! That just topped it all off! :) Swimming pool, jacuzzi, bar lounge, and beach area are terrific!

Reviews.Title: “Very luxe but sensible (considering)!”
Reviews.Author: LucyMcdoodle
Reviews.Content: This is a cool resort in a tight location. Swank mini lobby to check in, resident parrot Odie, turtle pools, hot tub swimming pool, floating dock with lounges, chic bar/grill (a little hard to see kids in pool from seating area though), beach lounge are with an enchanting step down to gulf. They put up with my dog,too, for $35, and let her sit by the lounges. There are plenty of shading areas, too. Rooms are small but really nice. My only caution would be to rest bikes a little early since they have to deliver bikes to hotel. In fact, consider getting bikes offsite.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: destinawoof
Reviews.Content: ALL GOOD!! Clean, comfortable, quaint, great service, super location, nice pool and bar areas, yummy food, friendly staff, on-site water activities, balconies, comfortable bed, modern decor, safe in room. Food is pricey! One down fall is NO beach (just a tiny area to get in the water)....but you have to expect that in Key West. Location is 1 block away from Mallaroy Square and Duval Street. We loved our stay and did not want to leave. ENJOY!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel”
Reviews.Author: elizabethmacdonald
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and it was the best hotel I have ever stayed at. Great room, great service, perfect location in Key West to walk everywhere. Very very clean well-furnished room. The turtle pond was amazing. My only "complaint" was that the pool was a bit on the small side.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sbayley
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hyatt for four days in March during spring break. The staff are extremely pleasant from cleaners to front desk. We simply couldn't have been made more at home. The location of the hotel is fantastic and we could walk to Duval and all the craziness in a few minutes. The only downside to the hotel, that we could see, was that the pool area is a slim spot between two buildings and so the only sun on the pool happens from about 9am-1pm and then it's gone. They do have a nice deck area on the water, though, and you can enjoy afternoon sun there as long as you can snag a lounge chair.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding property and service”
Reviews.Author: Ohio_Jeff
Reviews.Content: We experienced all of the good things and none of the negative things that previous reviewers mentioned. The location, facilities, and staff were outstanding. Special callouts to Daneille (Food and Bev Manager), Ash (HR manager), Dan (Shor Restaurant Manager) and the General Manager whom we met at the Wednesday Manager's reception (complimentary food and drinks). The great service started with a glass of champagne in the lobby during check-in. It continued as the staff sent wine and chocolate covered strawberries to our room for our anniversary and generally went out of their way to make it a special time for us. One area for improvement from my wife: brighter lights in the bathroom (makeup issue).

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: trudysmom666
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the lovely Hyatt for its location & were not disappointed. We could walk to everything. The room was beautiful & the bathroom spa like.. Only problem I could see was there is not enough room at the pool.

Reviews.Title: “I Had High Expectations...”
Reviews.Author: YoungOldGuy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 1 week and the hotelâ€™s location is indeed perfect. We couldnâ€™t have asked for a more beautiful spot in Key West and it is close to everything. Wife liked the Spa. The facility itself is very attractive and the staff was very responsive and helpful. I think they were exceptional. The place has great â€˜curb appealâ€™. But, I was bothered by more than a few things that really shouldnâ€™t happen at a 4 Star Hyatt property. The room was nice but after about an hour of walking around on the marble tile floor the bottom of my white socks looked like Iâ€™d been walking around on the street without shoes. Iâ€™m not talking about the â€˜white gloveâ€™ test. And Iâ€™m a guy so it takes something pretty dramatic to appear on the bottom of my socks to cause me to wonder what the rest of the surfaces are like. A large door on the dresser was broken and hanging by 1 hinge. Toilet seat was falling off. The ceiling fan could hardly be used at the lowest speed because it was so out of whack. 3 cribs/packâ€“n-plays were delivered to the room before we got one that wasnâ€™t broken. There is no fridge in the room but the hotel quickly provided one when asked but it looked like the bait fridge in your local walmart. Inside was beat up and cracked w/ no shelf. It really looked nasty. The furniture definitely had more than its share of wet rear ends from people going from the pool to the cloth couch and the water marks werenâ€™t very appealing. I donâ€™t know what the other hotels are like in Key West. For all I know, this could be the cream of the crop. It definitely has the potential to be exceptional. I was disappointed but if youâ€™re going to be let down you might as well experience it at a beautiful location with a cold drink and great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Would Not Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: Kim9
Reviews.Content: We have been travelling for 3 weeksin Florida from Miami & Everglades & now the Keys. I trawled for hours for our accomodation & funnily enough Key West was the place I had more of a wrestle with the choices, against the Gulf view hotels & the rather pretty town B&B's. So on balance (& with TA reviews) we decided on the Hyatt as we preferred the gulf view. We had a lovely deluxe Gulf view room with 2 balconies. Our room was large with sofas & chairs, the bed was really comfy. The bathroom was good with a great shower. The hotel has been updated although they must start to keep on top of the maintenance. One thing which was annoying was the paper cups in the room for making tea & coffee - never known anything like it - always had china cups, we had glasses for drinks so there isn't any logic. The hotel itself is well located, the staff are nice - but the other guests - goodness they are loud and not discrete. As previously commented guests are out early putting towels on loungers - which isn't fair play, it didn't matter to us tho, these people obviously want as much sun as possible & it shows with their leathery skin. Guest hang out in the pool & spa pool with their drinks.... We didn't use the restaurant as we dined elsewhere. We would have stayed in the Hyatt which was adults only but it looked tired - we stayed here because we mistakenly thought it would be reasonably stylish but it isn't. Tyre (Tire) conventions, hen weekends etc - you get the picture. We have stayed in some stylish accomodation on our travels but we were disapointed - the hotel could be all it pretends to be but needs to alter the clientel it attracts. The room was good though.

Reviews.Title: “I love Key West”
Reviews.Author: DarlingJJ
Reviews.Content: I have been there 2 times. I stayed at this hotel one time. The location is good. You can go to see sunset easily. The winter season sometimes its windy but still fun. The food at the hotel is delicious. Especially breakfast. And also the staffs are friendly. I want to come back there again soon!

Reviews.Title: “O.K.”
Reviews.Author: pattig65
Reviews.Content: I ran away to Key West for a week to relax and have fun! Booked my room through a travel agent which I'll never do again. Based on my room rate - I expected a little more. Some staff were extremely nice and helpful, some seemed like you were bothering them!!! Room was nice but backed up to local beach that housed the homeless. Also the dumpster - whoopee! Not exactly quiet. Was also next to the elevator - busy traffic. The weather happened to turn cold and it sounded like I was back in the Northeast with the wind howling through the corridor and under the door. We were without hot water one afternoon while they replaced the boiler - I would have thought they could arrange to do it late at night. Room was not always dusted; one day was not serviced at all - at 5 p.m. i called and finally at 6 p.m. someone showed up and did a "hit or miss" job. Oh, and that free glass of champage - I would have thought room service would have picked up the glass by the 2 (I finally dumped the dregs) or 3rd day....I think it was the 4th or 5th day when we finally put it in the hallway on one of the leftover room service trays that seemed to stay in the hallway. The staff was o.k. but I have had MUCH better service elsewhere and was treated more courteously at many other places I have stayed in the last 40 years. I realize that food is expensive today and expected that in Key West. But at the Hyatt although their breakfast was excellent....their price could break anyone's budget especially if they have a family. We chose to eat out for our other meals and they were also excellent and well worth what we spent! There was no place to grab a quick cup of coffee or a sandwich if you came back from sightseeing. And no where to grab a drink if you wanted - when the weather turned cold since everything is outside. I must also admit that I expected the Hyatt to have a courtesy van but they didn't. It would have helped with transportation and saved on taxi fares. I guess I just expected more from a Hyatt - and I definitely didn't get that here! I liked the location - but when I return to Key West, I will most definitely stay somewhere else!!!! I loved Key West, the restaurants, the locals we met, the roosters in the street and the fabulous sunsets! Just not the Hyatt!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelsharker
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this Hyatt and had a wonderful experience. The hotel has an unbeatable location. It's close to everything in old town (bars, restaurants, Mallory Square), but it's far enough from the cruise terminal to still be quiet. The staff was excellent at check-in. Very friendly. I was a little nervous when we checked in and got a room next to the elevator, but it was very quiet and we slept very well. The rooms were updated and modern. We loved the large shower. The bed was very comfortable and the whole room was very clean. The amenities at this hotel were great. We had a great breakfast at the restaurant and really enjoyed the hotel bar. The pool area is very nice and we LOVED the turtle pond! Overall, it's a little pricey but we really enjoyed the resort!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Venue Close To All”
Reviews.Author: Keywestfanyeahh
Reviews.Content: We had our wedding here on the beach. The staff, and particularly the Wedding Coordinator, Ava Marinitti were all class acts. They truly went above and beyond to make ours a special day. We had a deluxe ocean front room with a balcony. The SHOR restaurant is fantastic with a broad range of offerings. Alonzo's and Berlins is right off property with excellent food as well. Duval Street is a short walk away, but far enough that you're not subjected to drunken revelers at 2am. The property itself is quiet, so if you are looking for the afforementioned revelry, you won't find it here. The margaritas are probably the best in Key West. Go to the Rum Barrel for the best Pina Colada.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: BigBabyBryan
Reviews.Content: Let me say that the front desk staff was exceptional.....very helpful, very knowledgeable, and friendly. The location is perfect for walking anywhere in Old Town and the room, itself, was clean and comfortable. My complaint is the price for the balcony (which was almost closet size) and the non-existant "view" -- an enclosed outside stairway and a few palm fronds growing out of the concrete below. I would expect a $300.00 plus price for a room with something to view but to pay that much and have nothing to see is to pay too much in my book.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great location....”
Reviews.Author: beachbum1004
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my girlfriend from Christmas to New Years 2011. The hotel is very nice. We were in room 3301. The room was a Gulf Front King. It was very nice. Great views. Very nice pool bar with drink service. Very fast drink service. I would stay here again. Great location, right near everything. Walking distance to everything. We read the reviews and we did need to get to the pool early to reserve chairs. That's was we did and it worked out fine

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Great services. Great location. Nice amenities.”
Reviews.Author: adgillispie
Reviews.Content: Would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Key West for any reason. The location is perfect (just a few blocks off Duval). The staff is helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: geronti
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel right on the water. There is no beach front other than a small man-made sandy area, but the hotel's pool is excellent. However, in the evening they have a fire on their small "beach" and it is really great in the cooler months. The location of the hotel is very convenient, very close to Duval St. and all the bars and restaurants, but it still feels away from the main street noise and traffic. The room was very comfortable, and the hotel staff was helpful and accommodating. They have excellent breakfast! The resort provides lots of options for water activities, as well as bike and scooter rentals. They make these arrangements through their gift shop, but the only complaint we had while staying there was that these arrangements never quite worked out on time or as promised. I would recommend arranging such plans directly with the businesses providing the services, and cutting the gift shop out of it. They just never got it right the first time for us. Other than that, the Hyatt Resort and Spa was great, we will definitely plan to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Too Short of a Stay!”
Reviews.Author: SDRivergirl
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here for only one night and we wish we would have made it longer! Key West is a charming and great town and the Hyatt is a wonderful place to stay. There is a small beach that is exclusive to the Hyatt. Although, it is rocky and not that kind to the feet. BUT..... take a swim out to the dock and enjoy the weather water and sun from there. We LOVED it! The grounds of the hotel are beautiful. The pool area is great and the service was wonderful. The room was large and the bathroom was awesome! I hope to make it back to Key West and I will definitely stay at the Hyatt!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: bddden
Reviews.Content: The best review I could give this hotel is that my husband loved it and he hates every hotel I book. The service was superior. The room spacious and very clean. We had a smoking room because my husband likes to smoke cigars(ugh) but while in this room I did not smell smoke from a previous guest nor while we were there. They use a air purifier called PUREROOM. The weather was lousy, but we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: made2worship
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying at this hotel. The service was great, room was big. It was also convenient with walking distance to many restaurants. They don't have much beach. It is better to go to the other public beaches. Will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel and great location!”
Reviews.Author: Addicated_to_SBH
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property last weekend for 1 night after visiting the W=A across the island, and I became a big, BIG fan of this property. A small place, but they upgraded me to a suite with 2 balconies and a large bathroom. The bar was really cool, and they allowed me to turn up the volume so that I could watch the Bedlam football game in style. The location is one of the best on the island....a 5-minute walk to Mallory Square and Sloppy Joe's, a great marina attached where we rented a jet-ski boat for 1 hour for about $170....a cool way to see the ships and the local area. The breakfast was absolutely off the charts....didn't eat dinner there but the breakfast was one of the best I have had in a while. The pool was small but heated, with a big jacuzzi and fast drink service....a really cool place to chill with some cool beats on the speakers. I am not a regular at Hyatts, but I was so impressed with this property that I got the Hyatt credit card and am planning on making Hyatt a part of my travel options in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Best All-Around Hotel in Key West”
Reviews.Author: teddyrex
Reviews.Content: We had been to Key West twice for a few hours each on cruise ship stops and had looked at various hotels because we always planned to return and spend a few days which we did in late November. Being Hilton Diamond and Hyatt Diamond we had planned to stay at one of these in downtown Key West. The former Hilton is now a Weston so we decided on this Hyatt and I am so glad we did! What a beautiful hotel! It is very convenient and close to Duval Street and Mallory Square but far enough removed to be peaceful and quiet. Our room was huge - called a Salon Suite and the huge wrap around balconies (two) provided magnificent water views. As other reviewers have said, the bathroom was large and fabulous - rainfall shower and separate tub. The bed was wonderful! SHOR. the hotel's restaurant provided a delicious breakfast but the dinner menu was pretty limited and there are numerous wonderful restaurants nearby - one of the best restaurants we have been to in all of Florida (and we live here!) is right across the street - the A & B Lobster House. In summary, the Hyatt Key West Resort and Spa is a terrific hotel and offers beautiful surroundings and wonderful service! We can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MWestNewJersey
Reviews.Content: Location is perfect, close to everything but far enough away for some peace. No beach but nice pool and dock area for sun. Restaurant is excellent. Gym is perfect. Staff is great. Spa was very nice. Rooms are really nice bathrooms are big with a hugh shower, free bottle water daily. Overall this is a great Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but I think we could have done better for the cost”
Reviews.Author: miiamiia
Reviews.Content: Location was great, but we spent a lot of money on our room and overall would have expected more. Pool area was small and in the shade for most of the day, better to eat out than at Hyatt, we got champagne upon arrival but the person who was supposed to show us to our room disappeared, there was almost always room service trays left out for hours in the hallways, some gym equipment was broken, felt that there should be free bicycles for guests to use. Check the cruise ship calendar before booking your stay, the crowds really impact your trip once you leave the hotel. If we go to KW again, we would stay elsewhere unless we got a great deal here.

Reviews.Title: “Tropcial atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: basvince
Reviews.Content: First of al welcome with champagne! Very nice staff who showed us our room in building 3 overseeing the parking lot of nextdoors beach. Unfortunately that was also the parking lot where a lot of key wests homeless people like to stay. So a bit noisy during the evenings, but the police came every evening to send them away because it wasn't allowed to sleep on the beach. The rooms are very spacious and very modern and light decor. The bathroom is wonderfull with a rainshower! Unfortunately we only had (very!) hot water and no cold water from the tap. We suspected that the cleaninglady had long black hair, because everywhere in our room we could find long black hairs, every day! The cleanliness could have been better! We stayed at the hyatt in mid-november when it was kinda breezy. Because the rooms are outdoors the wind was coming under the door and gave a lot of noise. But for the rest this place is heaven on earth. Nice relaxt atmosphere, good restaurant and fair prices! Dont expect much of the hotelbeach, its only as big for 2 beds! But you can lie next to the pool and hottub.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome views”
Reviews.Author: fredandandrea07
Reviews.Content: We loved our trip to Key West. And finding our hotel on hotwire was a STEAL! We got the room just for the night for $79! The amenities were awesome. Spacious bathroom, king size bed with a small balcony overlooking the gulf. GREAT value, helpful staff and wonderful trip! Highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JMITCH77
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hyatt Key West Resort and Spa twice and give it two thumbs up! Location is perfect, setting is amazing and the staff is super friendly. Two small notes: The hotel pool is a little small but it does not change my opinion, I love it! We were upgraded to a suite but it was not a typical two room suite that you would expct, it had chairs in a large room. View was amazing!!!! Breakfast at the hotel was great and drinks at the bar were also top notch. Can't wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “The worse Sunday brunch of my life!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I did not stay at this hotel, but a friend and I attended our 2nd annual Fantasy Fest this year in Key West. We both saw an add from the Hyatt advertising a Sunday Brunch celebration ending of Fantasy Fest. The price $31.00 per person. This was to include decorations and special dishes prepared by the Chef to be in conjunction with this years theme. We called a day in advance to make reservations and were told the earliest we could get in was 1:00 p.m. We accepted this time and arrived on schedule. We choose to eat outdoors and are server was very nice. Once we were seated and the server took our drink order we proceeded inside for our food selections. What I saw made me stop in my tracks! There were four iron skillets sitting with covered lids on them with scrambled egges, bacon, sasuage, and potato wedges, I look over to the next area and see two more skillets one with chicken hot wings and breaded popcorn shrimp that looked like it came off a cheap Chinese Buffett! With the exception of some fresh fruit, dried ceral, and to add more insult cold cut roast beef finger sandwiches that looked like they had been leftover from a banquet event the night before, this was their $31.00 per person Sunday Brunch! Desert was just as bad! Cheap store bought deserts that tasted like they had been stored in the refrigerator for days. Oh and for the decorated Fantasy Fest theme to end Fantasy Fest. They had placed a cheap plastic kids trick or treat pumkin by the entry of the front door. For Hyatt standards very very disapponted. After $64.00 plus tip I left and would not ever dine here again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel. Best view in Key West”
Reviews.Author: blonde83
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel. The pool has an incredible view. Food was great. Walking distance to Duval Street. The rooms are pricey but worth it. Would for sure stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The best client service that I have experienced at a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kerry-312
Reviews.Content: Was greeted with Champagne at check-in, offered an upgrade well worth the $35 and escorted to the elevators that led to our room. Was pleasantly surprised by size of the room, the furnishings, finishes and finally not one, but two balconies over looking the water. Everyone we encountered was friendly creating a welcoming environment completed with the pools of turtles that I found hard to resist feeding. Perfect location that was a short walk from EVERYTHING yet far enough away (two blocks) that we were secluded. Will definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent service, beautiful resort!”
Reviews.Author: khubbard12
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent several days in the Florida Keys and booked our hotels through Priceline. We lucked out to get a night at the Hyatt in Key West...the hotel and our stay here was amazing! The resort overlooked the water with beautiful views of the bay. The rooms were clean with modern decor and amazing spa showers. We enjoyed drinks at the Blue Mojito bar by the pool and enjoyed the lounge chairs by the pool. I was able to get a deep tissue massage at the resort's spa while I was there and it was one of the best massages I have ever had! Erin, the massage therapist was wonderful! The resort was located right near all of the Key West restaurants and attractions, so we were able to walk everywhere! Our only drawback to the resort was the $20 resort fee that we were not aware of until check-out since we did not book our room through the resort. The fee included pool towels, bottled water (that we didn't drink because did not know they were included), and wireless internet (which was very slow.) It seemed like the high cost of the rooms should have covered those items. Otherwise, the resort was the highlight of our trip in the Keys. It was a beautiful resort and we would love to go back again!

Reviews.Title: “IT was great”
Reviews.Author: Dp2278
Reviews.Content: Loved the stay at Hyatt. They accomadadted every need for children. We got extra room service for our room with out asking for it. The house keeping was on top of making sure our room was stocked with extras. Would go to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Abolutely Marvelous”
Reviews.Author: TerRon19
Reviews.Content: I do not have one negative thing to say about this hotel....We stayed in off season so the rates were not too bad. The bathroom was huge. The maid service was excellant. The outside pool and bar and beach area were nice. It was especially cool to sit out there at dark. The entire hotel was clean, clean, clean. We had a room on the fourth floor with a gulf view overlooking the pool. This was our fourth year in Key West but our first stay at the Hyatt and I am sure we will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Super time at the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: randinc
Reviews.Content: Started with a Priceline room and upgraded to ocean view because we were celebrating an anniversary. Wow, what a room, corner suite with two balconies. Worth every cent. Staff sent us a bottle of wine and tray of chocolates one evening. The resort is right at the end of old town, block or so to Duvall Street and Mallory Square where all the activity is. Self parking is included in the resort fee. The pool is very nice, two restaurants on site. Housekeeping efficient, everyone you met had a ready smile and and was anxious to answer your questions. I've always had excellent experience with Hyatt but this one just raised the bar. Top notch in every way. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but SO nice!”
Reviews.Author: Kittehgrl
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Hyatt Key West resort and spa, and had a fabulous time. I have few complaints about the hotel itself, except for the cost. Of course the room is beautiful, and we had a nice, albeit, small balcony with a nice view, but it was very costly considering that we had only a cooler/ no refrigerator, no microwave, and it was a room, not a suite. The bath was what appeared to be a handicapped accessible shower only, and it was huge and nice, but for the fact that their was no door on it, and any water that splashes on you invariably splashes out onto the marble floor, where if you don't put down a towel, or bath mat, you will promptly fall and break your non-handicapped hip. But it was worth having luxurious digs in a good location in Key West. The bed was spectacular. I think the linens were sent straight from Heaven. It was the most comfortable sleeping I had in all of Florida. The pool and bar area were lovely. The lighting throughout the hotel was tasteful, as was all the decor. The ambient music in the main office could be a little overpowering at times, and I felt myself going into a trance there at one point, but snapped to finally and escaped out the door to dinner. It was quiet, comfortable and generally beautiful. I did take note that I didn't see a staff member that appeared to be over 25, and did feel a bit of an old fogy, but they were all very sweet, and not totally in a "children of the corn" kind of way. The hotel was within walking distance of Duval Street, one of the main attractions of Key West, but far enough away to not be right in the center of things on the more noisy evenings. I'm sure there are places to be had with better views, and perhaps even parts of our hotel had better views, but we spent most of our time out of the hotel, and it was simply luxurious comfort when we were there. Pricey but a decent location, and a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection in Key West”
Reviews.Author: legend16
Reviews.Content: Best location, really nice and easy-going staff, the restaurant served excellent food. This is the best hotel in Key West!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely the best resort in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Kyle5599
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from a 4 night stay at the Hyatt in Key West, and we loved every second of it. I still have no idea how this resort is ranked #11 out of 38 on TripAdvisor. We walked past almost every other resort on the island, and have stayed at a few others and none of them were even as close to as nice as the Hyatt. The location is perfect, a 2 minute walk from Mallory Square, but a little bit off of Duvall Street so you don't get all the noise from tons of cars and people walking by. All of the staff that we interacted with were 100% friendly and took care of everything that we asked for, and the room itself was awesome. Great size, ocean view, comfortable bed, flatscreen tv, fridge...there really isn't anything else that we could have asked for. I have to say that we did book the hotel through Hotwire and got an amazing deal, so I don't know if we would be as willing to pay the standard 350 a night that it is on other websites. But for what we paid, it was an absolute steal. The only bad thing I would say is the pool is a little bit small, but the pool area had plenty of chairs, and there is a really nice hot tub right next to the pool. Also, the beach area isn't very big, but it's pretty cool. The water is super clear, there are almost no waves, and you can actually do some decent snorkeling right there. A few of the guests actually had a manatee come up to them when they were out there, but unfortunately we didn't see any while we were out there. Anyway, I guess the bottom line is that I would 100% recommend the Hyatt, and I will definitely try to stay there the next time I go to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for a romantic get away!”
Reviews.Author: ans1723
Reviews.Content: This resort had the best front desk staff I have ever dealt with. So friendly and so very, very accomadoting. The best way to describe the room is cozy and cute! Loved the small patio with bistro set available in our that gave us THE best view of a Key West sunset. You are walking distance from all of the shopping, restaurants and pubs. I read that there are wild turtles around the resort and to be honest, was a little dissapointed with the display and ended up feeling a little bad for the turtles. =) If I were them, jazz it up for the turtles and patrons...especially if you are going to advertise them! Considering that's my only complaint, it was a GREAT stay indeed!

Reviews.Title: “Key West Paradise :)”
Reviews.Author: SharonM24
Reviews.Content: Great place! Location is excellent.. great service and staff. Wouldnt expect any less from a Hyatt

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway for two”
Reviews.Author: bower007
Reviews.Content: From check-in to check-out, the staff was polite and accommodating; we did not eat in the hotel restaurant so I can not speak for the staff there. The room was spacious and clean; housekeeping did a good job although their hours seemed strange some days. The bed was comfortable and the shower in the bathroom was HUGE! The location related to the shopping, restaurants and night life was good; the hotel is only a few blocks from Duval Street and Mallory Square. The pool was adequate, but if you're looking forward to the hotel's beach front area you'll be disappointed. The beach area is about the size of a few blankets laid next to each other; very small and rocky (dead coral?). Our stay was very relaxing and quiet; the patrons were mostly couples and groups of friends but there were a few families with children. The snorkeling trip which leaves from the hotels pier is awesome; I can't recommend them enough. If we ever visit Key West again (which I plan to), I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lacks Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Deanasorg
Reviews.Content: We had always wanted to stay here and when I booked I mentioned I was not sure after resding reviews if this would be good for us. We could have stayed three nights but left after the first night. Small room, beds are terrible , hotel didnt care I tried to rent bikes throught them no call back I asked for more towels took an hour. Needs to take lessons from some of the other chain resorts with customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a mini-facelift”
Reviews.Author: ExplorerfromFlorida
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews and got a recommendation from a friend before booking. It is not bad as far as hotels, but not what I expect from a Hyatt. When I mentined that the property is looking a little haggard to the front desk on check-out, the guy told me "yeah, it needs some updating"! What I liked: close to the action of Mallory Square, but not right on top of it like the Westin. Parking was included in my rate of $155 (govt discount) and that is awesome. We did upgrade to a partial ocean view for $40 more a night. The room is modern with everything....flat screen tv, big bed, cool furnishings. What I didn't like: Curtains had holes where the pin to the sliding glass door had cut it over time...neglect....and scrub that darn shower...the grout was moldy! (The shower is cool, though and the kids like the rain faucet. Probably looked great a few years ago when first installed.) No use of any business computer...you have to pay! how ridiculous in this day and age. Oh, and the gift shop is the only place that sells snacks. It closes at 5pm! So, there is one vending machine that took our dollar. What are kids supposed to do in the eve?? Had to walk to CVS about 3 blocks away for candy. Used fitness center....nice equipment, but the monitors were all messed up. some audio worked a little and the others didn't. On the one and only bike, the audio-video didn't work at all. Ugh! There is no beach to speak of.....but, that is Key West for ya. Ate at Pepe's for breakfast...awesome. And, at the Conch House for lunch...try the cracked conch...awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: GethersUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights while in Key West. It's a large resort hotel with excellent facitlities and pleasant grounds (which of course comes at a price!). The room was nicely decorated and a decent size, with a small balcony. It has a good sized swimming pool and has a small private beach area. It is in an ideal location - an easy walk to Mallory Square and the Marina. Staff were friendly and helpful. The only negative was that although it had gated parking, it was sometimes difficult to find a space. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay here... I like it.”
Reviews.Author: 777Jeff
Reviews.Content: I've been to Key West about a dozen times. I've stayed in several cheap hotels on both sides of Roosevelt Blvd, guest houses on Duval, and at Hyatt. When I stay at Hyatt, I have no need for a rental car. Just an $8 per person taxi ride from the airport. On this second visit, the girls at the desk actually remembered me from my previous visit. Several times, when we returned to our room, the wine and snack fairy had visited. Each time, was a nice little hand-written note from the desk. Everybody there is friendly. The person doing landscaping, cleaning the pool, emptying the trash, whatever... they all happily say hello to you. Personally, when on vacation, I sleep and shower in the room and that's about it. I found the rooms more than adequate for that. The shower is nice and roomy. The bed was clean and comfortable and the floors, walls, and furniture were very clean as well. When I stayed on Roosevelt Blvd (both N and S), I had to drive into town and find and pay for a place to park. The Hyatt is just two blocks from Duval Street. It is very convenient to the popular attractions... if you don't mind a little walking. I dive and it was very nice having the Southpoint Divers dive boat docked right in front of the hotel. I love where this hotel is. Just around the corner is the boardwalk for the historic seaport where you can drool over boats and yachts, take a late night stroll, or stop for a drink or some food at A&B Lobster House, the Commodore, Conch Republic Seafood Company, Schooner Wharf, or Turtle Kraal. The Rum Barrel is right across the street from the Hyatt as well (try their Philly cheesesteak nachos!) Key West does have some public beaches but it really isn't a "beachy" island. If you have children that like water parks and stuff, KW probably isn't the place for you. The pool at Hyatt is very clean. It's not large but KW is a small island so land is scarce and comes at a premium. There is an small upper sandy beach area just off building 3 that has some great views. Down some steps from that is a very small beach area with water access. There are only 3 or 4 reclining chairs in this area. Lots of cool little reef fish along the rocky wall if you look for them in and around the rocks. Snorkeling here works as well. You can even wade out to a small wooden floating platform with 2 lounge chairs. On my most recent visit, I had a view of the boat ramp, public beach, the beautiful Customs House, the cruise boats in the distance, the Shipwreck Historeum tower, Sunset Key, and Christmas Tree Island. I did see what looked like a homeless couple in that area but they didn't appear to bother anybody. Somebody mentioned chickens and roosters. The roam around the island. You will probably hear or see roosters regardless of where you stay. I found it kind of entertaining. Internet access was available but I don't think it is free. Would be nice for them to include it. Also, I think somebody mentioned some kind of resort fee. I don't like feeling nickel and dimed and it would be nice if they just integrated that stuff into the nightly rate. The breakfast package (awaken on their website) is nice. The food is expensive but you get a credit for most of it. Honestly, with the tip, I probably spent the same on breakfast that I would have spent elsewhere so I think it's pretty much a wash. Given the awaken package and the 4th night free, it's not a bad deal. Especially since I don't have to pay to park or rent a car. It's expensive but so is just about every other place to stay in KW. I think it's a pretty good value for the money. I'll go back to KW and I'll almost certainly be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “CU Rewards Paid Off Big Time!!!”
Reviews.Author: MaryS12
Reviews.Content: We hadn't touched our credit card rewards for four years. We're not big spenders, but we accumulated enough points to obtain a Hyatt room for two days. Awesome views, great food, royal treatment.

Reviews.Title: “Back to Key West to Recharge”
Reviews.Author: FlyingGeese
Reviews.Content: Key West has its problems. But that's not what I'm writing about. I've been going to the Keys for over 40 years, and I've stayed in a number of places there, some really great, some just this side of being called a dive. My wife decided to try the Hyatt on Front Street. (There are a few Hyatts in Key West.) We booked three nights with the fourth night through in for free. When we checked in, they up-graded us. We were on the third floor, right above the pool (couldn't hear any noise), with an excellent view of the ocean. The staff at the front desk were a little unhelpful, but nearly everyone else was pleasant. The room was big, and the decor was sorta early 60s, retro kinda thingy. Big plush bed. A few chairs here and there. Bathroom nice sized, but only one vanity, and, of course, poor lighting (so says my wife). Nice walk-in shower. But no tub. We didn't check out the spa, but did try the restaurant. Not bad. Expensive, but very nice setting, right on the water. The location of the hotel is something to consider if you're not into a lot of walking. But know that Key West is a walking town, and you will do lots of walking, almost no matter where you stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, very...”
Reviews.Author: Werner-traveller
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great location, very friendly staff. The perfect vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: floppsey
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel ever. Our room was amazing with 2 balconies!!!!! Fantastic staff, fantastic food and beautiful area!!!! Loved it

Reviews.Title: “Great View, location and wonderful time!”
Reviews.Author: guoning
Reviews.Content: Room: I stayed in Keywest for two nights and got one of the Deluxe Gulf View King room on the top floor. Room was clean and tidy, not as big as I would like, the bathroom was amazing, I love the rainfall shower. The room has two balconies, the smaller one has a table and two chairs and the large one has a sunbed, both have generous views of the gulf. Location: Location is pretty good, rather short walk to reach everything. About 5 mins walk to the cruise dock, where you can catch gorgeous sunset, few people live on East Coast see sunset everyday. Since Key West is pretty small, I guess there probably no bad location. Food: there's one restaurant in the hotel i think, rather empty at night. I would recommend to explore the rest of Key West to look for food.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hyatt - Can't Wait to Return Next Year!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TravlinStarre
Reviews.Content: From the moment we stepped out of our taxi and were greeted by the bellhop, we knew we chose the right place to stay.....after drinking our complimentary glass of Champaign while they checked us in, they gave us a tour of the quaint grounds, while giving us some information about the hotel & Key West. The gave us an upgrade to a gorgeous room with a beautiful view of the pool & ocean (room 3103), the bathrooms are very chic, & beds are comfy.....the customer service there is un-matched....everyone was so friendly & helpful....we had drinks every afternoon at Mojito's & enjoyed a breakfast one morning at the 'Shor' which was delicious.....in a lot of reviews people complain about the 'beach area' being small......if you are going to Key West you should know in advance that Key West is not known having great beaches, that's not the Hyatt's fault & the cute little beach area they have was a great way to utilize some of the property for folks to soak up some sun without being at the beautiful pool!...my husband & I go away usually every year in April and are looking forward to returning to this hotel.....we travel quite a bit and can assure you if you choose the Hyatt in Key West you won't be disappointed.....

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but worth it.”
Reviews.Author: perogiman
Reviews.Content: We stayed Sunday to Wednesday. The location is awesome if you want to be close to the Duval but still have a quiet place to relax by the pool and watch the sunset or boats go by. The rooms are awesome. We stayed in 3305 which was an oversized king with a larger balcony, pool facing with a ocean view, and an a great bath area with oversized rain shower head coming out of the ceiling. It was a great room. You also can see the sunsets perfect from this hotel. We recommend sitting out on their private dock. The pool bar has great food and drinks. The onsite restaurant is excellent as well. The staff were extremely helpful. The only downside to this hotel is that it doesn't have a shuttle to the airport. We stayed here 6 years ago and there have been extensive renovations since then which really was a nice surprise. The location is also right between Mallory Square/Duvall and the fisherman warf area which makes an easy walk to either place. If you can get a deal on the room rate then definitely book here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: njgirl1964
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Key West was great and the location could not have been better! It was a 4 night getaway for us to celebrate my husband's birthday. Upon checking in we received not only a glass of champagne each but they also delivered a bottle to our room with a note to my husband for his birthday! I had told the reservations person that it was his birthday and they noted it in our booking. We were in building 4 & had a Gulf View room. We definitely could not complain about the view which also overlooked the pool area. The room was clean & bathroom huge! Did not use the pool as it was a bit chilly but others did use it. I saw towels were put on the chairs very early in the morning. The beach is not much but that didn't matter to us. Hotel staff were good but noticed they were young and I just felt not experienced enough. But nonetheless, they were helpful. Had breakfast at the hotel only one day. A bit pricey but VERY good! BTW, make sure to check your bill upon checking out.......we had someone's else breakfast charged to our room! It was a mistake and fixed quickly. Overall, we felt that our choice for a hotel was a good one and would certainly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel For Everyone”
Reviews.Author: EastCoastRoadWarrior
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt at Key West is wonderful. The hotel staff are very courteous and kind. The room was very spacious and modern. We had a partial ocean view, which was ok. The bathroom was large and had plenty of Key West themed soaps and lotions. The pool was a fair size and had a nice hot tub next to it. The property is very well kept and has a koi pond and turtle habitat. There is plenty of things to do: swimming, jet skis, tanning, shopping in the gift store, going to the spa and just relaxing. The property has a "beach" but it is very small and rocky. Next to the beach is a tanning deck with chairs. The fitness center has plenty of machines and weights. Overall, we had a wonderful stay and had no problems.

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL”
Reviews.Author: disappointed87
Reviews.Content: Overpriced, small pool, and no beach says it all!!!! Had to get up early to put a towel by the pool to hold a spot by the pool. I thought you went on vacation to sleep in, not here!!! Where is the million dollar renovation they said they did I could not find it! Took the Awaken package thinking I would not not have to pay for breakfast, I should have known better, they got me at the check out. Be aware, very aware of this place, this is my third visit to Key West in the last six years and my last visit here, hell if I could get away with it I rather sleep at the dock then stay here ever again!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good times @ the Hyatt Key West”
Reviews.Author: Mac4YYZ
Reviews.Content: Nice spot. Great location. Parking tight. Rooms and grounds were spotless. Nice staff. Walking distance to many of the things to do and see in Key West. Key West hotels seem to be expensive in general but we managed to get this Hyatt on Hotwire for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel - resort fees not included”
Reviews.Author: compose12
Reviews.Content: Booked through Orbitz and "thought" everything was included. It wasn't. Hyatt tacks on a daily "resort fee" - $14...very annoying. If it had been in the price, I wouldn't have cared. heck, we're spending over $2,300 for airfare and 5 days at the hotel. I hate these piddly fees and won't be staying there again because of it nor booking through Orbitz. The staff is FANTASTIC. The room was great - view of the pool and the ocean, which brought up an interesting bed scenario. From the right side of the bed, you could see the ocean, so the mattress was really low on that side and really high on the other because of where everyone planted themselves. The bed also squeaked - for a 30th anniversary - it was humorous - others might not think so.

Reviews.Title: “Better the 1st time!”
Reviews.Author: WendyG2
Reviews.Content: We spent our Honeymoon 9/30/06 in Key West at the Hyatt / Front St. We loved every second of our stay besides the renovations that were going on @ 8am-Evening. It was so bad that my sister could hear it while I was on the phone on the balcony and laying out in the few lounges that they had on the dock (because it was too loud by the pool). I was disappointed that they did not warn us of this. Our room was brand new and we loved that though. We also did not want to spend out Honeymoon complaining to the hotel. The Concierge Richard was so funny and awesome that we hoped to see him the next time we came back. Overall a great stay besides construction. We were out of the hotel most of the time anyway. 5/4/09 - 5/8/09 This stay was definately worse..... We loved the fact that the our 1st stay we could feed the turtles in the pond and we did so every day. The second trip they did not allow that or at least that is what we were told...disappointing. We got a Partial Gulf View again. The 1st time same thing but overlooked the pool and Gulf.....This time overlooking mostly parking lot and boat launch dock where the bums congregate every morning to fight about cigarettes. This is how we spent our breakfast every morning. Still very hard to get a lounge chair by the pool. No Richard the awesome Concierge....but you are left with someone that does not even approach you to let you know what there is to offer and when you approach them, you are given pamphlet's with no recommendations. I felt the staff this time had REALLY gone down hill as did the hotel in our book. So much so that we are coming back this year and have a room at the Ocean Key Resort booked. From the reviews, hopefully much better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: soapsuds22
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt for a wedding. The room was very comfortable and the service was outstanding. Not a whole lot of amenities on site but you can find everything within a short walk. Perfect area for visiting Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: f1champ
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice but has a slight motel feeling. The good - rooms, staff and food The bad - small pool, beach is almost non existent

Reviews.Title: “Service + location+ style - perfect blend!”
Reviews.Author: sophiegirl04
Reviews.Content: If you want a mega resort, a fabulous beach, a pool with a lazy river or waterfall - don't come here. (In fact, you probably shouldn't come to Key West!) This resort is a small property, with more of a booutique feel and look. (especially for a Hyatt) Buildings are older, but rooms have been beautifully renovated - contemporary elegance with spectacular baths! We were upgraded to a partial water view, which had a small balcony on which to enjoy it. Coffee pot and refrigerator in room.(hidden away - look to find them!). First class amenities - key lime soap, quince bergamot lotions and facial scrub - and a room and bath that was kept spotless by housekeeping. Do try to get a rate that includes breakfast - it is pricey - but is delicious and the water views from the restaurant are great. Lovely way to start the day! Smallish pool - everything in Key West is sort of squished together - set your expectations properly. (I would not recommend this hotel for families who want to spend the majority of their time at the pool!) Outdoor bar with comfortable seating area overlooking the water - but not a party bar with mega night life. We loved the service - absolutely some of the best and friendliest we have experienced...and the location. It is a pain to drive into Key West and expensive to park! You can walk everywhere from this hotel - a great location. (Be sure to calculate that into your "expenses" as you plan your trip - a budget hotel outside of town may not be so "cheap" if you are planning to spend day after day in town.) We travel extensively, often splurge on our stays - and loved this hotel. It is a beautiful high end property, with excellent service and a wonderful location. A great place to relax and kick back...and certainly welcoming after a day/evening spent in town among the "crowds". Worth every penny you will spend here!

Reviews.Title: “DIDN'T WANT TO LEAVE THAT ROOM !”
Reviews.Author: keysgo
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful place. Everyone was so nice and helpful.It was freezing the few days we were there, but that room and the view.If you opened all the curtains it was a panoramic view of the gulf! Didn"t get to use the pool or hot tub... heck we couldn't even take our coats off the whole time, but it was beautiful. As far as location goes I think it was the best,just a block from Duval and 2 blocks from Malory square.And if you walk the other direction you are on the seaport, bars,restaraunts,we sailed a tall ship from there.All I know is if you got room for me let me know!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: OldCritical
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Key West has a great location. It is an easy walk to Duval Street, Mallory Square, the Conch Train, and the Truman Little White House. Our group of rooms here was lovely. We had a large separate entry, wonderful bed in the sleeping area, comfortable separate living area, and balcony with a nice view. I also liked the serene spa like bathroom, with a "rain shower". We enjoyed an excellent dinner in the Hyatt's dining room, and a good breakfast every morning on the terrace. The bar was my only disappointment. The only red wine they offered by the glass was a Merlot. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your time or money”
Reviews.Author: laulau410
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because it was the only hotel with availbilty for the dates we were traveling over the New Years holiday. The staff upon check in were very friendly, but with only 2 employees checking people in during one of the buisiest times of the year in Key West I was a little surprised. We got to our room and were really happy with the size and ammenities. But, our satisfaction stopped there. Unless you plan on staying in your room the entire trip this hotel is not worth the price. You would be better off staying at a B&B or Casa Marina or any other hotel for that matter. The pool was tiny...I counted 30 chairs surrounding the pool. I came down to get a chair at 9 am. There were 2 chairs- directly under a tree. I came here for some sun & relaxation, so having leaves falling on me and being in the shade the entire day isn't my idea of an ideal situation. There are 2 other areas with lounge chairs, but this only adds about 10 more chairs, but no direct access to the pool and are in secluded areas of the resort. We stayed at the Casa Marina in the past and the last 2 days of this trip and while the rooms aren't the largest they are sufficient. Besides, the ammenities of the hotel are what we came for and with 2 pools, a beach and great pool service the Casa Marina is a much better choice if you are coming to Key West enjoy yourself. Overall, the rooms were spacious, the location is great, but not enough to make me come back.

Reviews.Title: “Very good service for our wedding”
Reviews.Author: venice4504
Reviews.Content: We hosted our wedding here. The front desk, minus J.P., kinda is lackluster and had some major issues with our family having two rooms with the same last name (duh...it's a wedding) and the general manager apologized for it later. The rooms themselves are well appointed with lovely renovated bathrooms. They can run on the small side though. The reception food was very good, and we were well taken care of the entire length of our stay. We have not heard any big issues from our guests that did stay there.

Reviews.Title: “nice location”
Reviews.Author: soxgirl414
Reviews.Content: We visited in early December and were thrilled that the weather was 80+ every day! The hotel was nice, we arrived early, our room was not ready so we went out for a walk and were promised a call once our room was ready. At 2:15 we still had not received a call, so I called to check in. Our room was ready and they seemed puzzled as to why I had not received a call. We had a partial ocean view room with a small balcony. Breakfast was included in our room rate, it was very good, but super slow. It took over an hour everyday, which was too long in my opinion. The pool area is very small, but we were able to figure out the best spot on deck behind the restaurant to get some sun. The hotel in general was dead, very quiet, not much going on. We had drinks bar by the pool at about 4 p.m. one day in there were no other people at the bar. We rented bikes one day through the hotel, which I highly recommend to be able to see the whole island. Overall the hotel was very nice, but certainly not a spot if you're looking for fun.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: NewDrewToo
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at Hawks Cay Bay in Duck Key before arriving in Key West to stay at the Hyatt and after such an awesome stay at Hawks Cay we were completely let down by the Hyatt. The service is lackluster; people were semi-friendly, but almost in a forced way. We met much nicer people in the service industry all over Key West. The house-keeper did a minimal job at cleaning the room and everyday there was some kind of mess after the room had been attended to; for example, my husbands little hairs from shaving around the sink or dirty mirrors. The sheets were never changed during our stay. No turn down service either. I found the bed to be very uncomfortable and had a backache after two nights sleeping on the bed. Besides, the hotel is pretty, but really not in an inviting Key West comfy sort of way; I should have recognized this fact before booking the hotel, but I overlooked the importance. The cost is not warranted for what you get. I paid less and had a way better room, better service, better everything at Hawks Cay. Next time I will definately book with a family-friendly B&B or anywhere else but the over-priced Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Where service is just another word in the dictionary”
Reviews.Author: SuperSpy
Reviews.Content: Checked into a lovely room overlooking the harbor. The front desk staff was quite pleasant and that's where it ended. The concierge desk is a joke. A simple request like renting a bicycle or booking a golf tee time was never followed up. It's hit or miss if they're at the desk and they shut down around 6 PM. Housekeeping was at the door early in the morning, and when we asked them to return later they did - around 4:30 in the afternoon. The spa is not inexpensive and there are only two rooms. When my wife and I requested separate rooms, the concierge called back to ask if we'd be willing to double up in one room so they could add another guest at the same time. The hotel is ideally located and the physical plant is nice for the most part. The health club and spa was undersized for the property. Other than that it 's one of the better places to stay in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Average Hyatt”
