Reviews.Author: OneHonestReviewer
Reviews.Content: Most of the previous average and poor reviews summed this place correctly. It is in a great location just minutes to Duval Street and Mallory Square, which is important as parking is a nightmare in Key West, and this hotel is better than Holiday Inn and Marriot which are on the North end of the island and are expensive dumps so this is a step up from that experience. However, the hotel is very average for a Hyatt. No regency club, daily charge for Internet, a small, shallow pool that you share with other Hyatt properites and their guests, a cloudy small hottub and a five chair beach (it looks bigger in the pictures). The room design is strange like mentioned in previous reviews with a long hall that is cold and slippery when wet. Box air conditioners are noisy and very Days Inn like. The bathroom is large and the shower is almost too big to a point that it is cold in there when taking a shower. The toilet is very tight and the toilet paper roll holder makes the toilet feel very cramped. Parking is also very limited and very tight for large vehicles as the spots are very close together so park early in the day as most of the spots are for compacts. There are homeless people who sleep at the back of the property as I discovered one night and there is a parrot on property that makes noise throughout the day cutting into my relaxing quiet time. Basically, if you want to be close to the action and could not care about amenities and just need a nice bed, then this is your place. If you expect pampering, luxury and resort polish this will truly disappoint. I am a bit torn on recommending this hotel as it served my purpose but it is a long way from being a REAL resort.

Reviews.Title: “What a beautiful place, you will have not regrets!”
Reviews.Author: power01
Reviews.Content: I had my wedding at the Hyatt on 10/18/09 and the venue (The Shore) and rooms were gorgeous. Ava is the wedding coordinator and she is the "best". She pays attention to every detail and goes above and beyond. I cannot say enough about the atmosphere but simply amazing and the location on the island.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: jessphi
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and tastefully decorated. Had a great view from our room. People were nice. Key west was a delight. I wish I could stayed longer. Would go back anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Vacation at Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: OldBridgeRealty
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Dec 6th for a 4 night stay, chose to stay the full 7 nights. Ken had no problem adding our nights. The lobby had the most delicious key lime smell, made you completely relaxed and the champagne was a wonderful touch! We came to Key West to celebrate our 25th Anniversary and are so glad we chose the Hyatt, because we will definetly be back many times. Ken sent champagne and choc covered strawberries for our 25th anniversary, which was a wonderful touch. Our room was 3412, which had partial gulf view . There can be some noise from the garbage trucks at some mornings, but it did not bother us at all. I do not sleep well ever, and it was a pleasure sitting on the balcony late at night having both a city view and a gulf view. The added plus is also having a beautiful sunset view right off the balcony! Rooms are gorgeous, very spacious! The beds are very comfortable, the bathroom is to die for, large shower, beautiful rain shower, water always hot. Comfortable large towels and all necessities needed, just bring a toothbrush! Hairdrier is the large ones, not the small ones attached at walls. The cleaning staff is very efficient and always brought extra towels. Room service was excellent. Most mornings we ordered coffee, there is a coffee pot for your use if you choose that instead. The bar area was great, the bartenders are happy great people and there is always a drink special. The restaurant, we only ate there for breakfast and the food was delicious and the view is perfect! Location of the hotel cannot be more perfect! You have Duval a few blocks down, Harbor Walk right next door, Mallory Square another few blocks away and even if you want to go to the other side of Key West, the walk which is about a mile, is entertaining and very easy to do. We rented jetskiis and bycicles from an outfit that was right in Hyatt and it was perfect! Never had to use the car! Checkout was quick and without any problems.Boarding passes can be printed from computer in the lobby. We will make many more visits here, because there was not a single thing that I could possibly complain about. Everyone from Ken and Fred all the way down to the cleaning staff always had a smile and always greeted us, nobody was ever nasty. Sadly I did not get to use the spa, but a few people we met there had used it and loved every minute of it. Yes the hotel is compact but Key West itself is not a big place. We never found a problem finding a spot to lay out in the morning. Usually we would go walking at 8am and come back to the hotel by 10am and get some sun till about 2pm and then head out for some lunch at the Harbor, come back, hang out by the bar and then go out for the evening sunset celebrations. The pool is not big but it serves its purpose and there is also a hot tub. The turtle pond is beautiful and well maintained. Also they have a large HD tv off the pool in which you can watch sports late at night after the bar closes, which for us was wonderful. The bar has two HD Tv's. The bar was open from 11am to 10pm while we were there. There is many chairs to sit at throughout the hotel in which you can sit and sip a drink enjoying the gorgeous view. A perfect stay to a perfect vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location - Just check Price”
Reviews.Author: brd9816
Reviews.Content: Very very money location - next to Duval street and sea. If you need a place next to sea and just want to relax, this is it. I will go back there again(if I get good price again!). Just a couple of gotchas which are not really big but if you know upfront, you can be better prepared for it. 1) 12 bucks per day "Resort Fee" - The biggest Gotcha. 2) The Beach isn't really a beach, just a few feet of sand to get your feet wet 3) Interior seem to be targeted towards young generation. But just check the price and get it. You can't go wrong w/ it. I will go back w/o any hesitation. btw, when you are in Key-West and thinking about sunset cruise or something similar, check the boat type. If they are not powered (sail), they have high rate of cancellations due to unfavorable wind/weather conditions.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Katelle627
Reviews.Content: Review a little late but my fiance and I stayed here for a long Labor weekend Sept 2009 and my fiance is already talking about going back. The hotel and rooms are flawlessly clean and modern looking. Key West is not known for their beaches but the hotel has a tiny beach access which is great because after looking at other resorts it didn't look like they offered this. Pool is fine, only 3 feet throughout. Staff is really interested in making sure you have a great stay. Case-in-point, our room overlooked a parking lot/beach access where homeless people congregated and one afternoon a fight broke out. We called to alert the front desk and within 10 minutes a free bottle of wine and hand-written note of apology was sent up to us. Also at check out overlooking our bill, the bar overcharged us for our drinks and management removed them completely from our invoice. There were quite a few honeymooning couples we met on the property and on one of the nights there was a wedding reception going on in the main hall. About a 4 minute walk to anything you could ever want around Duval Street but the actual resort grounds were quiet. Overall it was a really great place

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to stay while in Key West!”
Reviews.Author: SwedishExplorer
Reviews.Content: We visited Key West for four days in the beginning of December 2009 and stayed at the Hyatt Resort and Spa for 4 nights. This was my second stay and I posted a review also after the first stay one year ago in where I basically praised the hotel (and you will find me doing this also in this review) however last year the front desk staff where not as friendly as one would have wished. Guess what, this year they where absolutely wonderful and we loved the stay every part from the world class check in experience (thanks Libby for providing an excellent check in feeling for us!) to the tasty and exclusive breakfasts that we just loved so much (thanks Carina for excellent service and friendliness!) for those of you who consider staying here, this is what you get; a completely remodeled hotel situated right by the sea and with a true exclusive resort feeling. The rooms as lovely and large and have balconies. There is a heated pool and a very comfortable hot tub. We had a reservation for a partly ocean view room but were upgraded as platinum Hyatt Gold card members to a deluxe room with two balconies (one huge and one smaller) overlooking the lovely pool areas and with full ocean view as well! The beds are so comfortable and the linens (I know, I am all in to the details) where top quality and starched to make you sleep like a king/queen! The design of the bathrooms will impress you and they are large and feature a walk in rain shower, top quality towels and exclusive amenities. Our room had a Nespresso coffee brewer (I think the regular rooms have ordinary coffee brewers though) and we had our room perfectly serviced each day including a shut down service for the night. There is wireless Internet all over the hotel for a cost (free for Platinum Gold card members) and parking is an additional 12 USD per night which considering this is Key West where parking is very expensive is not too much I think. I tried their Spa this year and highly recommend! The Spa is truly unique and with great staff (thanks Erin and Jana, you are true professionals!) The hotel is situated just by all the fun and crazy action of Duval Street and Mallory square but still secluded and quiet. Donâ€™t miss visiting Key West and spoil your selves by staying at this world class exclusive hotel where the staff makes you feel not only more than welcome but truly like if you belong! We will be coming back for sure! Many thanks again to the world class staff at the Hyatt Key West resort mentioned in this review ( and others not mentioned) who made our stay close to heaven!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Property, People and Picturesque”
Reviews.Author: BOGEMAN
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt for 4 nights (12/1 thru 12/4) for my wifes birthday (12-3). We were greeted by Ken at the front desk and offerred champagne. We accepted. We stayed here last year at Thanksgiving and the level of service was great. It seems nothing has changed. We booked the stay three get the fourth night free package which included breakfast. Our room was 3403 which offered a partial gulf view overlooking the pool. The breakfast package last year was a 37.00 coupon per room. They must have received some complaints because now the breakfast is complimentary. Everyone was super nice. We received a bottle of champagne and three chocolate covered strawberries for my wifes birthday which was a nice touch. From Fred the Manager, Scott the Assistant Manager to the wait staff at the Shor restaurant everyone was personable and attentive. We enjoyed our stay and will be back again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for dining, nightlife, watersports or relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Tillymint81
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to two nights in November and we absolutely loved it, the room was light and spacious and the decor suited the surroundings. The complimentary in room toiletries were far more impressive than anything I've seen before, with Shampoo, Conditioner, Body Wash, Soap and Moisturiser all with the theme of Key Lime. The staff were always friendly and helpful. I especially enjoyed watching the turtles just outside the lobby area. The only negative I would have was the fact that the bar closed between 9 and 10 pm.

Reviews.Title: “this place was fabulous-would stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: jafhed
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in Key West with 3 other couples. The location of this hotel was perfect-we were able to walk to all the bars/restaurants/and Mallory Square. We had our breakfast included and although, it is pricey-we could have room service on our balcony with no extra charge overlooking the pool and ocean (we were upgraded because we're Hyatt frequent stay members) The apple pancakes were delicious! All the employees were very friendly and the champagne at check in was a nice touch!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: harrellrw
Reviews.Content: Was in Key West 11/18-11/23 Wayne and Peggy Harrell and daughter Kelly Cannon and husband Jamie Cannon. Stayed at the Hyatt, very clean, rooms were great, location is one of the best in Key West can walk the whole town. Cabs are very high. Little pricie but we booked with on line and got a good deal.Staff very friendly, we got in early and they gave us great rooms with water view.No problems at this Hotel , we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Dire”
Reviews.Author: TravellersBlues
Reviews.Content: This would be an excellent 2 star motel, however as it pretend to be somethign else it is utterly dire. The staff are generally young, pleasant but very unexperienced and not trained at all. Getting the most simplistic things done is thoroughly impossible and the rooms and services do nto actually match what is advertised on the Hyatt Wed site. In terms of location, Key West has no beach hotels so it does not really matter where you stay as you have to travel to beaches and areas of interest. Pack pleant ear plugs to cover the noisy air conditioning, well that and some asprin. You may also want to consider something to keep the bugs off. Would not go back if you paid me! I could go on but an trying to delete the memory and wasted money of this unfortunate property from my mind.

Reviews.Title: “We Are Going Back!”
Reviews.Author: CT55AND56
Reviews.Content: Wow! What a great place. Our first trip to Key West & the Hyatt was recommended by our close friend & travel agent. It was a little on the pricey side but worth it. We thought this was a GOOD choice. Great location and the room was very nice, the bathroom was outstanding with a cool walk in shower w/glass half enclosure. Even though we had a room with balcony facing the property next door, it was still very nice. We will be reserving a deluxe gulf view room facing the water to the left of the pool next time we go. We were looking at our photos the other night and I had remembered I had not logged on and written a review, better late that never. We will be plannng another trip probably in early 2010 and will definelty be leaning towards the Hyatt again. Best words of advice we could give is..... Make Sure you go Hogsbreath Saloon! Best chili dogs in the world! I could eat there every day for lunch AND dinner. Overall our stay here was relaxing and the staff was very nice. The only negative comment we would have would be for the concierge office next to the pool. BAD BAD BAD, very snotty attitude, she acted like she would rather be any other place than there. We tried to book a parasailing reservation but she gave some excuse. We walked down Front St and found a place that took us out parasailing for a great time the next day. Cleaning staff was VERY good, our room was always spotless when we returned from the pool or shopping each day. My wife had to have her fresh coffee each morning so I would go to the restuarant every morning, the staff remembered me after the 2nd day and always made me feel welcomed. If you don't mind spending a little extra, this is the place to stay in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money...”
Reviews.Author: Adrian1972London
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt Key West 24th - 26th October. The hotel is in a great location and the rooms are clean, bright and modern. However, that's where the positives end. The pool and other communal areas are much too small for the size of the hotel and were always crowded. Despite paying a hefty room rate and a daily resort fee they still charge $9.99 per day for WIFI. Block three where I stayed faces a parking lot which is frequented by homeless people. This was not an issue until the last night of my stay when homeless men were loudly arguing and fighting throughout the night. On checking out I mentioned this and they couldn't be less interested.

Reviews.Title: “little over rated and not worth the money. shop around first.”
Reviews.Author: daveyvegas
Reviews.Content: first off the staff was very nice. but the hotel rooms are to modern looking and have a cold feel. we had sugar flys in our room and the staff moved us to one of there best and biggest rooms. [very cool of them to do that.] but yet that room was on that same cold modern look to. just bigger. we just came from hawks cay resort in duck key and for the money we were expecting grandure. not so. hawks kay blew it away. there rooms by the pool were beautiful. don't be fooled by the pictures on there website for the hyatt. it's kinda a let down in person. the pool totally sucked. it's waist deep and a strange lay out. the jucuzzie was strange to. sitting in it it was at waist line? but there little baby beach was ok. good for quick swim. water was nice.we hung out there with a lounge chair and a cocktail. lol.also remember there are no beaches in key west except buy the fort wich was nice. smathers beach stinks.literaly. sea weed issue. there resturant was ok at the hyatt. there pool bar was nice. bar tenders were very cool. drinks were $12.00 with 18% added for gratuity.[ forigners don't tip were told.] drink on duval st. if that's your thing. that whole pool area needs to be revamped. there is very little room and if it got busy you'll be even more pissed. the hotel was half empty and there were no chairs avaliable at the pool. very tight. now keep this in mind. i'm from las vegas nevada. so no matter were i go it's hard to impress me. hawks kay did and the staff at both places were excellent. kodos to the employee's. if the pool is your thing go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: hustchick
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect in every way: Room was spacious, pretty and CLEAN...shower was great, I want one at home. Staff was friendly. View was awesome. Location was where I'd always want to be in Key West...walking distance to everything...Harbor Walk; Duval Street, Mallory Square, etc. Turtle pond and parrot named Odie onsite are an added bonus. Another added/fun bonus...the Coast Guard ship parked in the Harbor plays "God Bless America" every morning at 8. So, leave your door open (if you're on an upper floor) and you can hear it.

Reviews.Title: “To much money for what you get”
Reviews.Author: MissyKitty1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are still on vacation. Arrived at our room to find little fast crawling bugs on the bath vanity and on a foot wide ledge that runs along the wall behind the bed. We spoke to the manager and he told my husband that it is just a little Florida bug but if we get out of the room for a while they would spray. Well they did and that took care of the problem but at a price of $475.00 per night, they should do this before a guest arrives. Yesterday, which was a Saturday during Fantesy Fest, is a big deal in Key West, we arrived back at the hotel at 10:15 p.m. the bar and restuarant were closed. We called to the front desk as to a place on the premises to at least buy something to drink and my husband had to leave our building and walk to another building to buy a can of soda. Even cheap hotels will have a soda machine on every floor. They advertise they have internet, but you have to pay $9.90 daily for it. Once again, even cheap hotels include internet..They have beautiful furniture on the patio with flat screen tv's but no place to buy food or drinks to encourage guests to enjoy the amenities. While this hotel just went through a very expensive renovation they didn't include/provide basics.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tbird64
Reviews.Content: Went to Key West with my wife and 4 other couples to celebrate my 50th birthday. A travel agent suggested this property, and it was great. The rooms are large and bright with all marble flooring. No bathtub but a HUGE shower. The location is fantastic; on the water, close to Duval, Mallory Sqaure and the harbor walk. The restaurant should not be stuck in a Hyatt. The chef is great and the breakfast, incldued in our package, was fantastic. Service everywhere, the bar (Shaun), poolside (Mr. Sasha), check in (Petra), restatuant (Ozzie), concierge (Laura) was excellent. The pool is kind of small but fits the property fine. There are docks on the property wtih a dive boat, wave runners and more. This hotel is a good size; not too big and not too little. Good class of clientle. On Wed nights they have a super managers reception that is much better than any others that I've been to. The manager Fred is very welcoming. We can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice for our 30th Wedding Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: jwmoore
Reviews.Content: It started off rough because the room we had reserved was not available. We were given a discount on the first night as a result. The next day they moved our things so when we came back everything was set. Both rooms were lovely but I loved the King Room . The room was beautifully decorated and the amenities were appreciated. We had a great view of the pool and water. The staff was always pleasant anywhere you ran into someone. We had a cabana by the pool one day which was heavenly. When we tired of the pool we went down to the sandy beach. The location was great as you were real close to Mallory Square and the Waterfront. We enjoyed having a meal by the pool. Everything was great except for the minor problems with the fire alarm system. On the last morning we were having coffee out on the pier and we both jumped up thinking we might have seen a shark but it was actually two porpoises swimming by.

Reviews.Title: “20 Year Anniversary Trip.”
Reviews.Author: pep07874
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hyatt for our 20 year anniversary. This was our first time to Kew West. The Hyatt was everything we hoped it would be. When we checked in our room was not ready by only ten minutes. The Front Office Manager, Mark Harris, provided a voucher for us that covered drinks and lunch. When we arrived at our room we had chocolate covered strawberries and champaign waiting for us. The hotel is very close to Duval Street and an easy walk to all restaurants. Every time I passed any Hyatt employee they all had a smile and asked if we needed anything. The pool area was clean and never hard to find a chair. When I checked out we were provided with a $150 food voucher good at most Hyatt Hotels in the U.S. and Mexico. I can't say enough about how spectacular we were treated at this Hotel. We will absolutely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but a bit pricey”
Reviews.Author: ZadaZainal
Reviews.Content: Booked it because of the great reviews. Great location off the north end of Duval Street. Very friendly and efficient staff. Excellent service. Very accommodating to our demanding needs too. Turtle pond by the lobby was a hit with my 1yr old son. Lovely room with a state-of-the-art bathroom facing the car park with a partial view of the sea. Great layout- easy access to the tiny private beach and swimming pool. We had breakfast at Shor, the in-house restaurant, and the food was delicious too. Some problems: the bed was large but too soft and couldn't provide adequate support for us. The A/C was noisy and not cool enough. The shower holder was broken and we had to wait for about 15 minutes in the room (unable to get settled in) until it was repaired. Breakfast was not included in the quite expensive rate. We liked it, but if we returned to Key West we would probably try another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Probably Best in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Jan_ATL
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay. Had a corner room overlooking pool and bay. Very spacious rooms. Pool smallish and shallow, but nice. Hotel has a beach where you can access the water. Right in the action, so walking distance to everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: chikflier
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located close to the action and within easy walking distance to Duval Street and Harbour Walk. The room was a nice size and clean, except for a small problem we encountered with ants. The only downside was that the room had the old style air conditioning units that are not efficient and they are very noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: holidayrocker_9
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hyatt after looking at the fantastic pictures on their webpage. We stayed here on Honeymoon. The hotel room was a little late being prepared and we were offered a free meal that evening, that was lovely, I think the room was delayed by about 25minutes. We had just travelled up from Orlando after the hectic theme parks, Key west was utopia, it is the best place I have ever been to, we booked the best room they had at the Hyatt and had champagne on our arrival so sat on the balcony and watched the sunset, before heading off for dinner. We then went onto a few bars after dinner and it was just like nothing I have experienced before, it was like going back in time, we had such an fantastic time and met a lovely couple from Texas. I must recommend you go to Latitude, its a restaurant, I am not sure which hotel you have to book this through, but they pick you by boat and take off you to the other island bit, only about a ten minutes boat ride and this was at sunset and we sat and had a meal on the beach, ahhh it was lovely! We also went onto Miami for another 7 nights, but Key West was the highlight of the honeymoon, wish we would have booked for longer, but there is always the anniversary, I will definately return one day as this place is out of this world and loved the place the minute we arrived. The Hyatt is situated in the best area of Key West, I could not fault the place at all, the staff were lovely the food was devine and you could sit literally over the water. The Hyatt is located where all the action is, but sure to take a camera.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury”
Reviews.Author: tommysteele1
Reviews.Content: For the best in Key West, stay here. It costs, but it is worth it. Perfect location, beautiful views.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic and wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Caro923
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Key West and the Hyatt. We went back to the Hyatt after spnding our honeymoon here. It was just as we remembered. Amazing views, rooms and are wonderful, staff is there to handle every last request. We have recommended the Hyatt and will continue to do so. There is nothing left untouched and wonderful. Don't look any further on the Keys. Enjoy yourself and stay here.

Reviews.Title: “tranquil setting and smack in the middle of the action”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel1229
Reviews.Content: I traveled with extended family which included a couple teenagers, a twenty-something and two couples. Our rooms were beautifully decorated with a great water view. The room had a HUGE shower, a flatscreen t.v. and wonderful balcony. The beach was small but perfect. We purchased a couple snorkel masks at the nearby CVS store and snorkeled right off the beach which was great. The hotel had a restaurant that served delicious food, breakfast was amazing (try the orange frenchtoast) and had onsite rentals for jetskis, snorkeling trips, diving trips, and sunset cruises. We booked the snorkel trip and highly recommend it, it was wonderful. We also rented jetski's and enjoyed that as well. The hotel had a turtle pond, koi pond, and a great pool bar. We rented a car for a week and realized we only used it one day, so I wouldn't recommend the need for a car since this hotel is a half block away from everything on Duval Street. The only complaint we had was the housekeeping didn't vacuum daily and since we were bringing sand in on our feet, by the end of the week, it was annoying to have sand in the room...other than that, there is not a single thing we could find wrong with this hotel! Stay at the Hyatt Key West Resort the next time you go to Key West, you won't be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel with great character and ambience”
Reviews.Author: gugsy
Reviews.Content: Its goregous, rooms are great and staff are great. Wonderful location over the sea and nice pool/fitness area. Overall an amazing hotel which makes a special vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and convenience are delivered with a smile.”
Reviews.Author: francophileusa
Reviews.Content: This most contemporary hotel was as clean as a pin! The room's balcony overlooked the pool and gulf and was a perfect place to wind down after a day's touring. The staff was super friendly and helpful and the location was just right to walk to everything we wanted to see. Mallory Square was a couple of blocks, Duvall Street was one block and the docks were practically next door. Be sure to take a tour, the trolley or conch train, on your first day if it's your first trip here. It will locate everything for you and give you an idea of where to find what you came to see. The Blonde Giraffe Key Lime Pie Factory offered a GREAT pie and coffee across the street, and the Croissants de France down Duvall street had great pastries and croissants to keep in your room for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST!!! Can't wait to stay again!”
Reviews.Author: fnkybee
Reviews.Content: I don't have enough adjectives to describe how wonderful this resort is! It was everything we wanted and more. The rooms are just amazing, the way they are decorated, the convenience, the comfort! The views are just spectacular! The location was right on! You are about 2 blocks from Duvall St. and Mallory Square. The service was fantastic! Everything was clean and up to date. We couldn't have asked for a better vacation. We will always stay at the Hyatt when we go to Key West from now on, I am just sad we didn't stay here sooner!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing in EYW”
Reviews.Author: fitforlife50
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weeks stay at the Hyatt Resort and Spa in Key West. We were looking for a quiet, relaxing hotel near Duval St. The Hyatt was perfect. The hotel was clean and well-kept. Our room was in Bld 3 with a partial gulf view and a great view of the sunset. We especially liked the walk-in shower. All the photos you see on TA are accurate relative to the layout, decor of the rooms. Each room had a small frig, which was really great. We kept water, juice, and a few drinks in there, which was very convenient. Our only negative was it's probably time to start changing out the mattresses; the Hyatt Grand Bed was one of our draws to the Hyatt Resort and it was time for ours to be replaced. The staff was excellent from top to bottom. Every person we met was pleasant and accommodating. We felt genuinely welcome, unlike some staff that are simply gratuitous. Check in was a breeze, we arrived early and they immediately found us a room. Our flight didn't leave until 3:30 pm and we were given a late check out. i was very impressed with the staff. Here are some of our does and don'ts. Do: stay at the Hyatt - short walk to all the action; take the Conch Train tour; visit the Mel Fisher museum; eat at Blue Heaven, Salsa Loco, and A&B; go to happy hour at Half Shell Raw; eat breakfast every day at Pepe's (hey Ray); drink lots of water; use the taxi service when going to some of the distance restaurants or museums - relative cheap, quick and efficient; use the Fitness Center. Don't: fly/drive from Miami/Ft Lauderdale; rent a car (or for that matter a scooter/bike either) - just walk; eat dinner too early - most restaurants are "al fresco", which are cooling down between 7-8. We had a great week in Key West and I highly recommend the Hyatt. We try to do a fairly nice trip each summer and we ranked the Hyatt KW in our top 5 favorite hotels. We would definitely go back - maybe in Feb, but we would return.

Reviews.Title: “A bit overpriced but very very well located”
Reviews.Author: ParisMiami2008
Reviews.Content: I just had my honeymoon at the Hyatt KW resort and I have mainly good things to say about the property. The rooms are very well decorated ( Actually the pictures on Tripadvisor are misleading ) The deco has probably been changed. The Manager Mr Hofman is a very friendly guy and guests are well looked after. There is a gift shop where you can access the Internet, even though opening times are a bit too variable. It's a bit overpriced compared to other hotels but the location ( walking distance from Duval street) is definitely worth the price. JFC ( Room 3309 from July 13th to July 20th)

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: abenitaj
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at the Westin when visiting Key West and I've stayed at the Pier House once, however, I absolutely loved the Hyatt and will be staying there from now on. The room at the Hyatt was very spacious and exceptionally clean. Customer Service was exceptional from the front desk clerks to the cleaning staff. Everyone was warm, friendly, helpful and inviting. They remembered and called you by name whenever they saw you! The rooms had updated everything and dimmers on the lights around the bathroom mirror, in the shower as well as on the lamp behind the low profile bed. There was a huge mirror in the bedroom close to the sitting area. The bed sheets and towels were crisp and white. The bed was very comfortable. The oversized shower had an overhead spout and a regular shower head. Each room has a balcony with two chairs. There is a small beach area where one can swim or snorkle. There is a beautiful pool, whirlpool, and 4 cabanas around the poolside area. The best sites and places to eat in Key West are within walking distance and there is no extra fee for parking at the Hyatt! Have fun at the Hyatt!

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation Ever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kcinman
Reviews.Content: This has to be one of the best hotels that my family and I have ever stayed at. Check in was so easy and very enjoyable. Our room was extremely clean and nice and large. We never felt like we were stepping on each other in the room. I can not say enough nice things about the pool and the pool bar. Each day they had a drink special that was very reasonable and my husband loved talking with the bartender who would know exactly what he wanted to drink. The location of the hotel is great easy to walk to everything. We were able to make many of our activities reservations right in the gift shop and the lady even went the extra mile to find my husband and daughter the best and least expensive fishing trip. She came out to the pool to tell us what she had found. GREAT SERVICE!!! I had a spa day during their fishing trip and loved the experience! Very personalized!!!! We are going back!

Reviews.Title: “Really Enjoyed The Hyatt Key West”
Reviews.Author: Atravelfan
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend over the 4th at the Hyatt Key West. Upon evening arrival, we found the front desk staff to be pleasant, and were surprised to be escorted to our room. The special requests entered in advance were fullfilled . The room was large,clean and beautifully decorated, with a large very nice bathroom ( bowl sink and lovely tiled shower with rain showerhead) . There was a small refrigerator which came in handy. The restaurant was expensive but we had a breakfast package so did go there daily. The waitstaff were friendly as was the hostess. The pool was small but not overcrowded. The "beach area" is tiny- big enough for 2 or 3 lounge chairs. The hotel grounds are very pretty, with flowers and lush vegetation as well as a koi pond and 2 turtle ponds. The hotel is located on Front street, about 2 blocks from Duval- an easy walk, but a calmer atmosphere than those hotels right on Duval. All in all, a great stay and would return again!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Value, Gorgeous Place - Best in Key West”
Reviews.Author: babygif
Reviews.Content: I was amazed at how gorgeous this resort was, from the entrance to the lobby to the walkways, to the room. It has a small boutique feeling. The area surrounding the pool/bar has couches with pillows very chic, warm feeling and relaxing. The view stepping out of our room onto the walkway was AMAZING!! Great view of the water from our balcony too. Room was gorgeous, modern and new. Loved the bathroom. Only one minor compaint, the AC is a wall unit, not central, so when you're in the bathroom it can get a little warm since the air is not distributed evenly. Very minor issue. We visited the Hyatt, and it looked not even in the same league as the Hyatt! STAY AT THE HYATT!!!!!! Worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “I loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Laurie123456
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights on vacation. We arrived early and we were able to check in early. The room we were in was huge (it was set up for handicapped access). I'm not sure if they are all that big but this one had plenty of space to spread out. Everyone at the hotel was nice. The hotel did have it's share of chair marking pool people, but we were on vacation and elected not to worry about it. The pool wasn't very big, but for the amount of people at the hotel it was sized just right and never crowded. The beach isn't much to speak of, but the water was nice to look at with easy access to everything in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “What a retreat! A perfect place to really enjoy it all!”
Reviews.Author: traveller1969
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt Key West Resort for 4 nights as a Hyatt Diamond member and the treated us really as VIPs! I can highly recommend the hotel, in the middle of it all, close to all attractions, nice small private beach and beautiful rooms. Spacious, well decorated and the latest gadgets to keep everybody happy (espresso machine on the room, 42inch flat screen, etc.). Go and book! You will not get disappointed! I rarely give the highest marks in my reviews, but in this case I had to give 5 out of 5.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, you will not be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: AllentownPaAnnieS
Reviews.Content: I have to start off by saying that I cannot for the life of me figure out how anybody can speak negatively about this hotel. I stayed here from June 9-13th 2009 with my husband and 2 friends. The moment we checked in we felt welcomed. Check-in was a breeze. I am a travel agent and it was my birthday on June 13th so I asked to be upgraded to a gulf front room. Done! Since I am limited w/space to write I will just say that I've stayed at 2 guest houses before I will always go back to the Hyatt. You will not be disappointed. Service is w/a smile, drinks are strong, perfect location, perfect weather. STAY HERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Service exceeded any of my stays in Disney”
Reviews.Author: Newark_Tink
Reviews.Content: I can't think of one single negative about this hotel. It was absolutley beautiful. Room was extremely clean and decorated so lovely. LOCATION WAS EXCELLENT!! It was close to everything yet quiet. The service was so awsome and so rare. And this is coming from someone who makes Disney her second home. Upon check in I wasn't just given my key and a map of the property, I was given a tour of the grounds, asked if there was anything that they could do for me, etc. And it didn't end there. Every time our paths crossed I was greeted with a smile and was asked how everything was and what they could do for me. Anything I requested was promptly attended to. I thought I died and went to hospitality heaven. In an age where service with a smile has been buried by fast, efficient and impersonal, what I experienced seemed surreal. If you stay here you have to take advantage of breakfast on site. It was delicious and Andrew, our server, each morning was so delightful. He remembered from day to day what we liked and disliked and he greeted us with a smile, like we knew him forever. I could go on and on. Pool is a bit small and there isn't an abundance of lounge chairs, but most Key West hotels do not have large pool areas, if at all. PS - Sunset viewed from this hotel is much better than the adjacent Mallory Square area, as there is an island obstructing your view at Mallory and not from the beach at the Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway!!! Relaxed!”
Reviews.Author: Turkbzerk
Reviews.Content: Needed to re-charge batteries and this was a great getaway! My wife is very particular and found this place to be beautiful and very very clean! White tile in bathroom...not a spec of mold or dirt anywhere!!! Great breakfast and awesome location!! Really enjoyed this place and would go back again in a heart beat! Highly Recommend.

Reviews.Title: “LOVELY ROOM & GREAT VIEW!!”
Reviews.Author: dawnso
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part or out honeymoon. Our room was amazing, King Suite but it was on 1st floor, next to restaurant that was being renovated at the time so bit nosey during the day. Not really an issue as we only stayed 2 nights. The pool area is tiny, with very few loungers so would have to there early but they do have small beach and deck area. We didn't use the bar as it was closed for a wedding.... the wedding itself actually took place below our balcony! We were surprised the room didn't have a mini bar, instead you have to order room service, which has $3 delivery charge. We did use room service for breakfast, which was delivered right on time and was lovely & hot.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I have ever stayed in !!!”
Reviews.Author: eddies26
Reviews.Content: I booked this trip as a surprise B-day present for my wife & wanted everything to be the best it could be. From the time we got there until we left the staff was extremely attentive, nice, helpful. Hands down the best hotel I have ever been too. There was a slight issue with our room when we got in & the manager stepped in & made it right by getting us a very nice room & some vouchers for the restaurant. The facility is beautiful & you could not ask for a better location. It is right in the heart of key west no need for a car what so ever. You don't even need to leave the hotel if you do not want. They run most of the excursions right out of the hotel also. To sum it up this was our first trip to key west & if there is a better hotel down there I would be surprised. So if you are looking for a place to go & enjoy downtown key west this is it. We cannot wait to go again nest year!!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing hotel, will not recommend or stay again.”
Reviews.Author: keri1995
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had two excellent experiences with Hyatt's and were looking forward to the newly renovated Key West resort. We have previously stayed at the Pier House, which we loved! Upon arrival we learned that our room was not ready. After being shown around the "grounds" (which are minimal at best) we learned that the pool was really a splash pool (the deepest point measuring 3 feet 9 inches), and the beach is essentially non-existent (maybe 6 lounge chairs) and you certainly can not go in the water... Eventually, we were shown to our room, where we learned, the refrigerator was really a "cooler" box and would not make your items cold, there are no robes in your room (despite what the website advertises), the extremely small balcony (which barely holds the two chairs and table overlooks the resort next door despite the room which room you reserved and paid for). During the week, the cleaning service simply forgot about us one day -- can not explain this at all... had to go and ask for fresh towels to shower after 5:15pm (ps: rooms are serviced between 8:30am and 5:00pm). By the way, the Hyatt has a number of properties in Key West and all of the guest from these properties are permitted to use the amenities at this resort during the day (ie: the "pool" and lounge chairs)... so if you do not go down in the morning and get a chair you may not have one with all the vistors from theother Hyatt's. This happened to us the first day. The bright spots are as follows: 1) the location is great; 2) room service (we ordered one night -- it was quick, good, efficient and the staff was friendly; and 3) the staff at the pool and bar (fyi -- pool bar closes at 11:00pm). The pool staff was generally very attentive. I am sorry to say it was a disappointing experience. The Hyatt is Aruba is so much better! I strongly suggest staying somewhere else... I will stay at the Pier House next time -- they have a beach and I never had to worry about getting a chair!

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not what I expected with Hyatt in the name.”
Reviews.Author: princsoreo
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after getting a great package deal online. As stated in the title, I enjoyed staying here, but didn't quite get the service I expected for a Hyatt hotel. When we checked in, we were offered a free glass of champagne and we said we'd like one, but it was never given to us and there was no mention of it it was coming or if they'd forgotten or what. Not a big deal, but not exactly stellar service. The room was spacious and beautiful. I loved the modern decor that felt clean and new. We went for the garden view room because ocean view isn't that big of a deal to us and it was nice. There was a tiny balcony with a table and two chairs. Perfect for people watching below. Our package included breakfast. If it didn't I'd skip the hotel breakfast and eat elsewhere. The food was good but expensive and service at the restaurant was far from impressive. Also, a cup of Starbucks brand coffee cost $4. I'm not cheap and I like to spend a little extra on vacation, but not on something I could get for less at a nearby Starbucks! There is also a hefty fee if you order room service. The pool was nice as was the pier. Bottom line: I'd probably stay here again, but if i found a better deal elsewhere I'd try it.

Reviews.Title: “good holidays”
Reviews.Author: jitendra04
Reviews.Content: very good location , nice and cosy rooms, but with lousy food.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property, Convenient Location, High Price”
Reviews.Author: KWLV
Reviews.Content: Our favorite hotel in Key West. We've stayed many times at the Hyatt. We note that it is a small hotel with small pool, etc., but that is not unusual for Key West. On water. No real beach but nice to enjoy looking out as boats pass by. The on-site restaurant is tops, and we would recommend a visit even if you don't stay at hotel. Request table on deck and enjoy the wonderful view. Consider staying here if location is important...right around the corner from heart of Duval St and all the associated action. If convenience of location is not important, then there are many equally fine hotels that are elsewhere in Key West for 1/2 the price (if not even cheaper). Key West is small place, so even if staying elsewhere, short cab rides always.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room ... Great Food!”
Reviews.Author: vbrudee
Reviews.Content: This was a quick get-away to escape the weather up North and pressures of work. If there was ever a room that could be based totally on the bathroom ... this was IT! The lighting ... the various tiles ... the raised sinks ... it was a totally luxurious experience. The huge walk-in shower area was highlighted by a entire back wall of green pastel tiles accented by white rock-like tiles on the side walls. It was spectacular. The room was comfortable BUT was located on the side of the hotel where there was a public beach which was noisy at night. The noise on the beach was nothing compared to the noise of some of the spring-breakers on our floor. Understand this is that time of the year, but people screaming, banging on doors and yelling obscenities just doesn't get-it for this level of property. We were surprised the hotel did nothing to manage this mayhem at 3:00 in the morning. The food ... it was the best of any place we ate on the Key the entire time we were there and that includes the way overpriced Sunset Key restaurant. Though the hotel did a good job of linking our two reservations (we were using points from two separate accounts) before we arrived, it seemed the person at check-in never understand what was going on so there was confusion with getting our room cleaned mid-way through our stay as room service thought we were checking out so they would not refresh our room. Hyatt indicates they are extremely customer-focused but they missed on this one - the front desk people really dropped the ball. All in all, a great place to stay - we will return!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place--highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Roamingtheworld
Reviews.Content: Our family just returned last night from a trip to Key West, and I am so glad we stayed here. Beautiful grounds with shuffleboard, ping-pong, pool table, sand volleyball, and large green space for kids, plus a very nice pool with sun and shade. We had an oceanfront room on the third floor, so the view to the beautiful water was excellent. Although not on a beach, the resort is on the ocean, and Smather's Beach is a mile down the road. Try the burgers at the Abbey Road Snack shack on the property; they are huge and tasty! Washer/dryer and beach towels are in each unit, and wi-fi is included. The only "con" I can think of is the hotel's distance from downtown; plan on 15-20 minutes to drive there and find a place to park. If you like outdoor dining, try Kelly's and Blue Heaven in Old Town. Both have excellent food and are family-friendly without being "over-run" by kids.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Key West Resort & Spa - Fabulous 4 nights stay”
Reviews.Author: curleys
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a trip to Miami, Key West and Naples. The Hyatt hotel was the best we stayed in on our entire trip. The location is grand for convenience, pool and oceanside bathing. The rooms were superb with walk in showers, newly furnished and consisted of separate living area as well as bed and luxury bathroom with wet room. The staff were very friendly, the cleanliness was superb and we could not fault anything. Choice of bathing areas, a lovely area with turtle pools near reception, free parking, we would go back here for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, look for a deal”
Reviews.Author: WWCOO
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel in early April. It is a very nice hotel. The rooms are excellent, and the views are equally good. Pool area and bar are very nice, though seats are limited. There is limited, if any, beach area to lay out. It is mostly pool and dock space for sunning. The staff was excellent, and parking is free in their lot. Internet is not free as I would expect for the cost, but it is available. I'd recommend becoming a Hyatt Gold Passport member, as they might upgrade your room for free. The location is hard to beat being one block away from the west end of Duval St, where all the action is. I'd recommend looking for a deal on their website or other hotel search websites. Last I checked, the one night charge was somewhere around $400+. Finally, I appreciate their kindness to military as the manager treated us to breakfast when she learned of my status. Thanks Hyatt. We had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view and great location but pricey”
Reviews.Author: OcalaGator
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt the first part of April as my daughter was getting married there. Ava was the events planner and did a great job. The hotel is directly on the water and the view was fabulous. You are within walking distance to Duval Street where the restaurants, shops and bars are. Nice pool or you can swim in the gulf. Now the not so good. At over $300.00 a night they set the record for what I have paid for hotel rooms in my lifetime. The restaurant charges $4.50 for a cup of coffee (another record) and breakfast was just as expensive and nothing special. I wonder why they have to charge $12.00 for bacon and eggs. Go to Pepes or Blue Heaven for breakfast. Also, they charge $10.00 a day for internet access. Go across the street to The Key Lime Pie Factory for a wi-fi hotspot and great key lime pie. If you dont mind the price STAY THERE. It is really beautiful !

Reviews.Title: “Good location, very nice staff”
Reviews.Author: betsy1224
Reviews.Content: We visited Key West for 3 nights (originally planned to stay 4 but decided to move on to Key Largo) in late February and stayed at the Hyatt Key West Resort & Spa. We chose this hotel, due to positive Trip Advisor comments, its convenient location and the fact that Hyatt offers a 20% discount for those age 62 and over. Even with the discount, the hotel was fairly expensive, but the rooms are lovely and the staff very accomodating and pleasant. The only downside is the pool area - there aren't that many chairs, and it's in the shade after 2 p.m. One very pleasant surprise was the onsite restaurant. We had breakfast there one morning, and the menu offered excellent choices (including healthful ones), and the food was extremely well prepared.

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fearful
Reviews.Content: We were able to secure a great rate for a two day stay at the resort. We were charged $360.00 for the first night and $180.00 for the second for a courtyard view king. Parking was available, too, at a charge of $12.00 per day. Happily, we were never charged. The hotel is well located- a few steps from the pier and a few more to Duval. We were there during spring break but the hotel and the street where it is located were seemingly immune from the chaos we observed elsewhere. Our room was lovely (just as on the site but even better) and overlooked a small pool containing turtles and a water feature that effectively cancelled any noise. We even could see a bit of the gulf from our balcony. There was no table on the balcony to enjoy a cup of coffee and breakfast, though. The room decor was fresh and contemporary, a nice change from the dark espresso furnishings that are ubiquitous elsewhere. Although the mattress was good, the linens were a tad rough. Lots of pillows, however. The flat screen TV is situated in the sitting area (charming) and is not optimal for viewing from the bed. We enjoyed the coffee machine in the room, but it is set up to make only one medium paper cup. We loved the bathroom. The large walk in shower enclosure with both a rain shower head and hand held shower feature allow two to shower comfortably. Lovely toiletries: key lime soap and eucalyptus shampoo, conditioner, etc. BUT ladies, no shower cap. Towels are plentiful. We did have a problem with housekeeping. There was only one hanger in our room when we first arrived. Although I called housekeeping immediately and was promised hangers within minutes, they were not there when we returned 6 hours later and I had to make another call. The next day housekeeping left coffee stains and hair on the counters and did not replenish all towels. I called management and a two person team came immediately and surveyed the room. The situation was immediately rectified. Although we did not request it, by way of compensation, we were awarded points on our Hyatt card. We did not take advantage of the pool, restaurants, and bar but did walk around the area. It looked lovely. Check-out was at noon and the hotel was unable to give us a late check-out. We did, however, keep our bags in a secure area and the hotel permitted us to keep our car in the lot for the full day. We were also invited to use the hotel facilities, including the pool past check-out. We are of the view that many hotels have problems. The litmus test is how one handles them. We were well satisfied with the response of Hyatt to our concerns. If we could secure a good rate, we would defintely return.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: fromtheusa
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a trip to Key West Flordia. Loved it! Stayed at the Hyatt Key West Resort and Spa. 1st of all the location is great - close to downtown and Duval Street, resturants, and shopping. I am really picky about where I stay. My husband booked this trip and hotel as a birthday surprise. And to be honest I was really nervous that he picked a hotel that I wouldnt care for. I was wrong the Hyatt was great - staff was wonderful and very helpful. Food / Bar / Pool and hot tub great. Room was fantastic. We had room #2208 overlooking the turtle pond. Concierge service on the property is very helpful and I recommend using them. They booked dinners, a fishing trip , snorkling trip for us (snorkling is not great - too cold and found out the sea is rougher in the winter months and we couldnt see anything - if you snorkle there do so in the summer when waters are calmer). I highly recommend spending the money to go deep sea fishing it was fantastic!!! Sailing there is also nice. My husband and I did use the spa - it is very nice, and ask for Gary he was wonderful. I am not the easiest to please when it comes to hotel/resort stays but this place has my vote.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in Key West”
Reviews.Author: cactus410
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 days at the Hyatt and it was fantastic. The check in was easy and the staff did eveything to make our stay perfect, thank you Ms Agbaba. First what the Hyatt KW is; a large upscale chain hotel that felt like a boutique hotel. The rooms were modern beach, very clean and the bathrooms were as pictured-fantastic. Room service was always less than 30 min and the food from "Shor" was great. It has one of the best pool bars in Florida. The hotel is less than 5 min walking to Duval St and the "Wharf" is next door. There are bike/motor scooter rentals next to the hotel. The best aspect of this hotel is that you are close to everything yet it is an oasis from the madness that can Key West. Now for what the Hyatt is not: there is no beach to speak off but rather a "sandlot" and water. To be fair most of the hotels are this way as Key West is not a sandy-beach destination. The hotel has a few spectacular view rooms, many average/partial view rooms and a few bad ones i.e. next to elevators or over the bar. If the view is important then pay for the ocean front rooms. The west side of the hotel( bld #3) is next to the public sandlot beach that has been mentioned before. The hotel is on the main channel to the harbor and can be busy/noisy. It has two sunning areas, pool and sundeck both are very nice but limited bar service. The spa has two great masseuse(s) Erin and Lucy. Although the rooms were nice there was a great deal of outside noise due to the fact they faced a parking lot. Finally the rooms do have floor unit AC which worked well but always have a background hum. Bottom line we would go back again and stay here. My advice is to relax, slow down and walk around until you find a place that you want to dine in.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: luvtravelluv
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice. The decor was very modern. I was really happy with the bathroom, I know that sounds wierd but it had a huge shower with no door, and really cool bowl sinks. We had a ocean view room and the view was amazing. (check out my pictures) The staff was fine I guess....now that I think about it I didnt really see them too much. The location was perfect. We walked everywhere. We rented scooters to go across town to a beach but other than that we walked to the rest of the trip and I am not really in shape! :) The pool was fine but it was small. The only bad thing I can say bad about this place is that the food is soooooo expensive. It was good but pricey at both the rest. and the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: oakchick
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hyatt in November 2008. The location, property, rooms, food were all amazing! Definitely worth the price for the rooms. The food was over-priced but then we found that most restaurants in Old Town were pricey. We had no issues with staff. Not overly friendly but courteous. The decor is superb. We had a king suite overlooking the gulf...it was perfect! Beautifully decorated and the bathroom was awesome too! Nice touches like rainfall shower head. The pool area was nice but the temp of the water was on the cool side. If you want a chair by the pool get there early as people do the "towel drop" to reserve their chairs. I would definitely go back and recommend it to friends. In fact we're planning our trip for 2009!

Reviews.Title: “Pass this hotel up....definitely not worth it!”
Reviews.Author: polo55polo55
Reviews.Content: We were not given the room we booked and paid for. Staff was dishonest, telling us they were giving us a room upgrade when in fact we were being given a room below the level we were paying for. No follow up by staff. Hotel is way over priced for what you get. Very small pool with not enough lounge chairs. Very little sun as pool area is surrounded by hotel buildings. "Private beach" is a joke...almost nonexistent.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing, more like a Resort/motel, NOT WORTH THE PRICE...”
Reviews.Author: klarkent
Reviews.Content: I am a VIP, Hyatt Gold passport Diamond Member staying at Hyatts over 100 nights a year. So I always want to write positive reviews about Hyatt. I had a nice, not great 1 week stay at this hotel, great location, nice rooms, but for $665 a night I had expected a lot more, most of all better service. I would have rather spent this type of money at a 4 star beach front resort in Hawaii, or Miami Beach rather than at the Hyatt Key West. Thank god I was upgraded to a Deluxe Gulf Front King!!! FIRST THE GOOD:This place has just been recently renovated, and the rooms are very nice. I would say the bathrooms are the highlight with a walk in rain Forrest Shower. The room lighting comes with dimmers, a nice large plasma t.v., and a refrigerator. Dinning: I really enjoyed the food and service in both the restaurant and room service. LOCATION: All the attractions of Key West are with in walking distance. This place is a nice little Oasis right off the drunken circus and rowdy scene which is Duval Street. NOW THE BAD: There is no central air in the rooms, they are equip with the typical noisy wall air conditioning units you see at Hyatt Place or in standard motels. The fitness room needs to be renamed to The fitness closet no more than 3 - 4 people can use it at one time, IT'S WAY TOO SMALL!!!. The beach as well is too small, not kid friendly and just plan disappointing. SPA?? well where is it? not your typical resort spa. No business center or computer station. Housekeeping majorly sucks. This was a Hyatt first for me. Everyday I had to call down to get my room serviced, sometimes as late as 5:00 PM. On top of that there were ants in my room. 2 -3 hotel staff members actually knew how to say good morning, most of the staff lacked general hospitality skills. I would say the front desk was generally off in another planet. I had a wonderful check in but for the rest of the stay they were very unhelpful. I get better service at a local In and Out Burger joint here in San Francisco. In the end if Hyatt wants to charge these type of rates it needs to drastically improve service at this hotel, and provide better recreation facilities. This place is over priced, I will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: snyd3202
Reviews.Content: The best location on Key West. The hotel is very nice. One of the nicer pools on the island, with a nice bar right near the pool. Hotel is located on the water with a marina. Keep in mind there isn't really a beach, per se, but almost all hotels on Key West are not really on a beach either. Only 2 blocks from the north end of Duval street and Mallory Square. This is where you'll want to spend most of your time. Pretty much every attraction on the island, Mallory Square, Duval, Hemmingway House, Southernmost Point, are all within walking distance. There is also a scooter rental company on-site that had the best selection of new scooters on the island, for the same price as pretty much everybody else. We only ever had breakfast at the hotel, but it was exceptionally good. If the price seems high compared to other similar properties, it is all because of the convenient location. If the Hyatt is within your budget, you won't find better accomodations on the island.

Reviews.Title: “the besyt place to stay in the keys”
Reviews.Author: tinalovesthekeys
Reviews.Content: Loved the Hyatt, been comibng to the keys for years and this is by far the best place I have ever stayed in. The staff, service all excellent. Even got a complimentary bottle of champagne and strawberries for our Anniversay night. You are treated like royalty here, my room has the same view as the photo they use in their promos. Glorious Azure water views. No wonder they get sold out so quickly. We even had a power outage on the island, but, the Hyatt has their own generators!! A and B lobster next door and fabulous. I am in heaven. Will always come back here. Even the bathrooms are large , luxury, CLEAN with key lime soaps. Maybe I will never leave LOL..........

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a tiny beach!”
Reviews.Author: cybertraveller696
Reviews.Content: I loved the hotel, especially after staying at the horrible Casa Marina. The staff were super friendly, the service was efficient and the room was great. Only let-down is the beach, which is tiny and the rather high room rate, hence only 4 points.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL but stay away from the homeless beach side of the hotel”
Reviews.Author: WillnRoss
Reviews.Content: The hotel as a whole was excellent! Great view, good service amazing rooms! You will not go wrong here! However there was a very rude member of staff who worked on the front desk, we had trouble as our room backed onto the side of the homeless beach which had a large police pressence. They were a little noisy and it did make you a little uneasy. When we explained this to her on the front desk (a german member of staff) she basically ignored our complaint and brushed over it and showed a complete lack of interest. However the front desk manager of the hotel was extreemly helpful and sorted our problems out. If you are lucky enough to stay here (it is amazing, you will love the rooms) just be sure to ask for a room away from the homeless beach and you will think you are in heaven!

Reviews.Title: “Great Time in Key West!”
Reviews.Author: NotherOne
Reviews.Content: We picked the Hyatt this trip after my last trip's "ocean view" room at the Westin that turned out to be a "cruise ship view". We were not disappointed - our ocean front room had a fantastic view of the water, palm trees, sunsets from all windows. We also had two balconies. Things to be aware of - many of which have already been mentioned here. Our room was in building 3 on the second floor right above the water sports desk, which meant that from about 9 am on there were lots of phone calls, some sort of air or fuel compressor running periodically, and the in/out of jet skis & boats. It is also right next to the public beach and the chatty parrot. For us, none of these things were a big issue and we did not try to move, but if you are looking for total serenity, the ocean front rooms in building 3 are probably not for you. We did have palm trees directly out our windows, but we thought they were pretty and added to the view. It was fairly cool during our stay, so we opted out of the beach/pool scene, in part because other than the small floating dock, much of the pool area is shaded, either by the buildings or by tented areas around the pool. If you are looking to bake in the sun for a few days, this may not be the best place. We intentionally wanted to be on the "happening end" of Duval Street and loved the location - walking distance to almost everything, but far enough away to be quiet at night. We did rent a golf cart one day to explore the "quiet side" of the island, Ft. Zachary Taylor, and our favorite, Louie's Backyard. If you want a quiet stay with a sunny pool scene and bigger beaches, try the south side of the island. But if you want great water views that aren't obscured by cruise ships in a location that is walking distance to all the bars, the Hyatt is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: drburb
Reviews.Content: Very nice stay at a great hotel. Recent renovations are very nice. We were greeted immediately by a very polite staff. We were given a personal tour of the hotel grounds by the concierge staff. All the staff called me by name during our entire stay. Hotel pool is very nice with comfortable chairs. Turtle pond was really neat. No real beach, has been washed away by recent storms. Dock on property has dive company and jet ski rentals on site. So no need to travel far for some excursions. We didn't eat at the hotel restaurant, too many other interesting choices nearby. Location was ideal. Two block to Duval St, half a block to marina area restaurants and stores. There is an annoying rooster in the parking lot, but you will see them all over Key West. Room was very nicely decorated in modern style. Bathroom was amazing, I am trying to figure out how to build that shower at home. I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt is not worth the price- Much better options in Key West !”
Reviews.Author: villanovatraveler
Reviews.Content: We just returned from one night at the Hyatt in Key West Florida. It is definitly not worth the price. The Hyatt room was very modern but not very relaxing. Our water view balcony was over the bar and parking lot and was very loud. Also, they have a parrot on the property that screams for hours during the day! The hotel does not have much beach access and the pool is extremely small. The pool is only 3 - 4 feet deep and cannot accomadate more then 5 people. Finally, we did not enjoy the location. It is close to the tourist / cruise side of Key West and is surrounded by very loud bars and is crowded with people. We enjoyed staying on the other side of Duval Street more at other hotels. It was very expensive and there are much better options in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Serenity at the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: guinevere422
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt was amazing! The room was modern and comfortable. We loved the peaceful fountains and turtle pond. The pool was very nice. We enjoyed the whirlpool but it was too windy for the pool. It is located close to Duval Street so we walked everywhere. That was a big plus! The only negative thing that happened was a rude awakening at 4am from the room next door. For at least an hour they kept us awake with loud talking/screaming and partying/moving furniture?!! This is not a reflection on the hotel but still annoying! Not even in the dive hotels I stayed in during spring break in college did I encounter such rude behavior!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: GaryGravy
Reviews.Content: We were in Key West in early October 2008 and really enjoyed our stay at the Hyatt. The location is great. Close to the action but quiet. While the hotel restaurant is currently under construction, there was no noise or disruption and a smaller version of the restaurant was open (but we didn't try it). One note, the staff of the hotel was very attentive and organized. One of the nights while we were there, the entire island was without power. They were very patient with everyone's questions and worries. They had glow stick there to pass out for guests. The bar was still open and the restaurant was serving what they could. They even filled my ice bucket for me since they ice machine wasn't working. They checked up on the guests to make sure everyone was ok. I was really impressed with their attentiveness. I guess they have pretty good practice with the hurricane procedures. But they were very helpful and kind. We had fun feeding the turtles. And if you get a chance, the jet ski tour from the Hyatt dock is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for Fantasy Fest”
Reviews.Author: Weeeeeee
Reviews.Content: I was at the Hyatt Key West Resort for Fantasy Fest 2008 for 5 nights. It was close to all the action on Duval Street, while being just far enough away so that when we wanted some quiet time, we could enjoy this wonderful resort. The staff was outstanding, from the front desk to the pool staff to the cleaning staff. All top grade professionals, friendly, customer oriented employees. We will definately stay there again for next year's Fantasy Fest!!! I highly recommend it. Also, our breakfast was included with our hotel room and they had many choices and the meals were great! We were able to have a really good breakfast, eat a snack during the day and went out to dinner each night. So, if you can get a deal like this, it was a definate cost savings. (Breakfast for 2 was approximately $50.00 before tip!!!)

Reviews.Title: “Key West...AWESOME!”
Reviews.Author: quinton21
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a fabulous 4 night stay in Key West (our first time in Key West) and had a blast. I will list some of the highlights... 1. The Hyatt: This was in the perfect location...we walked to everything. Duval St was 1 block and Mallory Square was 2. There is also a Marina next door with all the boating activities you could imagine. The room was perfect, extremely clean, AC was very cold, and the bathroom was huge. It had a nice balcony with a partial ocean view. We had breakfast each morning at the hotel and it was DELICIOUS! The workout facility and equipment seemed brand new. The hotel staff were wonderful to work with...each one went out of their way to smile and help with anything we were in need of. 2. Key West: My husband and I also rented a couple of small golf like cart cars and tooled around town. These were especially good when adventuring out to Hemingway's house and the Southernmost Point. There are also a couple of famous bars down that way( i.e. The Green Parrot). We had the time of our lives, much better than a moped. Each night we walked to Mallory Square for the Sunset and witnessed the most interesting street performer. He is known as "The Cat Man" his name is Dominique. He brought a smile to our face everynight with his show and his most interesting personality. His show and his "kitties" should not be missed! 3. Dining: There is no need to plan out your dining in advance. When strolling up and down Duval St all of the restaurants have their menus displayed out front. Take a gander and see what interests you. Each place has it's own personality. Two of our favorites were Salsa Loca and La Trattoria. We also vote Jack Flat's as the best burger (and we tried them all)! 4. All in all, we have only good things to say about Key West. It was everything we were looking for in a short FL vacation and will be back ASAP! P.S. The shopping is fabulous on Duval at Biton and Evan & Elle...ask for Dan.

Reviews.Title: “Best possible location”
Reviews.Author: kctangel
Reviews.Content: We went there for our anniversary and had a wonderful time. The hotel is located in the perfect spot to visit Duval St and Mallory square without sacrificing peace and quiet. Tons of restaurants and things to do nearby. As for the hotel itself, service was great. We had a turndown service every night with chocolate on our pillows and we never even requested it! We also got complimentary champagne and strawberries for our anniversary. Laura the concierge was wonderful. Be sure to eat at Sunset Key, Latitudes. Wonderful view, wonderful experience. The only downside of the hotel: unless want a balcony overlooking a beach of homeless people, do not get a room facing West. They are harmless, but our last night there we got to listen to police dogs barking as they got arrested. Insist on a water view room that does Not face west.

Reviews.Title: “South Florida Trip”
Reviews.Author: Shrimper72
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights and I have only good things to say about the Hyatt. Greeted on a blazing hot day after driving down from Key Largo with free bottles of water we were walked to our room by the guy on the front desk with the luggage following. Our large beach view room was fantastic, (it have may been the nicest hotel room I've stayed in and was on a par with a friends room at the Bellago in Vegas on the 26th floor that I watched the fountains in). Sporting two huge beds, flat screen plasma TV, fairly large fridge. The bathroom with it is adjustable lighting, massive two head walk in shower was excellent. The open air bar area is nicely laided out, perfect for a drink as the sun goes down and the pool and hot tub with it lovely padded sunbeds a joy to use. This experience was excellent, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back !!”
Reviews.Author: sunnyattitude21
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the most wonderful stay at the Hyatt Key West recently. We were in a King Suite right on the Gulf and the room and the view was awesome! We were celebrating our anniversary and the hotel made the stay the best ever! We can't wait to go back next year to celebrate. The staff was the best!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: lizziebill
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt for 2 days on vacation. We were greeted outside the hotel , and escorted into the hotel lobby. The hotel is beautiful, and extremely well maintained. The staff, all of them, were very friendly, and helpful. The room was clean and well laid, very modern and new. One complaint, maybe just in our room, but the volume on the flat screen TV would not go lower than a dull roar. The bathroom was awesome, with two shower heads and lots of lights. Snorkling was out of the question due to high winds. However, I went snorkling off the small beach, and found plenty of fish to look at under the dock. Overall a very pleasant stay, and looking forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: blueasha
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Hyatt Key West and it was nice to return once the vast majority of renovation had been completed. Unfortunately minor renovation had been started on their main restaurant, Nicole's. However that couldn't dampen our experience. The staff as always, at the Hyatt hotel's, were incredibly friendly and courteous and helped make our stay even better. Our room was beautiful,modern and spacious, as well as being very comfortable with all the amenities we could need. Food was top notch particularly breakfast and the morning paper was a great touch allowing me to keep up to date with the Olympics and the British medal haul! One particular member of their staff should get particular praise as she was incredibly helpful at recommending trips and places to visit and getting them sorted for us. Laura on the concierge was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms but not so nice pool & beach access with diesel fumes”
Reviews.Author: CleoStockholm
Reviews.Content: We had a full ocean front king room so the view and room was very very nice with 2 balconies with amazing views. Downside was very small beach access & pool, the beach access & water had to be shared with boats and scooters - a really busy and disturbing element.
