On top of that diesel fumes constantly and hence a big disapoointment. The hotel next door had a secluded swim only area and bigger pool - think twice about this hotel due to this.

Reviews.Title: “a quiet get away”
Reviews.Author: fishinainteasy
Reviews.Content: I thought the hotel was very clean and the rooms were simple and modern. The pool is less than 4 foot deep all around so it was a little warm. Its very close to duval street, but also close to a huge marina, were you can talk to boat captains about fishing trips and sunset cruises. I suggest you bring a little money if you want to experience key west fishing! Night fishing for shark costs about $600, but if you bring people who will chip in its not so bad. I did a split charter 3/4 day for $200. I really enjoyed it was worth the money, I just couldn't find anyone to split the night trip. I did alot of exIploring key west and I think the hyatt was the nicest there as far as hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Counting the days until our return!”
Reviews.Author: suzbri
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Key West Resort and Marina exceeded our expectations by far! We traveled to Key West to celebrate our 10 year anniversary without our children. We were attracted to the Hyatt because of its location and the reputation that preceded the Hyatt name. We were not disappointed! The hotel was extremely clean and well-kept. The staff was accomodating and friendly. The pool bartender was personable and creative - the concierge was efficient and informative. We were offered an upgrade to our room because of our anniversary and were given a beautiful room directly facing the Gulf with double balconies, a huge bathroom with a marble mosaic shower that had double shower heads, a plasma TV, an enormous, comfortable king-size bed and clean, fresh decor. The hotel also surprised us with a bottle of champagne and chocolate covered strawberries in our room on one night of our stay. We were a short 3-5 minute walk to both Duval Street and Sunset Pier. We took advantage of the jet ski company's tour of the island offered at the Hyatt and it was wonderful - fast and fun! We will stay only here when we return - this hotel is highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and modern renovations, but.....”
Reviews.Author: Gambles4
Reviews.Content: Renovations are a massive improvement for the Hyatt on Front Street in Key West. Obviously matching the South Beach style with water gardens, turtle sanctuary, modern baths with lots of glass, low lighting and soft "spa" music. However, the elevator was not working the entire week we were there and we had to walk up the stairs to our room on the 2nd floor. The resturant was pretty good, but an abundance of places to choose from across the street in the Historic Seaport. We had to get our bill corrected 4 different times due to over charging of "resort fees" that were included in our package. Pool is extremely small, but it is a small property. Balcony was too small to enjoy in the "Partial Ocean View" rooms. Much larger in the "Ocean Front rooms" and worth paying the extra $$. Rooms were very modern and a great improvement. I would stay there again, however, I prefer to try the "Westin" down the street first. Location was nicer at the Westin and so was the crowd....

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: dollyevison
Reviews.Content: My Husband and i were touring the Keys and spent 2 nights at the Hyatt. We booked in on arrival and had no problem booking a room. We even got to view the room before we made our booking. The staff on arrival were very helpfull and pleasant. It was quite expensive, but you definately got what you paid for! It is newly refurbished, the room was wonderful very cosmopolitan, and the bathroom was amazing, huge shower, no bath though and twin basins. The pool area was very nice, i would say it was more suitable for adults as we did not see any children around. There is a very small beach, but that is very typical of the Keys, it was adequate and we swam in the sea and out to the pontoon. We had a meal in the the pool bar which was very good one of the best prawn salads i have ever had!!. Breakfast was menu choice{no buffet} very pricey, but again of very high quality. Probably would have been much cheaper to have eaten breakfast in one of the local restuarants. The hotel is idealy located for walking to all of the tourist attractions, with lots of restaurants in close walking distance. A good way to see all of the sites is to take a tour on the Conch Train. A must is Mallory Square and the pier at sunset. Hemmingways House is very interesting as well. We also did the Champagne Sunset trip on the hotels Yacht, well worth it the sunset was incredable, very well organised as well. Just one word of warning we had a ticket to park in the Hotel carpark and when we checked out and tried to leave, the carpark ticket machine tried to charge us, its free for hotel guests! Over all an excellent stay i would highly recommend this hotel we had a fantastic time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, but you might have to climb stairs, for a while.”
Reviews.Author: RBKPennsylvania
Reviews.Content: A excellent hotel with an outstanding view of the beautiful sunsets each night. When we arrived late in the evening we were informed that repairs had disabled all the elevators in our building and they would be out for over a month. They told us to contact the manager the next morning, which we did. He moved us to another building (This one had one elevator that worked. The rest were also being worked on) but everything else was fantastic. The grounds are beautiful and the staff goes out of their way to please. If you have health issues call and check about the elevators, just in case.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: Millakins
Reviews.Content: We booked a block of rooms for a wedding at this newly renovated hotel, and our guests were so impressed! The rooms are so modern and clean! The location is perfect, walking distance from many restaurants, bars, and Key West attractions. The staff was incredibly helpful, and the pool was beautiful, with plenty of shade provided by the cabanas. The pool bar food is even worth mentioning! This hotel is well worth the price. It even has a tiny slice of beach, which in Key West is very hard to come by. I have stayed at most of the major chain hotels in Key West and I would stay here again in a heartbeat! My favorite--the turtle pond right outside of the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: andrewdayo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights from 2nd May' 08. Our room was fantastic although a little expensive at $400 p/night but we had a gulf front king with a fantastic view as you can see with our photos attached. The pool was a little shaded late in the afternoon but all in all a very welcoming medium sized hotel. Do not let the hotel fool you into thinking there is a beach though. OK, there is a beach but has just enough room for 4 beds on the sandy area but then if you fancy a dip in the sea it is there for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Place, Great Overall Experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: ccjersey
Reviews.Content: To start, I will say I booked ten months in advance and got a pretty good rate (considering the normal rates) and the sunshine on sale promotion (7th night free). I booked the Deluxe King Ocean Front. That's exactly what we got. It was beautiful. I'd be swimming if our balcony was any closer to the ocean. Front desk & check in extremely easy, fast & efficient. All the staff extremely polite & pleasant. I did not encounter any foreigners as mentioned in some posts. Our room was located in the third building over (closest to Galleon) and our room was on the 3rd floor above the Nichola restaurant, last room, 1201. It was actually the 3rd floor but they called it the 2nd, (Ground, 1, 2, etc.). Room was very clean. Bathroom very nice, bed gorgeous, flat screen, etc. exactly like the pics on the website. Shower water ran off a little slow, but that was my only complaint about the room. Balcony had two sliding glass doors & a large window in the middle of it. There were two chairs, two ottomans & a table with some plants. Bring a travel candle and sit out & watch the sunset, it was superior than to watching it anywhere else!! The sun ducked down between the two islands & there was no obstruction as you watched it sink below the ocean. Lots to watch from the balcony as well, boats, jetskis, etc. We even saw a dolphin jumping out a few times!! Beautiful. Galleon guests next door can be loud at times, but they are fun to watch. Lots of places to lay out in the sun - sun deck, small beach spot, pool area. My only complaint was that two different occasions they had to set up a private party on the sun deck or the small beach area. So, if you opted for the beach at 10:00 am (when there were plenty of chairs available at the pool) you were nice & comfy - until the catering manager comes over at around noon to tell you that in about an hour you have to go somewhere else!!!! If there was a sign stating this, I could have easily snagged a lovely pool lounger when there were plenty available at 10 am - but now at noon there were none!! This was really infuriating. Also, there was a private function one day on the small beach, the people attending the function all had towels & stuff at the pool chairs while they attended the function! So they took up double space. That is my only complaint about our stay, besides those two incidents it was all lovely - pool bar & staff very polite...a great experience all in all & if I got a good rate again, I would definitely choose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wow wow wow wow wow”
Reviews.Author: edog152
Reviews.Content: I had my 3rd brain surgery in April, and it was a hard one but I told myself when I got strong enough and the doc(s) allowed me to travel that I was going to go to KeyWest. The Key West Hyatt is A+ all the way around.. From the bellmen to housekeeping. I agree with others the resturant is quite interesting. Luke the Director of Food and Beverage is working on it and IM sure things will improve as the time goes. Linda one of the front office managers was great. She was in the lobby when I arrived and SHE checked me in even though there was a desk clerk availble. My room was 2101 and it was among superior than I ever expected. It had two balconys, one with a straw table with two chairs, and the bigger one had a chair with autmum and a sunbed. It had two air conditoner units, one near the bed and one on the TV wall on the far side of the room. I always used the one near TV and only used the bedside AC during the afternoon. There was a ceiling fan above the bed to help move the air. I often heard kids running around making noises, and i heard a few times kids screaming there heads off, I checked out the door and no one was drowning in the pool.. but still KIDS need to be on a leash! I did walk around the town a bit, it is simply AMAZING

Reviews.Title: “relax watching the sunset”
Reviews.Author: ChrisGem
Reviews.Content: wonderful place to stay on key west. The rooms are excellent, with good facilities for disabled travellers. We had a gulf view room and the view was wonderful, great for watching the sunset and the wildlife. The pool is not very large or deep but nice, the spa/jacuzzi was lovely! the are lots of different little areas to relax on sun beds, the tiny beach is lovely for a dip in the sea. Its a great location, right next to the harbour and the town centre. make sure you enjoy the managers cocktail party on wed night for free drinks and lovely snack food at the bar, great way to try out the food - that night we didn't need to eat out afterwards.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, better hotel!”
Reviews.Author: newtomd
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night for free with Hyatt points and then moved to the Westin for three nights with a Starwood discount. Gosh, do we wish that it was the other way around. We had an gulf view room, which directly overlooked a quiet sandy lounge area and the gulf. It was an amazing view. The room was immaculate (much better than the Westin) with an incredible bathroom with walk-in shower (that was as big as the whole bathroom at the Westin. We do not have children and like quiet resorts. This really fit the bill. I only saw one well behaved child during our stay. Most of the guests were likewise quiet and laid back. Needless to say, the pool was very relaxing. There was a wade in area if you wanted to swim in the gulf (the water was beautiful), but I wouls not call it a beach. There was also watersports rentals, but due to our short stay we did not try them. The location was the best part of the hotel ... close to both Duval Street and the Bight (the marina area of town). Personally, I liked the atmosphere, bars, and food better around the Bight than Duval Street. All in all great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Not my favorite”
Reviews.Author: TriformToaster
Reviews.Content: This was our third trip to Key West. Previously we had stayed at the Hyatt located just as you get to Key West (about four miles from the old town). If you don't mind being away from the action, that is a wonderful place to stay. This time we thought we would stay closer to the center of town. We were not impressed. The room was small, the air conditioning was extremely noisy and we had to set up a barrier so it wouldn't blow directly on us as we slept. The tiny balcony was ridiculous. The room was never made up until after 4 p.m. (a real pain). We had to call practically every day. The location is good. One night we decided to try the restaurant in the hotel, apparently because the weather was bad they couldn't serve us anything but wine, because the bar outside was closed. We went somewhere else. All in all next time we'll stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: quoftalk
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here May 2007 for our 25th wedding anniversary. At the time they were in the completion stages of a remodel, but this in no way hindered us in having a good time. The hotel employees were all very friendly and helpful. We informed the lady we checked in with that we were there for our anniversary and while we were out one day, came back to a bottle of wine, strawberries and chocolate...how nice. We thought there would be a beach, but in Key West there really is not much of a beach there anyway. That's ok, we still had a good time. Our room was very nice, flat screen tv, very comfy bed, and the bathroom was pretty awesome, the shower had a "rain" shower. We were also right on the ocean and our view from the balcony was beautiful. We ate breakfast a few mornings at the hotel and it was wonderful. Key West has great food, and the location of the hotel was GREAT. We could walk to several restaurants that were at the pier that were very authenic, I don't think we had a bad meal. We could also walk to alot of neat shopping. We rented bikes and that was alot of fun!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort - A comprehensive review”
Reviews.Author: jojemud
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a nice trip to Key West, FL. We stayed at the Hyatt Key West Resort and Spa because we've had above average experiences in the past - some great, some not so great. This was a safe bet for a hotel choice for a place we've never been. I want to provide a detail report on this resort as I think it would be helpful. All the reviews I've read had a generalized bent so this will give you every little detail you need to decide whether this is the hotel for you. The hotel is located on a fairly remote corner of Old Town, away from touristy Mallory Square and the famed Duval Street. It is the only one of few truly 4-star "resort" in Key West. It faces the Gulf of Mexico, and if you get a room with water view, it is truly one of the best places to stay. The Goods: 1) We had a 4 night reservation for a garden view room and upon arrival they only found 1 night (this is also bad) however in apology they upgraded us to a partial gulf and pool view for the entire stay for the price of a lesser room. 2) The room is immaculate, and with the $10 million renovations completed every room is perfectly appointed, clean, and modern. 3) The Pool - it is small but is comfortable to hang out in and around with many lounge areas to enjoy the sun 4) The view is wonderful if you have a gulf view room 5) Customer service is fairly good although don't expect something to be fixed immediately if, let's say your tv remote breaks. It takes a bit of time. 6) Water activities are provided directly at this hotel - you may launch right at their dock and go sailing, snorkeling, parasailing and jetskiing. Concierge handles all arrangement. This is a huge convenience because we didn't want to make calls and book reservations through the many charting companies in Key West. So our activity planning was effortless. 7) The turtle pond - wonderful turtles sunbathing and swimming happily in the pond. 8) late pool hours, you can swim until Midnight. The Not So Good: 1) This hotel is kid friendly, so you will find many kids screaming in the pool in all hours 2) The staff is only somewhat friendly. They are fairly ok but don't expect a warm aloha as you would in other island resorts. I am used to splurging on resorts so I'm used to top notched smiles from everyone who works at the hotel 3) The room's patio is ridiculously small on most rooms, unless you get the suite. 4) The prices are that of a 5-star hotel, not 4. This hotel is 4-star and doesn't fall short of that but at $650-$750 a night you will wish you didn't pay that much. 5) The renovations to the rooms and most of the facility are great. There are problem areas, such as the hallways which seemed a bit moldy. But being next the the ocean I think the hotel can't avoid such problems. But I would have liked it if they cleaned the doors, hinges, the handles a bit as it was a little rusty and dirty. 6) The hotel has a "spa" in its name- they have a spa called Jala but it is by all means, not a spa at all. It is a by-appointment-only service (massage, facials, wraps) and it is only a 2-room area within the hotel. You can't go there yourself and must have the concierge take you there. I find this hilarious that they overpromote themselves this way. I felt really misled because I really wanted to experience a real spa pampering service. 7) The hotel advertises two beaches - but they are not real beaches but rather, small sanded area with lounge chairs. This was also disappointing as well. 8) Key West is a drinking town, so two nights in a row we've had drunk disturbances (screaming, shouting at 2am) when I've had to call front desk to get security. 9) TV remote died and we've had to wait 2 hours for battery replacement. 10) Most people wrote in their reviews that there are no coffee makers in the room. But I found it! It's in a little photo box stuck in the linen closet on the top shelf. Unfortunately I found it the day we checked out! There you have it. I would provide pictures but it would be the same as everything out there which are pretty accurate depictions of the what it is.

Reviews.Title: “Good option for Key West lodging - Great location/Spotty Service”
Reviews.Author: CAL777
Reviews.Content: Had an overall nice 4 night stay at the Hyatt in early March with a few spotty service issues. Hotel was conveniently located right by the Harborwalk and the pool area/waterfront were nicely landscaped. It's a petite hotel befitting Key West and worth the stay if you are in the area. Following recent renovations, the rooms are nicely appointed in a modern island style. We had a "city view" (lowest tier room, 4th floor) and were pleasantly surprised that our room had a water/pool area view (not direct but easily visible from the balcony). Our balcony was small but fine for the two of us. There was a comfortable table and chairs set out there. The bathrooms are nicely equipped and done in the "spa" style with the large showers and modern sinks. Housekeeping was prompt servicing the room each morning. We had breakfast outdoors at Nicola and the view was beautiful. It was busy (and, again, on the smaller side) so you may want to consider making a reservation. I enjoyed their fruit plate and some toast while my husband indulged in an egg dish. Food was good but service was slow. Unlike other Hyatt properties we've stayed at, they do not offer a breakfast buffet. The pool area bartender was friendly and quick to make a strong drink! In terms of negatives, front desk staff was young, inexperienced, and rather unprofessional. Hopefully Hyatt works on the customer service training here given that the hotel is a Category 5. We received a notice on our bed that our iHome alarm clock would automatically reset for Daylight Savings. This didn't happen and so we were late for a deep sea fishing excursion. We nicely notified the front desk of this and they said nothing other than yes that was a problem. Not the Hyatt standard that I am used to... Regardless, I'd stay here again but would price shop versus the Westin given the service issues we encountered. I much prefer other Hyatt properties over this one but it is a good option if you will be in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, Great Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: EmilyinAustin
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our trip to Key West where we stayed at the Hyatt Resort and Marina. We had a fabulous experience that exceeded our expectations. Our room was beautiful and our bathroom was top-of-the-line. Our "city-view" actually included a partial ocean view and we enjoyed mornings and evenings on our balcony (although small). As I had read on this site, there is a small public beach with public bathroom facilities next door to the hotel. There were a few homeless folks hanging out there, but they did not bother us and actually it was a little interesting watching their interactions. The only negative aspect I can think of was the trash dumpster pick-up early in the mornings. I don't know how you can get around that, but we went back to sleep after the truck left - just reminded us we COULD go back to sleep instead of having to get up to go to work! Every employee we met was extremely pleasant and very welcoming. We had AAA rates which included a wonderful breakfast each morning. We were so pleased with the food and service, that we didn't get to venture out to other breakfast spots. Also, the location could not have been better. We were just steps away from great activities and restaurants at the Historic Seaport as well as the infamous Duval Street Restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome and Luxurious with a Few Glitches”
Reviews.Author: Stamboy
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a 10 night stay and I must admit the place is amazing! The hotel design is based on a Caribben resort and it sits right on the waterfront close by to all the things anyone would want to do in beautiful, fun Key West. The rooms are just as shown in the photos: beauitfully contemporary and luxurious. The views were spectacular, but I had to pay extra for the privilege. I could lay in my big bed and watch the boats pass by and neighboring islands, as well as the sunset. The pool was small and the beach smaller, but really it wasn''t that important since I mostly wanted to get a tan and there were numerous palces to get sun all day long. And the sun down there is intense, so be carefull and bring loads of sun block. Within a block were numerous excellent restaurants and shops with all sorts of menus. I especially liked being able to walk one block to the beginning of the main harbor and dockage area for Key West. There were lots of day trips to snorkel, dive, fish or just go for a sunset cruise. And the seafood at the dozen or so eating establisments was nothing less then excellent. A two block the other direction lands you at the foot of Duval Street, the central people watching street. Another block and you are at Mallory Square, home to the nightly sunset festival and freak show. The Hyatt had drawbacks in the strangest places for a luxury resort. The housekeeping service was uneven and unpredictable. While the grounds were spotless, I often had to clean up my room a little after housekeeping finished. But sometimes it was all done perfectly. Nightly turn down was again sporadic. Seems a mangement problem from afar. The restaurant had a limited menu and the food was excellent, but service seemed at best amateurish and at worst it stunk! Employees were often from Eastern Europe (????) and English was NOT their first language. But this was something I found across Key West. Those emplyees that seemed to have been born in the US were snobbish and sometimes it seemed you had to beg (or maybe I shoulkd have bribed) the Concerige to get assistance. But OVERALL the place is awesome and these annoying glitches can be corrected through better magement and trainining, so I plan to return next winter and stay perhaps for 15 days.

Reviews.Title: “Renovations Are Done”
Reviews.Author: CarpeDiem45
Reviews.Content: I have been following the reviews of the Key West Hyatt for some time as they unwent their renovations. I was initially worried about some of the more negative reviews but was pleasantly surprised. By the third week of Janury, the renovaton were completed so our stay was probably more what one would expect in th future. The hotel is beautiful and very "New York looking. Staff was helpful but you must measure it by "Key West" standards where everything is quite laid back. We enjoyed our stay and had a beautiful room overlooking the Gulf. Hotel was very quiet and clean. The roosters did not distrub us...neither did the turtles. Enjoyed watching the activity in the harbor from the balcony. Restaurant was quite good. The photo included in the hotel's listing is accurate.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Mini Vacation To Key West!”
Reviews.Author: L0ttieL0u
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hyatt Key West Hotel and Marina Dec. 23-28, 2007. Our hotel experience was excellent! After I booked the trip and read some of the reviews I was skeptical about what to expect as far as customer service. We found everyone to be extremely helpful, friendly, and nice. The employees are mostly from other countries but we did not experience a language barrier. We had to call maintenance to our room to open our vault and even he was extremely courteous! We are AAA members and I included this infomation when I booked the hotel. This entitled us to receive coupons for a full-service breakfast each morning. Make sure you do this as you book your trip. It was delicious! The rooms are very spacious, sleek, and contemporary. The walk-in, huge shower was also very chic.. Walk in, sit on a stool, and let the water run over you as the stresses of life are erased. I had read there was no coffee in the rooms but we did have a coffeemaker that made individual cups to satisfy us until we made it over to the restaurant for breakfast. The location of the hotel cannot be beat! It is steps away from everything.....Duval St., Mallory Square,and restaurants. The power went out all over the island on Christmas night for a little over an hour. They said this ocassionally happens. Visit the Blonde Giraffe across the street for the best ever Key Lime Pie!!! Go next door to the Marina to Alonzo's for great sea food. Everything on the left side of the menu is half price from 4:00-6:00 pm. We rented a car for a day and drove to Miami. Had to see Miami and South Beach! Glad we did it but it was a grueling 8 hour trip both ways on what was 2 lanes much of the way. We had a wonderful mini vacation. Loved everything!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely but pricey”
Reviews.Author: PhillyBased
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here from 11/29-12/7/07; we were in Key West for our wedding and honeymoon. Overall, the Hyatt is in a wondeful location, close to Mallory Square/Duval and the waterfront/marina (my favorite area of Key West). We were upgraded to a waterfront room overlooking the Gulf and the pool. PROS: 1) Spacious and clean room 2) Comfortable bed 3) Awesome shower 4) The pool - drinks/food were really good. 5) One day, while in the hot tub, the server brought out cool lavendar-scented towels - a nice touch! 6) Friendly staff 7) Watersports (parasailing and waverunners) available right off hotel dock CONS: 1) Construction (new decking) the entire time we were there, right below our room (which is possibly why we were upgraded). Noisy during the day. 2) The price, but we were able to take advantage of their "sunshine special" promotion with 5th night free. We would stay here again, if able to take advantage of a free night's stay, as I agree with other reviewers that the price is steep. The location is perfect however, and we truly had an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: ET69
Reviews.Content: pretty grounds. convenient location. tiny "beach." poorly designed bath and shower.(slow to drain) minimal amenities.(ex. no coffeemaker) bottom line......not worth the price!

Reviews.Title: “It'll be better when it's finished !”
Reviews.Author: VanninLady
Reviews.Content: This hotel is at the tail end of going through a multi million dollar refurbishment, but it isn't quite finished. We had paid handsomely for a gulf front room and were given one with the view obscured by palm trees and overlooking construction ongoing two floors below. We were moved to a less noisy room after some debate. The room was bright, spacious and cheerful - colour dashes of lime green and orange - very tropical. Lots of niggles: the patio door runner was bent and very noisy to open; housekeeping was below average with toiletries not replaced, bed not properly made etc . Large spacious walk in shower and fluffy robes - nowhere in the bathroom to hang either towels or robes ! The restaurant food was excellent but understaffed. Not a great setting for sun worshippers as the building is in a U shape and gets very little direct sun over the pool. Main selling point: a good location - easy walking distance to Mallory Square, and the tourist train / tram. (we're not likely to go back to Key West but would look at the Westin instead if we did!)

Reviews.Title: “A great choice in Key West”
Reviews.Author: lf_847
Reviews.Content: Booked this place after reading many online reviews and we have to say we were pleasantly surprised. Probably the best thing about the Hyatt is the location - about a five minute walk to Duval St and Mallory Square (sunsets), and maybe five minutes the other direction to the marina for fishing charters, sunset cruise, snorkel trips, and what we thought was the best seafood restaurant among the many we tried (Conch Seafood). We walked all over Key West including from the Hyatt all the way up Duval to the other side of the island (Southernmost Hotel, southernmost point, Casa Marina) and really liked being at the Hyatt for the short walk to everything. The pool is adequate but does not get much sun after about 1pm so be aware of that. They do have a small sun deck which is quiet and relaxing and a good place to snooze in the sun. There are also jet ski rentals and parasailing right off the Hyatt's pier so you don't have to go far for activities. We can't comment on the food as we never once ate there (too many other interesting choices within an easy walk) but the poolside bar is an ok place for a drink. Hyatt does run the "4th night free" promotion often which is what we booked so look for that. In all, we stayed 4 nights at the Hyatt and 2 nights on South Beach in Miami and wished we would have just stayed all 6 nights on Key West. Last, as this was our first trip to Key West we were surprised by just how long the drive from the Miami airport takes - be prepared for four hours, plus, from the time your plane lands to the time you're in Key West, despite the 155 miles distance. We would stay at the Hyatt again, definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Its not worth 450”
Reviews.Author: luvsxm
Reviews.Content: well this is your classic refurb hotel with a great location overcharging on everything .. we booked this online at their site be careful to check all the promos they run IT WILL COST YOU IF YOU DONT.. Room .. average room Bed ... great bed balcony --- a squeeze for two TV ---- flat screen nice Internet -- YUP its NOT free $10.00 a day ???? Coffee machine non existent -- why free if they charge $12 plus plus for a pot Bathroom -- awesome Parking $$ yup ANOTHER $10 a day ... Staff all from the Ukraine Bulgaria Poland you get the picture engliz not so good dont bother asking for anything they wont do anything // o I booked the wrong package same price no breakfast as the package with breakfast my mistake but nope booked online at hyatt.com nothing we can do Location ... cant beat it for fantasy fest Its not worth $300 Looked at the prices for Fantasy Fest after FF it was 450 a week later its 650 a night So forget it wont be back ... enjoy but be careful

Reviews.Title: “Price is the tipping point”
Reviews.Author: Jackman1
Reviews.Content: Most of the hotel renovations are complete. Rooms are nicely appointed, bathrooms are a 10. Pool area, new bar...place looks sharp. Excellent location, 5 minute walk to Duval and Mallory Sq.. I've stayed here before when the renovations were going on(much to my surprise). Hotel has serious service issues from bellman, check in, housekeeping, room service, cafe people etc. The issues were raised with the front office and only your experience will tell if they took root. You must ask for turndown, and ask if you want the sheets changed daily. Coffee in room is gone and replaced with complimentary coffee in the cafe for Gold Passport members(it's free to sign up). Hyatt runs many promotions, Sunshine on Sale, 4th night free, free breakfast etc so it really depends on what you pay for what you will feel this hotel is worth. My opinion is under $300 OK, over $300 and you may feel cheated in what the hotel can deliver. Santiago Bodega and Blue Heaven in a hardscrabble neighboorhood about a 20 minute walk from the hotel. Santiago is a charming Tapa style restaurant-excellent. Blue Heaven(breakfast starts at 8am) is a fun place with excellent food and service and serves BLD. Didn't get to the RoofTop Cafe although looked very inviting-the 2 tacos and tequila for $7 at the Island Dog won out for the last night. Danger Charter has a Wind and Wine sunset cruise $65 that is first class. Small crowd on board, personal service and an excellent selection of red/white wines/beers/soft drinks and California champagne. Meats, crackers, cheeses, crudites round out the spread for your enjoyment with lite music playing as the sun went down.

Reviews.Title: “Confirmations Mean Very Little”
Reviews.Author: mdc12760
Reviews.Content: Two weeks after confirming a stay at the Key West Hyatt, I called to find out if I could upgrade my last two nights of a four-night stay to a Deluxe Room. I had looked on the web site, and it showed the Deluxe as being available for those two nights. I was told that the web site was inaccurate; no problem -- those things happen. But within minutes, I received an e-mail saying that I had been downgraded to a room with less of a view than the one that I had received confirmation for. I have e-mailed and called repeatedly to find out how this could happen, and was told once that the problem had been resolved, only to get another e-mail the next day saying that I couldn't get the view I was originally booked for. Whether my stay there is good or not, I'll have to comment on later. However, I'm disturbed that a confirmation apparently means nothing, and that Hyatt has done NOTHING to explain how this could happen or do anything to try to make the situation better. Unfortunately, by the time we received word that our accommodations had changed, it was too late to look for another hotel. This isn't what I expect from Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: LUCD
Reviews.Content: Went to Key West for the Harley Davidson poker run and being on Duval Street the Hyatt sounded like a perfect choice. If location is what you are looking for,this hotel is your best bet. We had the ocean view room which had a beautiful ocean view, the room was clean and nicely decorated in a very simple way. We also had a large balcony which we couldn't use due to construction on the roof causing the balcony to get extremely dusty. They don't have a spa or a gift shop or a business center or after hours room service or a mini bar. The restaurant is still under construction. Also be aware that most maids don't speak english and at least one of them seemed to think it was ok to walk in without knoching and start cleaning even if you are NAKED!!!!! Also have breakfast somewhere in Duval, it will be cheaper and better!!!

Reviews.Title: “One of my favourite places on earth - KEY WEST”
Reviews.Author: CulinaryDelight
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely time here last December. Unfortunately the swimming pool did not get sufficient sunshine we thought so sometimes the water was a little cool. The rooms were lovely with super decor. We found the staff very helpful and friendly. We would stay there again. Jenny & Roland Cox Cambridgeshire United Kingdom

Reviews.Title: “Very poor service”
Reviews.Author: Kolya
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a nice location and rooms, but everything else is much worse than what one could expect from a Hyatt establishment. Service is extremely poor and there is complete lack of courtesy. The check-in and check-out processes were very inefficient and the room was not ready until about 45 minutes past the check-in time, which was 4pm. The room that I was eventually given had an unbearable smell of chlorine bleach and. the gulf view was totally obscured by trees. There was no other deluxe gulf front available (there are only four of these rooms, and there are additional four similar rooms in another building but the management calls them for some reason grand salon and mysteriously such category doesnâ€™t exist on the website). The management finally gave me a regular golf view room (bit smaller but with a nice gulf view), and offered to refund the difference in price. The new room was nice but there was some smell in the bathroom. In many ways this place operates like a vacation club rather than a luxury hotel and it is not difficult to get disappointed here. The deluxe gulf view rooms in building 3 are next to a little beach, and a street, that can get very noisy. Food in the main restaurant was good but overpriced. The swimming pool is very small. Overall, I was very unimpressed with this place and even less impressed with the staff. I will give a Westin a try next time around.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but why so expensive?”
Reviews.Author: FitToLive
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt 3 nights in early August '07 with our 2 teenage daughters and another family. We had requested early check-in and one of our rooms was ready, the other was not which was fine since we wanted to go to the pool anyway. When we did receive our room keys (to our kids' double bed room) we were very surprised by the size difference between their room and our King bed room. Our room was much smaller! However, the bathrooms are quite nicely sized and the decor (since it's all just been redone) was very nice. Both rooms had a very small balcony which looked partially over the gulf, nice view. The hotel was supposed to be undergoing renovation but we were not inconvenienced at all. The restaurant and fitness center were both open and although one building was having roof work done it was very quiet. Swimming pool is more of a cocktail pool since it is only 3 ft. to 4 ft. deep. Not a problem for us but might be for some. The beach area is very small (typical for Key West) and right off the pool. They have a nice floating swim/sunning platform there too. Location was great. One block off Duval and very close to the Waterfront area with shops, boating and restaurants. The expensive part - the restaurant prices were high considering the food was just OK. Fortunately we had free breakfast coupons or our breakfasts each day would have been around $60 to $70 for the 4 of us.. Lunch was also pricey and food was again just OK. Our rooms rates were $420 for the first night and $454 for the next two nights. You can stay at the Ritz on the Concierge Level for less than that! Not sure how they justify those rates since there really weren't any facilities offered at the Hyatt that wasn't offered at other nearby hotels. We expected a much more upscale hotel. Granted there has just been a major renovation so that may be the cause of these rates.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: IowaHawkeye
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Key West for our one-year anniversary at the end of July, and stayed at the Hyatt Key West Resort and Marina. They run a deal where you stay 3 nights, and get the 4th night free. The place is undergoing construction on their lobby, spa, exercise facility, and gift shop, but the noise/workers didn't bother us at all. We had a lovely room with a plasma TV, balcony overlooking the pool, and a rain-head shower. The pool and beach are on the small side, but it was never crowded, and both were a much-needed relief after the hot days. The Blue Mojito Bar served up some mean drinks - we liked the Dirty Banana and Mudslide - both tasted like ice cream milkshakes with a touch of alcohol. The location is a huge bonus! It is within walking distance to Mallory Dock, the beginning of Duval Street is a block away, and the Historic Seaport is just around the corner. The only downside to the facility was the housekeeping. We would come back from a long day at the pool wanting a made bed and fresh towels, and find that our room had not been cleaned yet. It was usually cleaned around 3:30 or 4:00 in the afternoon, which is getting a little late for our tastes. Other than that we had a fantastic stay. They offer parasailing at the beach dock so we did a tandem sail one morning (go in the morning as it is cheaper). As for Key West itself, the town is so relaxing and fun. I would highly recommend the following places/events: 1. Trails of Margaritaville tour - If you're a Jimmy Buffett fan, then you'll love this tour. It stopped at all of the bars Jimmy used to play at, including our favorite the Chart Room Bar at the Pier House Hotel, you get to see the recording studio where Jimmy recorded License to Chill, and it ends at Margaritaville Cafe. If you go, ask for Tim as your tour guide - he's awesome! 2. Fury Catamaran Commotion on the Ocean - This was a sunset cruise aboard the Fury Catamaran and it included the house band from Hog's Breath Saloon. The drinks flowed and the music was great. 3. Sunset at the Top - If you get tired of the crowds and heat at Mallory Dock, head up Duval Street to the Crowne Plaza Hotel (right next to Margaritaville Cafe) and go up to the top floor. They have a bar and a huge balcony where you can watch the sun set. Great views! 4. Historic Seaport - This was an overlooked part of Key West until a few years ago. We thought it was very cool with all of the bars, restaurants, and boats. Schooner Wharf Bar and Conch Republic restaurant are in this area and come highly recommended. 5. Restaurants - Key West has so many restaurants and bars, that it was hard to pick which we'd go to, but I'd say the following were our favorites. Rooftop Cafe (corner of Front Street and Duval) for elegant scenic dining, Croissants de France (farther up on Duval) for awesome crepes and breakfast sandwiches, Antonia's (on Duval) for great Italian food in a cozy and comfortable atmosphere, Blue Heaven (off Duval) for breakfast amongst the roosters, chickens, and cats, and Sloppy Joes. I know Sloppy Joes is a tourist trap, but we thought the food, atmosphere and drinks were second to none. If any of you are thinking about driving down, I'd highly recommend it. We flew into Fort Lauderdale and the trip was so relaxing and fun. I'd recommend stopping at Lor-E-Lei's for lunch and Robbies to feed the tarpon in Islamorada. On the way back, we had lunch at Sundowners in Key Largo and thought the water and views at Anne's Beach (bring your suits) were great. All in all an amazing vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Key West!!”
Reviews.Author: LittleWahini
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed five nights at the Hyatt Resort and Marina, and we both loved it. The updated rooms were gorgeous and cleaned spottless daily, the pool area and Blue Mojito Bar were fabulous and even though the beach area was small, the water was perfect! The service was impecable and the location can't be beat. The Hyatt Resort & Marina is just steps from the historic Marina, Duval Street and Mallory Square, but has all the peace and quiet of a secluded resort. There was construction going on in the lobby and the spa, but it did not bother us one bit. Also, there is a boat right there at the marina called the Floridays that does snorkeling trips and sunset cruises daily! Both are not to be missed! We cannot wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt = WOW!!”
Reviews.Author: tomw40
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I had to change our travel plans at the last minute :( so our travel agent at Cataract suggested the Hyatt in key west. We had both been to key west before and loved it! so we decided to try the Hyatt. To make this short and sweet the total package was awesome!!! bed was amazing view was great! tv and internet worked great bathroom was WOW all amenities were taken care of hair dryer iron in room safe etc. staff was great and friendly Sean the bartender was fantastic!! after staying in two different places in key west I truly recommend the Hyatt it is expensive but totally worth it!!

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Stay”
Reviews.Author: drums45
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful 4 day/3 night stay at the Hyatt Resort. We stayed in room 3402, a king bed room. It was large with a good view of the Gulf and Pool. It was quiet too. We loved the modern decor, the nice flat screen(LCD?) TV, and nice shower. Room service was fast. I recommend the french pressed coffee. Everyone from the front desk, concierge, Nicola Restaurant Mgr and staff were friendly and accomadating. The food was fresh and delicious. We had a blast! The concierge booked us on the Hyatt's sail boat which docks at the hotel (you can't beat this place for convienence) for an afternoon snorkel/sail. There are jet ski rentals, jet ski island tours,and parasailing available too. The boat and jet ski rentals were reasonalbly priced ( a deal, I thought) and the crew was a lot of fun. The pool and hot tub were well maintained and the bar at the pool was classy and comfy. We had a late afternoon flight out of KW and the hotel gladly gave us a late 1pm check-out and stored our luggage. We can't wait to return to KW and will certainly stay at the Hyatt Resort and Marina again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Wedding Experience”
Reviews.Author: KWBride
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt for 6 days during our wedding and everything at the Hyatt was perfect! Christy, the reservations specialist was an angel and handled all of our room blocks with a smile. the rates were reasonable for the beautifully renovated rooms and the decor and ambiance is sophisticated, yet laid back. perfect for small weddings, we had 80 guests attend our ceremony on the small beach area and in the marquesa room. the food was exceptional (get the filet/mahi duo) and the views are gorgeous. our guests loved the hotel too! service was great, minus one sourpuss at reception. by far, the best resort hotel on the island.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat this hotel in Key West”
Reviews.Author: beachbabymorristown
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Key West and I had no idea where to stay. I searched reviews on several hotels in the Keys and seen some good and some bad reviews of this hotel. I am pretty picky about where I stay and expect the place I stay to be very clean. I can tell you this is one of the best experiences I have ever had going somewhere in the blind. There is some construction going on here but not anything that would be bothersome to anyone. The rooms were immaculate! We got there at 12:00 pm and our room was already ready. I walked into the room and was amazed....the beds were heavenly, plasma tv, tile floors and the bathroom was the biggest I have ever seen in a motel room. The shower alone would probably hold 5 or 6 people! It had the newest shower head along with a shower massager and a bench inside to sit on. The pool is small and sometimes hard to get a chair but if you have patience usually within 30 min people are up and gone. The chairs all have pads and pillows for comfort. Hotel staff was very courteous and catered to our every need. Drinks are a little pricey but they are everywhere in Key West. Also the mahi mahi sandwich in the restaraunt is the best meal I had in Key West. There is not a big beach area for the beach lovers but this is a VERY convenient location for all the Duval St bars. Wouldn't stay anywhere else next trip to Key West!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Hyatt was awesome!!!”
Reviews.Author: jenndye
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt was the best part of our trip to Key West. The pool and the ocean right there by the bar with great drinks, great food and friendly bartendars is what it is all about when you travel to Key West. Lisa and Shawn were the best - thanks you guys!!! We traveled from one end of the island to Smathers Beach (which is beautiful) to the other sight seeing (you have to rent an electric car and see the island - its the best way to do it. Don't drive you have to pay to park everywhere!!) in our electric car and always ended up back at The Hyatt on Front Street because we wanted too. I wish they had this hotel with this staff everywhere I traveled. Also, this is the only hotel I have every been where I constantly saw the assistant manager (or any management) talking to the guests - ensuring they were happy, helping the staff or chatting to keep you company. I don't think this man ever went home. He was the best!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: vroberts
Reviews.Content: If you want location, you got it at the Hyatt Key West Resort and Marina. This hotel is right around the corner from Duvall Street. You do not need a car however the scooters that you can rent throughout the island looked like fun! My husband and I did not mind the walk on Duvall Street daily. The hotel is very clean, the staff is very polite. They are renovating the lobby however this did not deter from our experience at all. The Hyatt has a very small beach but if you have been to Key West, you will know that this is true for most hotels. There are great beaches within "scooter" distance. The pool and the pool bar are wonderful. I can't comment on the food at the hotel, we did not dine there at all as there were so many other places to eat on the island. Our room was waterview and recently renovated. It was very modern and clean. You have to check out the sunset at Mallory Square. Ask for Allen at Schooners Wharf which is right around the corner from the Hyatt . He will tell you where the webcam is so that you can call your friends or family at home and let them watch you as you relax and have a drink at any three of their happy hours. I would recommend this hotel highly if you want a great location to all the restaurants and night life that Key West has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous View!”
Reviews.Author: FLBayBunny
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in one of the deluxe oceanview rooms during our wedding weekend and we were thrilled with how trendy the room was and more importantly, how gorgeous the view was. The room was very expensive ($600 a night with tax) but for those looking to splurge to celebrate a special occasion, it's well worth it. I was a bit disappointed with the size of the room given it's price though (it was just slightly larger than a typical hotel room and smaller than the suites at the Westin, which are actually priced a hundred or so per night less than the Hyatt). Breakfast was terrific but lunch was average. The location just couldn't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice and great new rooms”
Reviews.Author: jencrocks
Reviews.Content: The company I worked for took us all to Key West as our holiday bonus. We stayed at the Hyatt Resort and Marina. I dont think there is a bad view in the entire place! (please see pics) Its location is within walking distance of everything...no need for a car or even a rented scooter unless you tire quickly. Duval is right there. Malory square is just the other way. We only used a taxi twice...to the airport and back. You can rent Jetskis/ski-dos right out front as well as parasail. The bar vends Excellent bloody marys and specialty drinks around a very nice pool with great cabanas. The shower took a minute to figure out---hot water didnt seem quite that hot to me--but the newly remodeled rooms were very clean and modern with a great Key West flare about them. Although you dont spend much time in your room while in key west, if it were to rain you would not regreat choosing this establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hyatt!”
Reviews.Author: DKCampbell
Reviews.Content: We stayed just one night at the Hyatt Key West Resort and Marina. They are just completing a huge renovation. As it was Easter weekend - we heard no construction and saw very little. Our room was fabulous. The view, furnishings, bedding and bath were wonderful. The hotel staff was courteous and our room was very clean. The reception area is temporarily relocated - but was of no inconvenience. The pool bar was great. The Easter Buffet was just OK. This Hyatt Hotel is a smaller property -and without some of the "extras" but we enjoyed the location, location, location!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location in Key West”
Reviews.Author: WTT_Tennis
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I decided to book a trip to Key West from December 26-January 2. We were very pleased with the location of the hotel. It is close to Duval Street which is well known for its restaurants and shopping. Upon arrival, the front desk was very friendly and offered us Champaign while they were processing our paper work. We found our room to be comfortable and clean (with the exception of a trail of small ants that must have found entrance to our room at the balcony door). We thought that we had an â€œupgradeâ€� when we were told we had an ocean/beach view. The beach was very small and was apparently home to three or four homeless people. While attempting to enjoy our balcony views, motorcycles or boat launches would often disrupt the peace. On New Yearâ€™s Eve, I even witnessed someone urinating and another person vomiting on the beach. If we were to go again, we would request a room overlooking the pool to avoid the unpleasant public views.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic for Weddings!”
Reviews.Author: MABF
Reviews.Content: We had our wedding at the Hyatt Key West resort and Marina and it was more than perfect! The Wedding coordinator/caterer (Ava) is exceptional, there is no need to be a "bridezilla" she will handle every last detail. Our guests are still raving about the meal, we chose the filet and mahi mahi combo...Delicious! The wedding cake(cakes by Joey & Paulie) was a work of art and it's included in the package... and for all those people who complain about small beaches... I suggest that you try Mexico,Hawaii ,The Bahamas etc... (They have great beaches). Key West is not known for it's beaches, it's a great "Island City" with Carribean flair. Key West is full of fun,excitement,romance and amazing sunsets that melt into the ocean. The little beach at the Hyatt fit our 60+ guests perfectly and the Marquesa room(all winows) with a wrap around balcony for our guests to watch the sunset and enjoy the ocean views was perfect for our reception. We had an unforgettable time with our family and friend's. If you are thinking about having your wedding or just vacationing at the Hyatt Key West Resort and Marina...Book now, I highly reccommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great break from the northeast”
Reviews.Author: 1of8
Reviews.Content: stayed her for 5 nights this month..i must say i was a bit skeptical when i heard there were renovations being done..with a 5th night free it seemed like a pretty good deal for a hyatt..we stayed in building 3 on the 4th floor..the room was terrific..new, clean, large with a great king size bed and balcony..don't pay extra for direct ocean front..you cannot see the sunset and many of those balconies are next to the exterior stairs..the property is close to everything..i would recommend renting bikes with baskets..they are cheap and you can get everywhere..the open air bar was terrific (my wife loved odie the parrot) but we passed on the restaurant..there are too many other good options around town and this one was always empty (not a good sign)..if you want a great beach pay the $20 for a ferry over to sunset key beach (worth it!)..the pool at the hotel was adequate..the gym was marginal..this hotel is about it's location..after a long day out around the area is was great to come back here for a drink shower and out again..staff was terrific especially the concierge..we were never bothered by construction but we did not sit around the hotel all day..we will definitely go back

Reviews.Title: “Nice, convenient, clean”
Reviews.Author: walkindoc
Reviews.Content: We were greeted warmly upon arrival, by courteous staff, and given a champagne welcome. The room (312)was recently renovated, modern, clean. Had a partial ocean view with balcony, which was nice. However, it overlooked a small, public beach frequented by hobos. Lots of vehicles coming and going all night with young, loud motors (many Harleys). Plus it had a public boat launch so we would awaken to the sound of Jet ski motors in the AM. If we go again, we will request a courtyard room because you still get partial view of the ocean from the courtyard rooms, and it will be quieter. Also, the renovation work will hopefully be completed soon, making it even nicer. The hotel was amazingly convenient, and walking distance to all the touristy stuff. We didn't even need a car. Pool was small and never got the full sun, so it was chilly in the shade. Nicola's restaurant was very good, but a bit expensive. Overall a great stay, at a decent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this place. Go to the Westin....”
Reviews.Author: ktojto
Reviews.Content: FIrst of all, we knew that the Hyatt Key West was going through a remodeling process before we arrived, but we were assured that the noise would be minimul during the day and would stop in the late afternoon. We were here on a business trip and had problems from the beginning. First of all, I was in my room unpacking and I heard a noise at the front door. As I approached the door, there was a repairman taking off the lock! I startled him when I approached the door and I asked him what he was doing? He asked me how I got in since the lock was broken. I told him that I used my key card and I got in fine, but he insisted that the lock could be broken into unless he replaced it. After several attempts at trying to make the new lock work, he gave up and I repacked, and he moved us across to the other side of the property to another room. This new room was not as well laid out. The TV was at an angle where you couldn't get a direct view from the sofa or from the bed. The air conditioning was so loud I couldn't sleep. The maid service was slow getting to our room everyday.stopping by our room late afternoon when we were trying to take a nap or get ready for the evening. Out of the 4 days we were there, she only cleaned the bathroom (not the bedroom area) once! I asked for shampoo and towels every day. For $425 a night, that was unacceptable. Also, the fitness center was a joke. They had 2 elliptical trainers, 2 treadmills and 1 cycle, and one rack of hand bar bells. Also, the equipment was old and needed servicing. I heard other guests complain to the receptionists, who were very nice throughout the browbeating they were taking from this one guest, who was livid about the condition of his room and quality of the food in the restaurant. He pretty much threatened her with the phrase " you know what you should do to fix this, don't you" . I felt badly for her, because those problems were not her fault. Hotels who refurbish their properties are probably better off closing down completely than to lose their reputation in the process. "Most" of the staff were very friendly and I don't fault them for the problems. I still say properties that undergo remodeling are better off shutting completely down while they are going thru this process as not to lose customers. We passed the Westin down a few blocks, and I would recommend this hotel over the Hyatt, at least at this juncture.

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay here again”
Reviews.Author: travels2much
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip to Key West in January of this year. My friends and I were very excited because I had stayed at a Hyatt in Washington, D.C. and EVERYTHING was incredible there. Sadly, our stay at the Hyatt Key West Resort and Marina was absolutely horrible! When we arrived, they did not have rooms ready for us and said it would be a few hours. Since we arrived at noon, that was understandable. The manager said we would be staying in brand new rooms that had just been completed. I specifically ASKED if there was construction going on in the building and Jon replied, "They are only painting." That was a total lie. We were awakened every morning between 7:00-7:30 a.m. of our stay to the sounds of drills, hammering and construction. There were construction people coming and going out of our rooms at all times. I came out of the bathroom one time (which is near the door) wrapped in a towel and saw the door shutting. I asked my friend rooming with me if someone was in our room and she had gotten up to investigate too because she heard the door open! Construction people constantly knocked on the door. They would always apologize saying, "Sorry, we didn't know anyone was in this room." The room itself was beautiful but not completed. The drain in the shower kept stopping up, the water was white (yes, white, we were told it wouldn't hurt us), there was a waterfall coming from the floor above over the balcony drenching the brand new furniture so we couldn't sit in it, there was no phone, there was a place for a refrigerator but no fridge. When we complained, we were told they could not move us because the hotel was booked for the boat races. Also, a very rude young lady at the desk, who should seek employment in another field - I think collections would suit her better - told us that because we booked our trip through a "discounter" (which is apparently the new name for "travel agent") they could not compensate us. An equally inept young man, said that we would need to TELL them what we wanted before they could do anything. I could not believe the stupidity of the staff. They gave us each a free drink voucher and a voucher for dinner at the restaurant. The dinner was wonderful, the experience at this hotel was not. Our "discounter" got us reimbursed for one night's stay but to be on a trip that you have looked forward to all year and end up staying at this - supposedly - top notch hotel and have all of these problems...well, I think you know how you would feel. It was simply not enough and the staff just did not care at all. No one would even apologize. Not all of the staff was worthless, though. The concierge we booked our snorkeling trip through was absolutely wonderful. So was the staff at the restaurant. I would never stay here again except maybe if there was a new manager and the front desk staff is fired, and the rooms are actually finished, it might be a decent place to stay. I'm already planning my next trip to Key West and I can assure you, I will NOT be staying at the Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: ftpjtm
Reviews.Content: We were underwhelmed. During our stay in October 2006 at least half of the hotel was closed for repairs from the hurricanes in 2005. Our room was OK, but considering the price it could have been better. The location is as good as it gets, but the hotel itself is showing wear - at least our room was. In the bathroom 1 sink had a slow drain, and the other a leaky faucet. The toilet didn't flush properly. The room and outdoor walls could have used a fresh coat of paint. The mattress was showing wear, compared to the Marriot hotel which we stayed in the night before in Daytona. I am really being overly critical, most would overlook what I am complaining about. I was just a little disappointed after reading all of the other glowing reviews, and after paying the high price. And the good news for future travelers is that the (not yet opened) renovated rooms looked much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: anniroz
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed for several days. We had been there before with my two daughters. Hotel staff was great even provided a wheelchair for us to use free of charge. Food was wonderful and they had free happy hour on Wed.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect.”
Reviews.Author: nowt2do
Reviews.Content: Key West is not just a place; itâ€™s a way of life. The atmosphere in this little island in the most southwesterly point of the USA is so unlike the rest of American. Itâ€™s chilled, itâ€™s relaxed, and itâ€™s like being in the Caribbean. The warm waters of the Gulf wash onto one shore, the Atlantic on the other side. Itâ€™s sunny, itâ€™s hot, and itâ€™s beautiful. The thing about Key West is that itâ€™s small, but you still want to be at the heart of the Island, somewhere near Mallory Sq for its infamous sunset celebrations, and somewhere by Duval Street for shopping and eating, but then again you want to be near the beach as well, so where to stay? Well I can happily say that if it were me, I would never, ever, stay anywhere but the Hyatt Key West Resort and Marina. This beautiful resort is located on Front Street, and is no more than a 2minute walk from Mallory Square, Duval Street and The Historic Marina. It has itâ€™s own private beach, which is small, but perfectly adequate for a bit of a sunbathe, building of a sandcastle or swim in the warm gulf out to the floating sunbeds. You also have a private marina where you can go on sunset cruises, snorkelling trips or out on Jet Skis. If you donâ€™t wana get sandy you can sunbathe on comfy sunbeds, with decent towels and good service by the pool and spa. A lovely little area to catch some rays and chill. There is everything else you could want from a top class hotel, a shop, bar, restaurant, and gym, but also little things that make this top hotel feel extra special, and fitting on the island. Terrapins in a pool and a McCoy parrot called Odie who sits on the trees by the beach. Itâ€™s strange, but staying at the Hyatt is a bit like staying at a friends, itâ€™s familiar and cosy and you feel like home, but itâ€™s something a bit different and special. You get everything youâ€™d expect from one of the worlds best hotel chains, but in a style completely in keeping with the island. The rooms are fabulous, with large balconies, unbelievable views of the sea and exceptionally comfortable beds. The colour scheme brings some quirkiness to the room, the massive flat screen TVs look cool, and the bathrooms are mind blowingly beautiful. The best bit is the proper robes, and the high-class toiletries, itâ€™s what you expect from a hotel like this, and youâ€™re not disappointed. This is a simply stunning hotel, in a perfect location, with fabulous staff, and everything you could ever want for a perfect trip to the Keys, why bother staying anywhere else, the Hyatt Key West Resort and Marina has it all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay Even With Construction”
Reviews.Author: miamimickey140
Reviews.Content: We live in miami and usually hit KeyWest a few times a year. Sonce were so close...normally we go for the day and drive right back. This time we wanted to stay and destress from the everyday work life.....This Hyatt delivered. We go there 8/26 for one night. What a night that was. The resort is going under some major construction...but it didnt bother us at all. The room was a remodled room with an ocan view. ROOM: Totally brand new. YOu feel like your at a contemporary chic hotel in NY. All modern furniture witha twist of the tropics. Also nice plasma TV. BATHROOM: Felt like you were at a spa. Shower was huge (you can fit 6 people in the shower) Also had a Rain Shower over head with some mood lighing. Fantastic. The products in the bathroom were also great. And you can buy them online. I think our one day trips to the Keys have now changed to a nice weekend getaway.......no reason to not stay here. Koi Pond was also a cute touch and while your checking in....ask for Turtle food and come to the turtle pond where you can feed at least 30 of these guys. Enjoyed it and cant wait to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Resort the best”
Reviews.Author: cadipat2001
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Hyatt 2-3 times a year and love it. My husband and myself had an ocean front balcony overlooking ODIE and the beach. It was beautiful. We are coming back for Fantasyfest and hope to get another oceanfront room. At that time there was no ongoing noise but when we were leaving the pool renovations started, so we planned our vacation for the right time. See you in October, hurricanes permitting again. Patricia

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed from June 2-5th. Wonderful place with wonderful people. Construction was going on and the pools were closed. Lots of noise and workers everywhere. We were given access to pools at the neighboring properties, which was fine. We got to stay in one of the newly renovated rooms in Building 3 with a wonderful view of the Gulf of Mexico from our balcony. The food and drinks at Nick's were top notch. Breakfast, especially was wonderful, if a bit pricey. Overall 4/5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hyatt and Key West”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hyatt Key West Resort and Marina from May 15th to May 21st. We had a wonderful time. This is our second trip to Key West and second stay at this hotel. We are planning a future trip for 2008, and wouldn't dream of staying anywhere else. Our room was beautiful. It was very airy with many windows, and we had a wonderful view of the Gulf from our balcony. Half way through our trip, we figured out that the best place to watch the sunset was actually at the hotel. We went to Mallory square for a couple of sunsets, but Sunset Key blocked the full view. The view of the sunset was fantastic from the hotel. Hotel staff were very friendly and accommodating. My husband went on a fishing trip and brought back fish for us to eat. The chef at Nicola fixed the fish for a very reasonable price and it was absolutely delicious. We went on a jet ski tour, that was offered at the Hyatt and had a great time. Key West is a great place to visit and the Hyatt is a wonderful hotel. My husband and I can't wait for our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Please read if you have reservations!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked our vacation in January. Six days in a four star hotel. We arrived 6pm on Tues. March 21st to discover scaffolding above the turtle pond (building 2). Weds morning around 9am we woke up, opened the curtains to our balcony and there was a construction worker sitting on our balcony. The scaffolding was now at our 3rd story level. There were saws and grinders and hammer drills going all day long. One morning the workers were grinding bolts off of our balcony wall at 8:30am. Our room was actualy shaking and a crack appeared in the wall. When we checked with the people in the lobby, they said we were sent a letter(which we never received) stating that the hotel was under renovation and it would be going on the Mon thru Fri 9am until 5pm. We could not sit at the pool, because the construction workers were sawing off the balcony guard rails on building 3. They also did this work Saturday and Sunday. I can not explain how loud this was. We asked to move to building 1 where there would be no more people on our balcony even though we would still hear the noise. They would not move us. We asked to check out early, they said there would be an early check out penalty(besides during spring break its not easy to get another hotel) We asked for some sort of discount, but were turned down. The lobby personell did not seem to care about us. We came here with a wedding party of over 20 people. The hotel basically ruined it. I have a call in to the main Hyatt Customer Service Center and spoke with a lady named Elaine. I will give an update when I hear back from her. I was told the heavy construction would be going on for 2 more months. The hotel is really tore apart and doesn't look like the pictures on the internet. I just wish I would have read this review before I spent thousands of dollars on my "dream vacation" I do have photos of the workers on our balcony, but without my son here, I am not sure how to add them to this review.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading other reviews I am glade I stayed before seeing this site reviews send mixed emotions. My stay was great room was well maintained, air conditioning worked great and was close to downtown. The cost per night was a little much but it was during Fantasy Fest and everything was booked. Overall enjoyed stay and will stay again

Reviews.Title: “Great location but definitely not worth the $$$”
Reviews.Author: EAM
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with some of the reviews here that the Hyatt was not upto our expectations especially for a 4star hotel. The rooms were average, although the little balcony was nice and we did have a great view of the pool and the gulf (partial gulf view room). The hotel is on Front street, very close to everything (shops, restaurants, museums, water activities) which is a big plus. I was disappointed with the service because almost everyday we had to call the front desk to request for tea and coffee supplies since housekeeping never refilled those in the room. Finally the 3rd day I left a note for housekeeping requesting supplies. I was surprised, since we have stayed at 2 and 3 star hotels and even they have been very good about these things. The pool was small and always crowded - we never got to sit by the pool. The restuarant was pricey so we never tried it although they did have a Christmas day breakfast buffet which was pretty good. A few days into our stay, we noticed a promotion offer valid for limited time (including the days that we stayed at the hotel), at the lobby, which stated that if we booked using AAA membership, we were entitled to free daily breakfast. My husband had used his AAA code while booking. However when we asked the hotel about this they said that we were not entitled to the said offer since the appropriate boxes on the booking had not been checked. We had made the reservation 6 months back when the offer was not even displayed on the website. We were very unhappy with the way the management totally denied us something that we were entitled to. Anyways, we actually found this restaurant called Bistro 245 at the nearby Hilton hotel which was right by the water and had amazing buffet breakfasts (omelets, waffles, scrambled eggs, bacon, sausages, potatoes, fruit, cereal, croissants, yogurt and more) for only $12.95. So we ate there almost every day that we were there. All in all, we did not get value for our money, were disappointed with the Hyatt, and would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but not worth Cat 4 points or $$$”
Reviews.Author: vmonk
Reviews.Content: I'm normally very satisfied with Hyatts but we're just back from the Hyatt Key West (401 Front Street) Dec 2005 and it REALLY should not be considered a Category 4 by Hyatt. We were told we were upgraded to one of the best rooms & views in the resort (I'm a Diamond level member with Hyatt). Even then, we found there was little walking room with the 2 double beds making the room very crowded, a tiny balcony, everything needed updating (bathrooms, etc.), a/c is via a noisy wall unit...the pool area was tiny and crowded, there's no RC and the breakfast was pretty meager. We did have a partial gulf view which was nice. I'm guessing the location is the main reason for the high rating, but given the lack of resort level accommodations and amenities, I don't feel this hotel meets Cat 4 standards and wouldn't pay the $300+ rate we found online. I'd read other reviews on various web forums and found many others were disappointed in this Cat 4. My expectations were already lowered by their feedback, but I was still very disappointed by the hotel. By the way, the staff was very friendly and accommodating and this is in no way a reflection upon them. The tourist areas of Key West are small so you can walk almost anywhere. We did have ants in the bathroom as others have mentioned in previous postings, but it wasn't an infestation so we didn't bother the front desk about it.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Hyatt Key West Timeshare”
Reviews.Author: VeryUnhappyGuests
Reviews.Content: My wife and I paid a $475 deposit for a four night stay at the Kew West Hyatt Timeshare resort to be used the first week of November (Meeting of the Minds). Hurricane Wilma went through our community in Southwest Florida and damaged our business, additionally, it devistated the Miami and Keys with power outage, flooding and curfews. We called to cancel our stay, as wee needed to attend to our business and could not go and we were very concerned about the conditions and lack of power and gas for a trip to Key West, but were told by the Hyatt organization (located in Illinois) that it is beautiful there and nothing is wrong in Key West. All major news organizations report a completely different situation. Many areas in Key West, the lower Keys and Miami are still without power, water and gas. They refused to give us our money back, I called four times, was put on hold for a "supervisor" three times and waited in excess of 15 minutes, each time the phone was never answered. The fourth time a supervisor answered and told me he needed approval from his supervisor, and would call me no later than 24 hours later (Friday, Oct 28 at 5pm). They did not call forcing me to fill a complaint with the State of Florida and State of Illinois. This is the last thing that I expected from a Hyatt resort. I was treated rudely, lied too, made false promises and disrespected. I would urge anyone considering investing in a timeshare with Hyatt to look at another organization such as Marriott to purchase their vacation home. I am not even an investor but a prospective investor, and this is how they treat you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great staff, Great local, Great food, GREAT!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: joecaDublin
Reviews.Content: I dont care what the other reviews say, the hotel & staff and everything else was absolutly top notch. This is a five star hotel. Great to relax and chill. We will be going back next year. Well done Casa Marina!!!!

HotelInfo.Name: Hyatt Key West Resort and Spa
HotelInfo.Address: 601 Front Street, Key West, FL 33040
